text: the concept is awesome.  the energy is very much alive.  the market does fit well with the area.  The issues - the prices are way out of whack for the amount of product, quality and over all presentation.  It's like an airport, they have a captive audience, no other options close by, so they gouge you on price.  the only difference, there are a lot of places to buy natural food in a fun atmosphere at much lower cost's.  we'll continue to walk around, socialize, but were're not buying until prices are equalized.

Horrible experience. We didn't get anything we ordered. Ordered grits, got hash browns. No explanation until we asked why. Ordered avocado omelette, no avocados. Ordered baked breakfast sandwich, got disgusting bacon on dry toast with no sauce (there was supposed to be Gruyiere with a Mornay sauce. Then the checks were split amongst my party and the diners who ordered the same things, got different bill amounts. And we aren't feeling great afterwards. Avoid

This place has a very quiet, local feel to it, despite being flooded with tourists. We came on a Friday afternoon before St. Patrick's Day, and was it packed outside. There was a group of maybe 10 waiting and other groups of 2-4 waiting on the street. The hostess was very polite and helpful, but we ended up waiting close to 1.5-2 hours for a table of 3. 

The decor of the place gives the similar vibe when you arrive - it feels very homey and welcome. The staff was a bit slower with service and not too attentivie to me patiently waiting to put our order down or get the check - understandable since it's so busy, but can still be improved. I had the crab meat omelette and it was alright at best, but not worth the wait or the price. My friend liked his bananas foster french toast, so possibly I should have ordered the other recommended items.

What really made this experince a 2 star as opposed to a 3 star was the staff messed up our check. We waited 10 minutes to finally get their attention to send the check over, only to have the bill twice the actual price. I'm pretty certain the check was meant for the table of 5 next to us, so I'm sure they were happy getting a $35 bill. There wasn't really a sense of urgency in getting the check out of the way, which might have explained the extremely long wait to get into the restaurant. 

Maybe we came on a bad day, maybe I ordered the wrong item, and maybe the waiter was new. Either way, I wouldn't recommend this place despite the high reviews. Unless there's no wait, you will probably have a better experience elsewhere.

My doctor is good, but every time I'm actually sick, even for a chronic condition that only requires a refill, dealing with their staff is a nightmare. I've been misdiagnosed by a PA, hung up on while a receptionist was fighting with her significant other on the phone for choosing the 'emergency' line during an emergency, and denied a prescription causing me needless suffering and multiple phone calls. If you aren't able to help me when I'm sick, why are you my doctor?

They know how to cook chicken.  It was juicy and tasty. I didn't get the Cajun spice, but it was good.  
The beans and rice had a heavy pork flavor. 
The biscuits small and flat.  
Service was quick.  High turn over chain, in and out.  
No vegan options.

Lowes' systems and customer service are dysfunctional.  In summary: on day of delivery at 2pm (after fridge is empty awaiting new one), we get an email indicating a 3 week delay.  After that, another delay (over 1 month all together).  When the delivery occurred, they would not install the stove (claiming Lowes didn't tell them I paid for the install).  I email customer service and they respond to Dan (that's not my name) about a Google device (that's not my issue).  In summary, I shopped the store for about a month, trying to spend money, and they screwed up about 8 times in a short period.  Lowes is an appropriate name: Low customer satisfaction, Low accuracy of meeting commitments and Low on my list of places I'll be spending money.

Suddenly it's much less clean, well stocked and the pasta is over cooked.  Last month the soda machine had mold behind the nozzles.  Today it's worse. 
Sadly we've been enjoying eating at this location for the last 8 years and never seen it like this.  The Alfredo sauce was chunky with spiral pasta yellow from being over cooked. Lights are missing or going out, so it's dim. Ceiling tiles are swollen and discolored from moisture. Lastly, the tables are sticky. Worst CiCi's experience ever.

Food quality and taste are mediocre. Veal parm was bland and tasted like dry, fried breading. Marinara sauce was tasteless. Dover sole was served full of bones. Second similar experience here, several years apart. There will not be a third.

The only reason why the rating isn't lower is that dinner (in person) at Tre Lune can be a really nice experience. The service and food quality can be top notch.

Ordering take out is another experience altogether.

Sure ordering for pickup automatically excludes us from getting a level of service that is often expected from a Montecito restaurant but we didn't realize that ordering takeout also meant that we would be subject to huge swings of food quality/consistency. After all isn't food quality the one thing that a restaurant can exhibit huge amounts of control over?

The latest takeout experience involved ordering Garganelli with chicken and mushrooms. One order excluded the chicken and the other order assumed that we would enjoy having the chicken added as an after thought - on top of the dish as if it were an over easy egg. We have pictures of the incredibly appetizing meal (being facetious of course) but there doesn't appear to be a way to post those while writing this review. Keep in mind the cost of the meal is the same for takeout or dine in.  The same price applies even when no chicken or mushrooms are added.

Our advice - don't order takeout at Tre Lune.  If you are in pinch and find yourself looking over the menu, then place your order and clear your calendar just in case you need to stick around the restaurant while your dish is being remade the correct way.

PS. And no, these are not the only examples.  There are others but clearly we didn't learn our lesson and continued ordering.  The last experience may have sealed the deal for a long while.

Your restaurant wasn't busy I work in fast food and I know what  what busy is your employees are slow as shit 20 mins for 2 orders get them in check or fire them all of these people on here have bad reviews of this location do something about it
Nice view but just recommended drinks.  Chips are stale and soft tocos fell apart, not fresh food.  Go some where else to eat

Let's just start with this, I am absolutely devastated for my former co-workers that got all laid off last night. Cliff decided to completely screw them all over and just close the restaurant without former notice and some didn't even know they were not coming back. I worked my ass off for that place about 6 days a week, made sure to do my job and I had believed in that place. The owner Cliff fired me for no reason and accused me I find out later on for things I didn't do. They were terrible owners and I hope that you all do not go and support Barrel house. I am appalled at the way I was let go as I'm sitting there rolling silverware working my butt off for owners who completely didn't appreciate all the work I did for them. I have kept my mouth shut since I got let go. That was an amazing staff there and the fact that he did this to all of them there is absolute crap. What a selfish human being. Please don't let one penny go to this man. I'm livid to see that staff hurt and jobless because he didn't have the guts to do it properly.

Wow. Waited forever for the food just to get a half full bowl of seafood gumbo for $9+. There was barely any seafood. Didn't see a single sausage as advertised lol. Waste of money. Would not recommend. What a rip off. My friend got the okra gumbo and it came out cold...after she waited even longer than I did. I should have checked the reviews before I decided to eat here. Shame on me. Gumbo was ok but for what you pay it's a complete sham. Paid .50 extra for crab thinking I was getting crab meat. They threw in a crab leg...Find somewhere else to eat. STAY FAR AWAY

Curb side pick up. Ordered the standard burger and a classic burger. They gave us 2 plain cheeseburgers with NOTHING ELSE ON THEM!! No bacon, no pickles, no lettuce, no tomato, no onion, no condiments. If I wanted a plain cheeseburger I would have gone to McDonalds and spent a lot less. Very disappointed.

My first stop on my first visit to Armature Works, and I was tempted by the Chicharrones on their appetizer menu, being the addict that I am to this Cuban crispy crunchy juicy fatty delectable morsels of pure yumminess. If you have this weakiness like I do, don't fullfill it here, as you will be sadly disappointed. There was no crispy crackling skin, and merely skinless seasoned pork belly dropped in to the deep fryer and fried to a dark brown color. The only things good were the sauces served with it, which were a spicy habanero based one they called Cuban fire water and an avocado sauce to cool the palate a tad. The servers were friendly and attentive, for which I gave two instead of one star. With all the choices of food at this venue, I probably would try others before I gave this one another try.

This tasting room was recommended, cool scene but terribly aloof and pretentious. Poured the wines and never came back and out of 2 flights only 2 wines were local! What's the point of coming here? Had such better experiences pretty much everywhere else!!! And the wines were not good, local or otherwise!

My partner and I had one of our first dates at the original Santa Fe in the Marigny, so it has long held a special place in our hearts. We love sitting outside on the patio. However, after a series of lackluster visits, I think we're done here. Too many other good options in town. Tonight, our glasses ran and stayed dry, and I actually had to leave my table and head for the kitchen to try to find basic condiments for my now-cold dinner (even after asking a server). And the place wasn't that busy--the inside was almost deserted. I hated to cap off what otherwise was a really great day in New Orleans with this disappointing experience. It won't happen again.

Overpriced. We ordered Cajun jambalaya, side of potatoes and seafood gumbo. Sizes are so small. Paid $28+ for all these three items. It is like a tasting. I can't even call that it was a full dish. Avoid this place at all costs. Side of potatoes were $4.50 alone and you can see the size in the picture.
Awful service burger was raw when asked to be medium well. Waitress was rude dropped the food ran away dropped the check ran away. They werent even busy. Go some where else.

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE. I called this company to get an estimate and see if they could help with my move and the sales associate would not give me a quote nor speak with me until I assured him the weight of my items. He was aggressive in his tone and hung up on me. I, myself, work in customer service and am an extremely cheerful person. This was a terrible experience. Never calling again.

I was in mainland this past week with my family and let me just say it was awful. My food was cold and tasted like it was reused from previous days... I didnt mention anything bc the older blonde haired lady..I'm guessing the manager seemed very stand offish and rude. I overheard her calling her employees idiots and incompetent to another employee so I decided to not bother complaining. The food was 1000 times better in previous years and the menu now is nothing but fat bar food. Bring your old staff back who actually brought ppl in with their cooking annd vibes.. 2 thumbs down...keep trying though..
Terribly slow service, wobbly table, and enough onions in everything we ordered to gag a buzzard on a gut truck.........

I hadn't had KFC in a long time and had the itch so I walked in here one day recently and got a bucket of chicken, and first thing I thought, was "When did the buckets of chicken get so small, especially for the price?" Oh, KFC still rocks so it may be worth it, yes?

Well I got home and start eating, and first thing I thought was "When did KFC start tasting so NASTY?"  Maybe it's just this location, but no matter - it tasted awful and won't be doing KFC anymore.

I'd rather go to Publix where you get a box of much better tasting chicken, where you get just as much chicken, if not more..  For roughly half the price.  $7.99 at Publix for an 8 piece mixed box.  2 breasts (and they're huge), 2 legs, 2 wings, 2 thighs.  Trust me - much better option if you want some quick fried chicken where you can just grab and go.

KFC....  YUCK.  Overpriced crap.

Shame they've seemingly gone so far downhill..  Used to eat KFC all the time years ago and loved it, but no more.
Steaks are ok but pricey.  The bisque was terrible.  Bread was good.  Haven't been back.

The cashier was too busy visiting with manager and the other associate.  She never greeted me and then walked away to do whatever it is she was doing while conversation and ignoring me and the others in line.  She proceeds to ring me up not a single word and then proceeds to clean the floor.  No receipt and me just standing there.  I finally say, "are we done here?" Never got my receipt.  Terrible service.  Visit on your own time ladies.  To the manager who said, "I need to put my eyebrows on so I am not scary"  your customer could care less how you look we just want friendly service and not to be ignored.

So I walk in there's and there's three people at the bar. I set down and the bartenders on the other side of the bar I sat there for a few minutes and two guys came in and she came over and served them beers got them menus. The bartender then proceeds to check on a table and get their checks and bring them up and ring them up right in front of me at the cash register. I thought maybe she say something then. Nope takes the change back over to the table comes back stops at the two guys on the other side of me asking if they want another beer (one stool between me and them). Turned around and walked across in front of me and proceeded to go back and check her phone.  I should have known when there's only a dozen or so cars in the parking lot at 6 o'clock in Indy that this place was definitely hit and miss. Needless to say I'm heading out to the next restaurant and won't be back.

Sub quality pub food. Nachos were disgusting. Booths were dirty and waitress was rude. It's a shame because this would be a great little spot. I love dive bars so long as the food is on point and unfortunately this place falls short.

Terrible experience!!!! We went through the drive thru and ordered 2 burgers and the guy had us pull forward to give us "fresh burgers". He said it would be 4 minutes and we waited 10 mins. We had a crying baby in the car and were ready to just leave but we'd already paid $26 for 2 burger combos (that's ridiculous for fast food burgers...). When they finally brought our food out, they gave us fries instead of onion rings that we paid extra for. It was not worth the hassle of going back in to get it right because we needed to take our child home. But that's ridiculous. We will NOT be coming back. Brentwood residents DONT GO HERE!

I haven't gone here in about 6 months, but I've been coming here since they opened. We ordered some takeout today and noticed things have changed. The prices have risen, the portion sizes have dramatically decreased (containers of steamed rice and beef with broccoli were only two thirds full!), and the food quality has also declined. We will no longer be eating here because of this.

Very disappointed with the service my coworkers and i had yesterday from your establishment especially from the manager Linda. My coworker reserved an area for a retirement/birthday and was told there was going to be another party of only 6 ppl apparently they were going to watch the band (by the way not worth it) As i arrived to my group, about a half an hour later, we were told that we needed to clear off our area bc of the other party which the management told her was only going to be 6 ppl and that by the time their party arrived my party was going to be a lesser crowd to at least be settled for one table at the corner. Well that was not the case, so we were rushed by Linda ( which she clearly said let me help here and  clear to get them out) to be put at the tiki tables that was already occupied by a gentlemen and she tells us to get him out of the table....Clearly very POOR service AND Managenent by Linda!!! Our waiter was the only employee that was very nice and was trying to keep us happy (even though too late) so i can't complain about him. 

The appetizers are very overpriced (not out of this world) and my piña colada was watered down and overpriced as well.

My agency has been devout costumers many times in the past reserving for happy hours!  This incident has completely ended our choice to come here anymore.

For anyone planning on bringing their beloved pets to this location or for that fact the brand of Veterinarians.  Please use your money elsewhere.  They had not disclosed that because my cat (best friend) Stella was over weight that there may be complications.  Very long story short, Stella never woke up from surgery when this was "suppose" to be "routine" surgery.  They had killed my best friend and did not disclose the proper information.  I would have not had the surgery if there was a good chance this may happen.  Now I go to pick up the cremated remains of my cat and the inconsiderate a**holes that work there had given me the wrong cremation box.  This box had sat on my table for a few hours since I was working and I finally am glad to get home and have some closure to my loss.  How can you let that happen?? How are you going to be that inconsiderate about a very sensitive situation and let this happen?  Not even an apology!  I really need to let everyone know to let this place go out of business one day and let Professionals deal with the life of your loved pet.

Okay so I never write reviews but... I visited butcher and bee this past Saturday and thought it was a great atmosphere and menu. First things first, the bartender was extremely rude. Secondly, I ate the lamb meatballs (which I thought tasted funny) and proceeded to get severe food poisoning within 5 hours. I have a pretty solid stomach and it was horrible. No one else I was with had the meatballs and no one else got sick so it seems like a fluke but I don't think I would visit again.

This place was extremely disappointing!
First, they pointed us to a dirty table,and they didn't give us napkins or silverware! When they brought out the coffee they didn't bring anything to go with it, or ask us if we wanted anything with it like sugar, or milk!
We even had to ask for silverware and napkins! For the food every one of us had something missing that they said came with the meal! We had to ask them repeatedly to bring the items that we ordered! This is not a repeater!

I'm not exactly sure how this place is getting such good reviews. Besides the fact that the staff was kind...I ordered guacamole and chips, a chicken taco, and a beef taco. The guacamole was old and bland...it literally tasted like nothing, the chips super oily and tasteless, the tacos were cold. The chicken had a odd taste...possibly nutmeg? Not sure but it wasn't for me. I prefer more spice/heat for my tacos. The beef was also cold and didn't have a good taste. I could of done better with an Old Elpaso taco kit from the grocery store. I'm sad that I wasn't pleased. But maybe it was just me because at least 4 "soccer mom types" were waiting in line for pickup??

Update* The owner Ben has reached out to me and offered an apology and a refund. That means a lot. Thanks Ben and good luck to you with the continued success of your eatery.

This place went downhill really fast. The long waiting time for a simple order, and really unclean conditions make this place not worth going to. I used to love to go here but after a while I stopped due to the things I listed at the beginning of this review. I was completely disappointed. The fries at many times were either soggy or burn, and the burger had no flavor. That's all I want to say, thank you for your time.
We ordered two different variety and both were semi dry ( although description says creamy).  No crusty cheese - just awful pre-made toppings.  I will not be going again ever!

Bought a tres leches cake.  I'm about to eat it 30 min after I left and I find out it's spoiled.  No expiration date on package.  I live far enough that it wasn't worth going back for a refund.  Won't be going back.
Terrible place.  My lashes were put on incorrectly and caused a horrible reaction.  I had to see a dermatologist and opthamologist for the infection.  Stay far away from this place!

I've been wanting to try Livery for a while, and finally went last night with a Bachelorette party. What a disappointment! We had a reservation for 9 PM but our table wasn't ready. No big deal, we headed to the bar and ordered drinks. Our table opened up at 9:25 so we were good to go! Our server took our food orders first since we all still had drinks at that time. Around 10 we didn't have any food yet, and it started to rain so we quickly moved inside. They had a large table available that was able to fit all but 3 of us. So we just stood for about 15 Mins until I finally asked our server if they intended to bring us chairs so we could sit when our food came. They brought us seats and we squeezed in at the table. At 10:20 one of our guests asked the server for a drink refill - because in the 55 minutes she had been our server, she never ONCE asked if we wanted more drinks!! She took her order and started to walk away! I waved her back and said, I think our whole table would like to order drinks. Our appetizers were finally served at 10:25. An hour after we had been seated. Our drinks didn't come until 10:40... 20 Mins after we ordered them. Our dinner was not served until 11:05! Then those of us with skirt steak had the smallest little portions, and it was drowning in oil and butter. We only had a few bites because it was so oily. So... bachelorette party. Two hours for late night dinner service. Server only got us one round of drinks more than an hour after we sat down... completely killed the mood of the party! We had been at Tastings beforehand and had the most amazing service, incredible fun, and Livery brought the whole night down. We had 13 people to start... only 4 ended up continuing the party. The rest of us were sleepy and sober by then. We will not be back.

Hubs and I went to eat and grab a drink last night at about 8 maybe. Wasn't too busy, normal amount of people. Our blonde waitress gave us menus and I ordered a beer to start and my husband said "I'll have a water to start while I decide what else I want." She brought my beer and never came back. She was literally 5 feet from us eating food, joking with customers, even making eye contact with me while I was holding up the menu. & nothing.. about 20 mins went by and she walked past us to go out to smoke. That's when we just had to go to the bar and pay for the beer and leave. We couldn't believe it.

be careful    be very careful    do your homework    they present you with a price list for options    a sheet of paper that has their heading on it      it looks very official    it is not   it has the prices increased from the Honda retail prices     are you kidding me    retail is not high enough   buyer beware  very aware  sorry

If you are looking for a cheap sushi place to eat I suggest only going for lunch or dinner. A couple of friends and I decided to try this place out regardless of the bad reviews. I can't describe how horrible the service was. It was a Saturday night with a few tables being served and only ONE server. I ordered the dinner special which included the miso soup which tasted like sewer water. The rolls themselves were not great but not the worse. Unless I am feeling cheap I will never return to this restaurant again.

The first time I went to pita jungle was in Phoenix. They had an amazing jalapeño cilantro hummus. It had lots of spice. The next time we went to the one in northwest Tucson. The jalapeño cilantro hummus was bland. We got a falafel and a salad. Surprisingly none of it had any flavoring. The salad tasted like lettuce with oil.

ambiance 7/10
service 7/10
softshell crab Po' boy   2/10 essentially felt like bread crumbs in bread sandwich.
sea food gumbo: 1/10
fried okra: 2/10
wings: looked fine. I did not have them though.
corn bread: 1/10
paralines: 2/10

I am a REGULAR Dunkin go-er and this location is absolutely awful. I repeated my order 4 times, the guy taking my order was mumbling and kept saying they didn't have things I was ordering but then suddenly would say "oh yeah we do nevermind", we waited in line for 36 minutes, got to the window, the girl at the window stood and glared at us before opening the window, we finally got out food and none of it was correct. We got 3 things we didn't order and didn't get any of the 4 items we did order. They charged us incorrectly and when (god forbid) we asked for ketchup packets and politely what took so long in the drive thru line, she rolled her eyes and said "were busy". Alrighty then... won't be returning.

We really wanted to like this place... hidden in the neighborhood, outside patio, promise of craft cocktails, under new management.... Unfortunately the service was nonexistent, the food was eh, and the menu was typical with odd (not good) twists throughout. We won't be back.
I love the atmosphere, but the tacos are so damn greasy.  Our order takes forever.  This time the grease was just way too much.  I won't ever go back.

I was advised Joey's pizza had good New York style pizza. Went there on Friday with high expectations only to be disappointed. I hate the pizza when you bite the end and the entire crust slides off the  Pizza. I ended up throwing the whole thing away. Don't know if it was cooked too fast or too hot but the cheese slid right off. Will not go back
Sitting in the downstairs bar and they refuse to close the door. It's freezing out and 60 degrees in the restaurant. They don't care people are walking out because it's cold
Very loyal customer, here almost every week. All the TVs in the entire hotel have gone out and management isn't doing anything about it!! Very poor customer service.

Ok let me start by saying love the vibe and the people working there now with that being said the pasta was inedible.  Italian food is my favorite and I  have never has anything quite like that.  The pasta was spaghetti  and when you would pick up a noodle the entire thing was stuck together is was like a pile of chewing gum.  It's as simple as learning how to boil noodles!

I wanted to try a new nails salon and my coworker referred me here. I walked in right before I noticed them locking the door behind me. Shortly after they started turning people away and I found out that they were expecting a wedding party. They'd promised them that they would shut down the shop when they came but they're about ten people including myself who were already in the shop. The bride began fussing and accusing the nail shop of lying about their agreement. So they pulled all of the nail techs together to get the bridal party started and called the waxing lady to do my nails. Needless to say she totally messed up my nails from the acrylic application to the filing process. When it was time to polish, a guy came to polish and basically noticed how messed up my acrylic was and had to refile all of my nails. He annoyingly kept trying to get me to spend more money on other products and services that I wasn't interested in even though I told him I didn't want anything. It was an overall annoying experience and I'm STILL not satisfied with the way that my full set turned out. Won't be going back.

Have been driving to Grays from Indy for years.  Haven't been there in a few months and was so disappointed.  Got carry out.  Chicken livers were over-cooked, dry and had no flavor.  Mac and cheese was more like pasta soup.  Pasta was in a watery, soupy liquid that barely tasted like cheese.  Green beans had no flavor at all.  Got a piece of pie that was horrible.  Staff in carry out was not friendly.  Don't know what happened but hope they go back to the friendly place it used to be with fantastic tasting food.  So very disappointed!

This is hands down the WORST Popeyes I've EVER been to. The lady at the register was loud and ghetto. She spent over 5 mins tryin to refund a $1.00 item for a man instead of having a manager do it. I ended up leaving since i had two kids and 4 hours still left on my drive. This lady is unacceptable as an employee and was very argumentative, loud, and rude to the previous customers, but the extremely long wait due to incompetence was ridiculous. Drive ANYWHERE else but here for food
Came here for breakfast and had the blueberry muffin and breakfast potatoes. The breakfast potatoes were not crisp and had no seasoning so I would not recommend. The blueberry muffin was good

To start, as the photos prove when I walked in the beds were very not well made and it didn't make me want to stay here. It looked as though the cleaner just threw the blanket back over and they were lumpy and didn't look nice. 
Not only that- where they claim the beds are queens they were definitely no bigger than doubles. Very hard for two people to sleep in a bed. 
My room on the 7th floor was right beside the elevator so it was loud all night and I mean right by the elevator. 
When I went to shower- the shower looked as though somebody had recently showered and I didn't get to the hotel until 11:00pm ... it was wet and there was hair ... 
my keurig machine when I opened it in the morning to make a green tea had an old smelly coffee from the last guest in there 
Then wen I called for a car service and the hotel says they provide that I wanted for the morning the woman at reception said the car service doesn't start until 4:00pm ... so it's more of an evening. At service then a day or morning car service . What good is it in the evening when I need to get to places and meetings in the morning ? 
The only thing that saved this place is the continental free breakfast as they aren't your typical one with waffles and pancakes - they have eggs Benedict etc.

If i could give this place 0 stars I would. I've tried this place 3 times but never again. They have nasty attitudes. They never seated us we had to ask if we can be seated, served sushi with clearly old fish, and once i got it MY FOOD HAD HAIR IN IT. Then they literally put a spoonful of salt at the bottom of my drink!! wtf is that who does that! Every time i asked for a frozen drink i just got a drink with ice cubes in it!  Never coming back to this place again!!!!

Food is decent. Waiters were awesome. -2 stars because of the manager (Adam?) who was a total prick. 

We had a party of ~15 and had just finished dinner. Just as we had the credit card/bill returned for signature, he came out of nowhere and rudely told us to hurry up because there was apparently a party that had waited an hour at the bar for our table. What's your deal man?

1) We had just received the credit card/bill for signature. We weren't just occupying the table for no reason.
2) There was no prior indication that he needed the table back. Why not give us a 20 minute heads up? Nobody would have taken issue with that. And how were we supposed to know that people were waiting at the bar? That's not our damn job - isn't that what Adam gets paid to do? Do your job bud.
Didn't realize it took 1 hour to make and delivery a sandwich that was 10 minutes away. Jimmy johns should be sued for using a slogan like Freaky Fast because that absolutely false advertising

Had the worst meal ever at PJ's in Oaks.
Ordered a burger. What a disappointment.  I've had better burgers at fast food restaurants. It was dry and over cooked. It looked like a frozen patty from Sam's club.
Won't be returning.

It looks like it was once a four star hotel and has slowly been run down over time to the point where now it is sad and disgusting! Uncomfortable beds, bad pillows, gross carpet, gross walls, etc etc. I definitely recommend staying somewhere else!

The absolute worse service. Every. Single. Time. The blizzards are always sloppy and looked like a 7 year old poured them. The SLOWEST drive through. The employees do NOT wear gloves (DISGUSTING). And so so so so so SOOOOO rude

Vegetarians BEWARE-The vegetarian menu has meat. It makes no sense. One side clearly is their regular menu that has meat. The flip side claims it's vegetarian but the meatloaf is not a mock meatloaf-it is MEATLOAF. Their soup has beef stock. It's all just a joke on us-Will never go back-
how about you try answering the phone once in a while. i waited on the phone for so long that i learned all the words to your crappy country theme song. it's a MONDAY not a friday night

Went two days ago and the bartender was extremely rude. Left without having anything to drink or eat as a result. Went to The Institution a couple blocks away and they were extremely nice! If you have a similar experience I'd recommend going there as an alternative

1 star for awful service at the front desk. So rude. 

5 stars for my waxer Jess who was super sweet and did a great job.

Since you don't take reservations, but you accept call ahead seating.  Take the call ahead when a customer calls in.  Don't tell me that there is no wait currently and i will be ok.  Then when I arrive you tell me it's a 45 minute wait.  This is the second time in a row that this happened.
Got shots legit shoved down my throat the second I walked in then was asked to pay for them... all in all I hate this place and have never felt so uncomfortable  or violated.

I was here for the Oscar showcase.  The theatre really needs to modernize their seats.  The theatre seats are beat up and not that comfortable.  I am hoping I don't take Home a bedbug. The theatre needs more help to keep up with the demand of high crowds. A lot of garbage piling up.  And few people cleaning.  I did find the bathroom clean but few soap dispensers that worked.

Strike Two - we won't be back.  Yes, we tried Brickhouse twice.  Visit 1 was on a Friday night about two months ago.  Visit 2 was today on a not busy/not slow Sunday.   I could go into a long review of why this place is not worth your time nor money...but, I'll keep it short(er).    If you go, be prepared to wait for your drinks...to wait for your food...for your food order to be screwed up...and for the excuse that "we are understaffed".  Understaffed is no excuse for the three additional servers sitting in the corner booth doing nothing...or why the appetizer comes out AFTER the main course....or why the chicken on my sandwich is refrigerator cold...or why three (3) Philly CHEESEsteak sandwiches are served with NO CHEESE...or why a burger ordered very well done/burnt comes served medium...  Nothing from the manager except "I'm sorry".   This place has a great great atmosphere...but that is where it stops.

Maybe I need to avoid this location all together. 
Every time I go I order a ham & Swiss and it seems like either they are out of Swiss or don't listen because my order is always wrong. Smh irritating af

This place is garbage.  The food is awful. I think its the First Chinese restaurant I've ever been to that doesn't provide steamed rice with its entrees.  Worst beef with broccoli and sesame chicken I've had in memory. Beef is somehow hard and chewy at the same time.

So the good part is the burger was great. A bit overpriced ($18) but very good none the less. Everything else at this newer restaurant was a hot mess!!  Many of the staff are new -- ok -- train them -- no one could explain the Tuesday Night specials -- basically a sign on the table stating $4 craft beers  -- which was completely different than the other sign that talks about happy hour from 4-7 -- so, craft beer (as generally defined as Not Budweiser) is loosely defined by the bartender as Local only -- so the "craft beer" brewed in the next town over didn't qualify??  WTF. Another waitress told us everything under $6 (so only 4 of the 20+ draft choices) and another told us all the drafts were essentially half price?

I'll be shocked to see this place still in business in 6 months!!  Unless, of course, they have a celebrity rescue from Jon Taffer or maybe Robert Irvine?!!
5:43 am friday, not open, says 24 hours but again mislead by out of date information on yelp
Worst customer service!  They lost my expensive Italian pair of shoes!

Went here for lunch- when we first arrived, they could not seem to figure out who was going to be our server. It took an hour to get our food (it was clear they forgot to put in our order). The manager gave us a dismissive apology and offered us a coupon for the next time we come in, but at this point that's useless because I don't think I'll be coming back. Finally got our food and both my friends' avocado toast looked awful- the avocados were black. The people around us appeared to be having a similar experience, as many of them sent back dishes and complained of a long wait. Also the bathrooms were DISGUSTING. Will not be returning, absolutely abysmal service and basically zero compensation for the wait or the bad food.

For the 3rd time I've ordered my favorite meal from this Taco Bell, and they just can't pull of the correct ingredients with their equipment. I get a #6, which is 2 chalupa's, hard taco, and a drink. I always get chicken, no tomatoes, add nacho cheese, hard taco and MTN DEW BAJA BLAST with hot sauce. Tonight I got beef chalupas, tomatoes, onions, (don't come with it in the first place) a soft taco, an Ice tea of all things, and surprisingly hot sauce. And the fact that chicken and nacho cheese cost $2.50 more is not why I'm mad, all 3 times there was nobody in line, and not even inside. So from now on I'm going to the one and keystone and 62st street. Sure I'm going to wait in like for 20+ minuets but at least I know my order will be correct. Even when it's a cluster at 1am with all the drunks, I'd rather deal with that than a terribly inaccurate order of Castleton tbell.

The burger was thin and bun was dissolving under some heavy tomato sauce and it had melted cheese?...the lamb rib is good, spiced ok and crispy but no sauce offered with it or anything else. The humus are mixed with carrot....??... the bread is like a pancake, it should be lafa or pita bread, crispy not soft cake like. The shredded wheat is actually konafi but was very dry and inedible. Surprisingly bad for its location and all the buzz about the chef.
The sign says they are open till 10pm! We were there at 9:50. And it was closed. Fix your signs please, or stay open till the actual closing time frame. Thanks.
The worst chicken tacos I have ever had and the guacamole and salsa are terrible. The place is so overpriced for what it is. Save your time and money and go to besito in Ardmore
The fishbowl may have been cheap but it's all ice and completely watered down! If u wanna fill yourself with sugary liquid then it's good but otherwise I'd pass.

Before the movie begins, I wanted to warn not to get seat E8 in auditorium 5 -- it's currently broken and I've never been so uncomfortable (outside of being on an airline). Next up is two hours of torture.

This company is a complete mess. DO NOT USE THEM! 
It's going to take a month to receive our stuff and they still haven't told us what time they'll be delivering. At least let us know approx. what time so that I can take PTO from work??!!?!? We moved from San Diego to Portland not San Diego to New York. It shouldn't take like 10 years to get our stuff! 
It's really inconvenient having absolutely nothing at our new place. We can't sit, cook or lay down anywhere. 
When we emailed and called our rep in the San Diego office, she completely ignored us because she knows they messed up. 
At least keep apologizing because isn't that your job? She tried to blame us for having stuff under 3500 pounds?! Seriously?! We had to buy a new bed bc we couldnt sleep on the floor! We're wasting money on buying stuff we already have! 
If you hate your job that much, then go find something else instead of being completely useless! Oh yeah, the corp office will make you talk to the rep so they're pretty useless too. 
From reading other reviews, I'm really afraid our stuff is going to either get lost or damaged. I don't understand why/how this company is still in business when they have so many negative reviews. Im also going to report this company to BBB! I am rolling my eyes as I'm typing because this company is annoying and they don't care about anything other than making money.

First time at this IHOP. Walked in to place a to go order. I ordered the original french toast no powdered sugar (I am diabetic) and a side of bacon. May I add that it took 2 waitresses to take my order and they looked and acted like they had never heard/seen someone place a to go order before. Paid for my order and sat down to wait. The "hostess" was not so pleasant. Watching her seat people without a hello or anything, rubbing her eyes and telling the waitresses how her eyeliner is smearing all over her hands and is annoying, was pretty bad. After about 10 minutes I noticed them take a bag to the corner near the register, I thought it was my order and I was right. We waited for another 15 minutes or so, and I thought it was taking pretty long to place a to go order of some french toast and bacon, so I went up and asked if it would be much longer. I was rudely interrupted by the hostess who said "did you pay yet?" Mind you, she was standing right there while I paid. Meanwhile, the waitress went back and asked about my order, went and looked in that bag that had now been sitting for about 15 minutes, then asked the cooks for a side of bacon and magically my order was ready. I got my food and began walking out, when I was stopped by the original waitress who took my order. She wanted to check to see if I "got the right bag". Upon looking at my order, it was completely covered in powdered sugar and the bacon was burnt. I got my money back and talked to the manger and explained that I ordered without powdered sugar as I am diabetic. He said he was the one who cooked my order. He told me they didn't mark it on the receipt and tried to throw his waitresses under the bus. After looking at the receipt, he says that it was in fact marked on the receipt. I would understand the mix up if it was busy but it wasn't busy. I would also question the cleanliness of this place simply by observing the waitresses and dirty hostess.

Many Japanese hole in the walls are fantastic. This one is far from it. Disinterested service (dirty plates left on table, server forgot to take additional sushi roll order), salad is drenched in dressing in a sloppy manner, had to ask for a glass for my huge Sapporo beer, mediocre sushi (nigiri bland where some fish is served too warm or too cold, dragon roll was yucky (eel was slightly bitter and even the tempura  seemed chewy and dried out). No one said thank you or goodbye when I left. I'll remove a star if I get ill from the meal which seems like a possibility given the environment and my experience at Samurai sushi.

Waited 20 minutes for our drinks.  Our appetizers came out about 10 minutes before the cocktails.  Waitress apologized and said she'd get them taken off the bill.  Bill came, they were still on it.  Manager came over.  We explained what happened.  He apologized and then told waitress to hand us the bill.  No change.  Drinks still on there.  If you choose to go here, hope you don't have an issue.  Management won't help.

BEWARE

We researched this restaurant because we wanted a good authentic Italian restaurant. Website states the "chef" went to culinary school in Italy. 

Long story short it was horrible. The veal was chewy. The chicken marsala tasted like water, no flavor at all, it was not cooked with wine. Spinach manicotti was cold. None of the entrees came with the sauteed vegetables. The menu states The entrees come with  piccata potatoes and sauteed veggies. The bread was still doughy. 

When the food was sent back, the waitress stated the "chef" would be out to talk to us. The waitress then returned a few moments later and stated we will cut the bill in half. The "chef" never talked to us.  We then asked what happened to the "chef" that trained in Italy. The waitress stated he relocated to Nashville a few months ago; however, the current cook still uses the same recipes. 

We asked about the grated parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, and the noodles. Was told they don't use fresh parmesean because it would go bad. They also don't make their own mozzarella or noodles even though the website says differently. Was a horrible experience and definitely over priced. There was only one other table of people there the entire time we dined. I don't recommend it at all. We will hunt for another Italian restaurant.  

On a positive note the salad was very good. The mozzarella cheese (sticks) we're good but they were the frozen kind. 

We were really looking forward to cannoli  and tiramisu; however, we were hesitate about it due to the state of the rest of the meal. We asked the waitress about it and she admitted they came preprepared from the freezer, so we passed.

This place sucks! and never gets my orders correct. I have notified the manager several times but there's No customer's service to resolve the issues. Therefore, I won't spend my money there and I will share that with my friends and coworkers that eats there regularly.
They have really great customer service i just prefer the food on south street better

Las Palmas in Franklin is CLOSED. I saw this coming as the food, service level, management engagement, and quality has been sliding downhill for a couple of years. A sad ending to what was a great location and restaurant experience.

Ordered online and got nothing. You have to wait three days for your money to be refunded. Waste of time, order elsewhere. They might as well burn down their building and collect the insurance because they're obviously not in the business of making pizza.

Long waiting list on Monday for decent food and coffee but customer service had too many rules, such as not seating if all of party not present & not serving coffee while waiting in line outside in. They were clearly trying to move us through the restaurant swiftly to gain more tables, so not a relaxing place to eat if visiting friends or trying to have a relaxing breakfast. Attempting to clear plates too often. They kept asking my wife if they could take her plate as she was still eating, with food in her mouth. Wouldn't come back.

Holy cow. didn't vacuum my back seat. rags were dirty and left inside and outside streaked, dirty, fuzzy. worse than before wash. Everyone leaves their cars so the wait is much longer. They increased their prices for this!! never going back!

No problems with the actual restaurant but chickies and Pete's stands at bb&t pavilion and Lincoln financial field are absolutely absurd. $14 for fries plus another $3 for cheese cup is just outrageous. Used to be a strong supporter of crabfries but I will never drop that absurd amount of money on just a small cup of fries.

Good service but horrible food. Jack's new food truck series has to be the worst sandwiches I have ever eaten from Jack in the box. Taste OK but for $5 a sandwich, better load it up. I've tried two out of the three and it's horrible. The pork "belly" in the BLT is so thin, they should be illegal to classify it as belly. Thick bacon is a better term and two pieces that can't fill the sandwich is a rip off. Then the Primerib Steak sandwich didn't even fill 3/4 of the sandwich. Once again failure. Last but not least... They called the bread a baguette but it's really just cheap sub bread. Overall, I'd be ashamed to even market these sandwich as such. I don't blame Martha for not trying them. #JackvsMartha

Stayed here for 4 days while attending a Sales meeting and left completely unimpressed.  At most times, the front desk was only staffed with one person who was responsible for check-in, check-out and receiving phone calls.  For a fairly large hotel, it is completely unacceptable.  The room was devoid of any artwork except for one picture on the wall.  Sterile, lifeless with drafty windows and weathered/worn carpeting.  Hallways were humid and smelled of mildew/mold. The entire hotel is dated (evidenced by me being stuck in the elevator for a few minutes) and does not adequately reflect the Embassy Suites brand.
They overcharged me then didn't update my bill. Their beers are just ok and overpriced. Not been here in awhile and won't be going back

But wait! Is it for adults right? Then why did I feel like I walked into a daycare? This place is terrible I have never ever felt like a place should close their doors as bad as this place needs too. They need to tell anyone who is bringing kids that there is a Chuck-E Cheese nearby take them there. Will never go back and will let anyone and everyoine that will listen to avoid this place.

First time I ordered,they said it would be an hour wait,my husband called after an hour and 30 mins,they said our pizza was on its way. We waited another 45 minutes or so before calling again,they  apologized,gave it to us for free then finally delivered it. When we got it both pizzas were wrong and ice cold,since they were free we didn't call back. Today we decided to give them another chance,they said 2 hours this time so my husband called them back and said he would just pick them up. He went up there to pick them up and they said the driver was on his way to our house,my husband came home,then they called and said the driver came back to the store and we just told them to deliver it because he was already home,we waited about 40 minutes and they call again saying "the driver broke down so we have to pick it up". We just moved to the neighborhood so 2 out of 2 bad experiences is enough for me,never again will I waste my time ordering from this clueless location!

I went to the Blake's on River and Craycroft which recently opened. I ordered a cheeseburger and fries with a milkshake, it was okay. Nothing great. We also ordered the chicken finger boat which is supposed to come with 4 chicken fingers, but instead we got two regular sized chicken tenders and two popcorn chicken looking nuggets with no chicken all breading. It also took about 15 minutes total with two cars ahead of us. I'm not gonna bother going back, take the drive to In-N-Out or Culver's.

District donuts should really consider putting their exceptional schedules on their website. Somehow I have been restricted from going two years in a row. I am from out of town and was told to try these donuts, but that's apparently not an option for me. The first time they were getting ready for a company holiday party (I tried to visit in the afternoon) and the second was today, 3pm on a Monday afternoon, but it closed at 2pm for some construction. I have now spent $40 in Uber rides and have not had any donuts. I've been told the donuts are good but this is just bad service in my opinion. I shouldn't have to call in order to figure out if a place is open during their normal operating hours.
Slow service. Medicare food. It shouldn't take 15 minutes to get a bread bowl of soup. The manager is rude

Went there a couple years ago and thought it was pretty good, once I got a table.  I had called in a few days ahead for a reservation for two.  Despite the reservation, we waited close to an hour for a table.

I called this week to make a reservation for this weekend and was told, "We don't do reservations for less than six."  Maybe that explains the wait last time.  Would've been nice to know then, but now that I know now, I won't be back for another hour-long wait.  It wasn't that great!

Had a breakfast here (as Kimpton guests), which was the worst hotel breakfast we've experienced ever. 
As we walked in no any kind of greetings or smile, just a  sit where you want gesture.

Had: a) BEET ME (a small glass of supposedly beet, carrot, ginger and cilantro raw juice, which in reality was filled with 2 huge cylinders of ice taking the 2/3 of the space in a glass and the rest of the space was filled with UNDRINKABLE mess of awfully tasted beet and ginger juice with nowhere found carrot or cilantro flavor). And this is coming from the person who LOVES raw juices and familiar with many flavors of them. Otherwise why would I ordered this mess for the price of the $9 ?!?! for THIS??? 
         b) Supermarket quality bagel and Croissant with the slice of Philadelphia Cream Cheese bought in some of those Warehouses (like BJ'S or Sam's, no condiments like jams or jellies coming with them) for $4 each?!
         c) 2 cups of not good tasting coffee (no milk until asked, no refills offered) for $4 each?!

And then comes the question from the waitress "How did you like it?"
Well, she received our honest opinion about how we liked it, and after hearing it, said with of course an attitude: "If you didn't like it you don't have to pay for it", which actually was the only positive (and I would say fare) part of our experience in this place. Paying about $30 for a minimal breakfast for 2 should include much more hospitality, taste and satisfaction than was offered to us here.

One word: Laziness.

That pretty much sums it up. This spot is receiving two stars primarily because they have convenient hours and are consistent. Consistently, meh. Here is why I say they're lazy:

1) Constantly messing up orders.
2) I have had, on numerous occasions, the full shell on my shrimp while in a taco/burrito.
3) Again, I have had, on numerous occasions, the avocado 'stem' [or whatever that top part is that easily flicks off] in my guac. Yes, biting into that is as unappealing as it sounds. 
4) I always walk in, order food, and leave with a bill that is a fraction what it should be due to them comping all of their mistakes. It's the definition of laziness; why not correct said issues?!?

Oh well. I know what I'm signing up for when I go here so there are no surprises.
Ordered a large pepperoni, with garlic knots. Delivery took almost over an hour. Once we got it opened it up and this is what our pizza looked like. Luke warm too. Guess it was a tough day at PJs.

I wish I could give this place a 0. If you have any food allergies to items listed on their sandwiches do not visit the location in Airside C in the Tampa Airport. They will not help you by making a fresh sandwich. All of the sandwiches are pre-made at a different location and warmed upon request. I was trying to buy someone a turkey sandwich that has Italian dressing and cheese. This person has an allergy to parsley which is common ingredient in Italian dressing and lactose intolerant. They were not willing to make fresh sandwiches and very rude about it. If you can't make any changes to sandwiches this should be noted on your sign, do not make the customer wait in a long line to find out this information.

While I have shopped here in the past some I have always ended up at Edwards or other places for quality and pricing plus the subtle air of snobbiess here and the firm ordered client is very wealthy and dressed impeccably, if you are single working class you aren't their preferred client. However today was beyond inexcusable.  I often might be coming in before or after a workout so in workout gear.  Today I came in and was simply looking to see what items on sale (again or their ideal client as looking at sales instead of all full price). After wandering around a bit I had items in my basket and was checking out. Someone came and told me I couldn't buy a basket as it was for someone else. This basket didn't have a hold sign on it anywhere.  I was told it was a regular who was eating at he bistro and had other items on hold (again no sign). Ironically he other items I had well well more than the original price all combined.  I left because the firm attitude I got was you aren't our ideal customer and F$&@ you.  So I won't spend my money here. I encourage you to follow the lead and spend where they are kind and treat all customers equally. This is not an all customers are equal place

This store has a great staff (SteveFisher) that helps you decide on window coverings. But if there is a problem, the installation team falls so short it isn't even funny. I ordered vertical shades on a relatively small sliding glass door. It does not work properly. They were installed the end of February and they still do not work. There is no communication between the install person and the managers of the department. The team takes copious amount of notes and can never find them. I am losing my patience to get this problem resolved. Next I will call the company. Do not order big items from here

My mom made a reservation for this past Saturday for my stepdad's 65th birthday celebration.   The reservation was made through OpenTable who had texted us that day to confirm the reservation.  When we got to the restaurant, there was a sign saying it was closed until further notice as they had no water.  I saw on OpenTable that this similar issue happened to others a few days prior.  If you are going to close down for an emergency, you should not allow people to be able to book reservations and anyone that does end up booking a reservation through a third party website should be notified immediately.  Completely unacceptable.
This place is SLOW!!  Food is good not sure if it's that good for the wait.  It needs better management

Bland. Everything was bland. I have eaten there twice and both times was disappointed. Even their beer is bland - tried one of their pale ales and the flavor was shallow and fake. They were out of the local brew I originally ordered. Lettuce wraps lacked flavor with slimy chicken. "Spicy" peanut chicken noodles had no flavor. Boring food, boring atmosphere, just boring! Won't be back.

I never post issues really when it comes to eating out, I speak with someone directly when able, 

On 08/02/18, I went here for my quick 30 minute lunch break, ordered two items and kept it moving.

Closest light, I took a bite of my food to save time on the distant drive back to work, upon biting my chalupa, I bit into what I thought was a extra long piece of lettuce, after it continued to come out I knew it wasn't lettuce, but a large piece of plastic, normally I go to the restaurant and talk with the store manager myself off to the side and confront them with these issues, I didnt have time to do that at the moment due to time sensitivity, I did have time at work to get with corporate and leave my email for them to contact me about this issue even describing what happened and the location which it happened hoping a regional or general manager in the area would contact me same day if not next day, after work I confronted the shift manager off to the side what happened and showed my receipt and plastic, there was little to no care that this happened, I managed to get a "we're sorry about that" and not much anything else verbally, I did ask if I could get a general manager or regionals phone number to resolve this issue, I was denied, then handed a receipt with a supposed phone number to call, and the regionals name on the receipt she said, when I asked where, she stated the Cashier: Julio, was the regional off the receipt she gave me, Doubtful.

I wouldn't come here if you care for quality, I waited 3days for a reply email, nothing.

Usually our go to for shakes and dinner in a hurry. Tonight the service was extra slow and unfriendly. We waited about 25 minutes for dinner for two. The screen changed indicating food was on the way. After about 10 minutes we pushed the button again and were notified that the ice cream machine was empty and they were waiting on that. Food finally arrived cold without a sorry from anyone. Sorry Sonic. We are done with you.

So many asian fusion places popping up in this city, unfortunately this one is not one of the best ! It has a wide ranging menu from Vietnamese to Thai, taco's what not, but, overall food was average. Flavors of asian cuisine were scarce to say the least . Owner spent a good amount of money on the ambience( a bit gaudy) to have it qualified for a fusion restaurant , but, still doesn't get the score right. Service was slow and mediocre. The shrimp fried rice is definitely a must at this place , rest of the items were sub-standard . Hopefully, Reno starts getting some restaurants that stay true to its cuisine !

Went for brunch and the food was great but that skinny tall brunette working made the whole experience awful. Her service was awful and she was indifferent with not just me but all the customers she dealt with. Probably won't visit again  next time I'm in Nashville. Shame.

I am really surprised with all these great Yelp reviews. This place is mediocre at best. And way too overpriced!!
Good concept, really nice space and ambiance but very poor execution. 
First the food. It is definitely overpriced. We went twice for breakfast. 
Oatmeal they serve is Trader Joe's organic quick cook oatmeal in packets. They just add hot water and a few slices of bananas. Twice I was told "sorry we ran out of steel cut oats". 
The silver dollar pancakes and scrambled eggs are just ok, wouldn't come back for that either. 
They had some oatmeal chocolate chip cookies which were really good but again overpriced. 
Coffee was ok, nothing special but I have to say that they do serve organic half and half and organic almond milk. 
View is great, nice outdoor seating and very pleasant space inside. But... service is terrible. They seem like they have no idea what they're doing. Everyone is doing everything-from taking orders to cooking to serving. It seemed very chaotic. I waited the other morning for 15 mins just to order-even though I was first in line because the guy was making smoothies and explained the older lady what she should be doing. She was munching on the dates while making smoothies, not wearing gloves and one of the guys who was supposed to do all the cooking (I guess) was taking orders using the same glove for handling credit cards that he uses for preparing food...The two guys also seemed a bit annoyed and unpleasant-probably because they cannot handle that many customers... 
All in all-menu looks interesting and different but the food my group had was just ok. Won't be coming back. Please do something about the service!!

I was in town and this dunkin donuts was near my hotel. On my way to work decided to pick up a quick coffee and donuts for myself and a couple coworkers.  The lady at the window was extremely rude and just kind of shoved my bag at me.   When I got to work and opened my bag, the donuts were all smashed together and just thrown in the bag. The frosting was stuck all over the bag.. No paper napkins...  Probably will not return...

Let me start by saying despite the reviews my friends and I decided to try this place because we heard the food was good and I had actually met one of the bartenders at a Black Restaurant Week event earlier that week. Being forewarned about the bad service from this website we called to try and secure a table or at least to find out the waiting time. On several calls we got no answer. Since it was close to home we went anyway. Several people were waiting outside. This was at around 9 pm and we were told they were not accepting anymore patrons. Seriously!! I explained the we tried to call in order to avoid wasting time, bus and cab fare back since it was late.  The hostess apologized and stated that the restaurant is really busy. I understand that, but what is unsettling is the patrons waiting outside also made several phone calls and when they finally did get through they were told that they don't accept reservations over the phone.  So which is it? Essence festival ended the day before and there are definitely LESS people in the city now. Clearly the management needs a class in restaurant/patron etiquette and I hope that considering its location it will be more appreciative of the community and provide a better level of class and service.

This was almost embarrassing to write over a salad but the service was so horrible. 
Coworkers and I stopped by for lunch to watch the World Cup and get some food. We sit at the bar and wait 15 minuets for drinks while the bartender clearly payed attention to the suits who needed refills then she serves new customers at the bar a drink after she told us to wait.

SO , we WAIT ANOTHER 15 mins to order food: 3 simple Cesar salads (one with chicken) . 

Even making it easier we pay ahead since it was our lunch break. 
Our colleague got their Cesar salad within minuets...
The two other small Cesar salads took 30 min!!!

HOW DOES THAT HAPPEN?!

The bartender was less then apologetic that the small salads took longer because one of them had chicken on it. The small Cesar salad with chicken was so burnt it was inedible

Needless to say, i left no tip and I was late getting back to work .

Service needs major improvement

Very poor management. I've been asking for a coffee machine since morning because the one in my room is not working. I called the desk and I went to the dest personally more than 5 times. All they told me is "wait a min, we'll send someone right away" Nobody ever came in my entire stays. Totally waste of money. Not worth it.

We took my step kids out for dinner Saturday  night, and the prevailing topic of conversation was how bad the service was.  Our waitress took our drink orders and brought the kids' drink after about ten minutes.  Ten minutes later she brought the adult beverages.  

She just dashed in and out.

Then, ten or fifteen minutes later she came to take our dinner orders.  She said there were no rolls.  Before she dashed off again I asked for water "all around".  We were parched after eating the peanuts (imagone that).

Ten minutes later, our quick little leprechaun of a waitress (complete with green hair and green lipstick) brought one glass of water.  Before I could ask for a glass of water for everyone at the table she was gone. 

Our food arrived an hour after ordering.  Many dishes were cold.  Our waitress reappeared long after the food was eaten by the people who waited so long.  I had to search for the sauce for the chicken tenders,  as our waitress and the dude who delivered our food failed in the mission.  I nearly went in to shock by the amount of salt on my chicken.

I don't know why I left this poor excuse of a waitress anything.  Unless you have no measure of good food and service, this place will just disappoint.  I don't know how this place stays in business.

This place is gross. Bathroom nasty. Elevator sketchy. We received a airline hotel voucher for a canceled flight & choose to pay vs staying here. Room as a weird odor. Furniture stains all over the chair. Housekeepers yelling down the hallway to other housekeepers about what duties they have. Front desk people not very friendly. We were only in the room for 45 mins before deciding it's best we just pay for our own room. I never write reviews but I felt the need.

And don't bother to complain to corporate-----you receive a standard
"thank you for your feedback" letter and NOTHING improves
at this location!
Decent selection but store maintained very poorly. Unclean and messy. Difficult to get around.

Under new ownership again! I am a customer since opening years ago. 

The detail center does excellent work, and the car wash is also excellent.

Where they fall extremely short is there is no one on site; and/or anyone in charge to deal with customer issues. Dropping off my two cars for detailing was a hassle as the detail crew was late both days! Picking up was a hassle as well. When spending $200.00 to detail each car I expect better customer experience.

When using the car wash service associates either do not pick the correct wash requested or the computer screws up. I always get/pay for the "supreme" wash and about half the time I get the lower end wash and end up having to wait for the car to be put through the tunnel again for the correct wash.
My group and I were asked to leave because they had to make room for more people. I will never eat here again. I hope the manager sees this. They should be ashamed!

Perhaps I caught this place on an off night, but the service was abysmal and the food was mediocre at best. The really off putting aspect of the experience was being ignored by the server and having to go to the bar for drinks only to be ignored again. Lastly, the tap was down, so there were no drafts. Time for some quality control.
Great location however very little food at happy hour and rude bar tender. Plenty of other close hotels to stay at.

Interesting I had no issues getting my prescription filled timely at Walmart... I move it here and the won't let me fill it until 3 weeks after it runs out. Taking my business back to Walmart for prescriptions.

I should have walked out when the host threw the menus on the table and walked off. It took 6 minutes and 24 seconds for a waiter to come to the table. While ordering food, he continually said he was new and didn't know is we order certain things. When the food came, we ended up sending some things back because they were disgusting. This has ruined my experience for ever visiting Chili's again. 

On top of that...the customer service was atrocious. I'm almost led to believe it was because of race since minorities sat on one side and whites sat on the other side of the restaurant. I was tempted to take a video but no need since I will never spend my money here again.

I found the front desk was so unprepared.  The person in front of us complained there was no to valet park their car, and they left it down the street and were afraid of getting a ticket.  The front desk person seemed very unprofessional and didn't know how to fix that problem.  It is an extremely complicated hotel to navigate.  My room was a mile away from the elevator.  Not bad for me, but for an elderly person it would a problem.  The grand hall had terrible service I waited over an hour for 1 hamburger, they said they had a big banquet that night... okay.  The pillows were small, the air conditioner was terrible.  We asked for the manager for a printing problem and was told he'd get back to us, never did.  Cool place to look at, but the staff was not up to par.  I NEVER right bad reviews.  It could be great with a better staff, and pillows.  Come with a compass to find your room.

Went back a second time just because It's in a great location and I really wanted to like this place. My noodle was under cooked and the pork had way too much fat. I am done with this place. Kin and Nomiya are my places for ramen.

We heard they had the best tacos in town. They were very mediocre. Ordered refried beans and rice. The beans were just okay and the rice was cold and hard. They only brought out one meal (there were 2 of us) and did bring our other meal out fairly quickly but still forgot an item we had ordered. Very disappointed.
Eggs not cooked, ordered medium. Coffee horrible. Service very good and atmosphere good

My friends and I had tickets to a Paint Nite that was being hosted by Barrelhouse. We walked in unsure of where to go and stood waiting because there was a "please wait to be seated" sign, but no hostess to be found. Servers literally walked by us and ignored us for like 2 minutes, until someone finally asked if we were there for Paint Nite and directed us around the corner. Uhh okay. 

So we take a seat and waited for someone to take our drink order. No one comes, so we head to the bar and again, wait two minutes to be acknowledged. The bartender literally walks by us to a guy eating next to where we were standing, asks if his food is alright, and then walks by us again. Uh?? Finally we flag her down and we hand her our IDs and she takes a look at mine and immediately says that she can't accept my ID. I recently moved to Boise and still have my out of state license, and it is vertical, but it is still valid and has not expired. I ask her why not and she says that the cops have been on them about fake IDs and she can't take mine because most fakes are vertical. So, we ask to see the manager. The manager tells me the same thing. Apparently my valid, unexpired, legal driver's license doesn't look or feel right to her. At this point, we were getting annoyed. I totally understand policy and being cautious of underage drinking, but she was so unprofessional and rude about it. Finally she says she'll look into it and takes it into the back. 

So five minutes later she takes it into the back and asks to see my credit card, and compares my ID with my credit card. She then says it's ok. No apologies or explanations. She also took a three minute long look at my friend's (horizontal, and also valid) Oregon license. Funny thing is, when a new guy FINALLY came around for the drink order he didn't even ask for my ID!!!! 

Anyways, food was good but overpriced. The chicken on my salad looked like those frozen Tyson's strips that you stick in the microwave. Service was slow, and they forgot our silverware, and we never received it after asking. We had to go up and find some. Drinks were good.

They were busy so I can be sympathetic for slow/forgetful service, but the whole ID situation totally put a bad taste in my mouth. I have never had that happen to me in Boise, not even downtown or at the liquor store! It was embarrassing and the bartender & manager made me feel like I was not worth their business or time. I will not be back.

Too expensive for the services offered. I recently moved here and based on the reviews here decided to drive 20 minutes to give this place a try. The service provider that assisted me was very friendly and the wait time was a lot shorter than I normally wait but I was not given exactly what I asked for and what I did receive was not worth what I was charged. I believe in paying for what I want but this was not worth the money

I just called and he quoted me $330 for a Note 8 screen repair. I then asked for quote on yelp (by accident) and he wrote back it would be $420. Uh, what happened?

At uBreakiFix cost is $260 (plus tax) for new LCD screen and labor.

We got a late dinner here around 9pm and the food was not appetizing at all. The mash potatoes lacked flavor and salt, my seafood fra Diablo pasta was very dry and all of the seafood was over cooked. Very saddening when my scallops are as chewy as a piece of beef jerky. We also got the surf and turf and the lobster wasn't very tasteful, but the steak was cooked right around medium rare which is how we like it. The server we had was very nice and the management was accommodating and corrected the kitchens mistakes for our low quality food. Overall staff was pleasant and made a bad evening of food turn into a decent one with their professionalism and handling our predicament. Happy to say the low quality food didn't reflect the work ethic of the employees/management.

I hate leaving a bad review, but maybe I can save someone else's night out. First, it's so loud in here when it's crowded that unless you're skilled in lip reading you won't be able to have a conversation with the people you are with. The squid appetizer was so heavily battered that you can't taste the actual squid. Everyone else's dishes were so-so and too spicy. We had the honey butter chicken, crab watermelon salad and sweet potato side. Staff was nice though!

Been to this location many times. It just isn't the same. It's a chain, I get it. But waiting for drinks which arrived after the appetizer. Then the waitress disappeared. No bread... Waitress finally showed up to take our order- and yes, one was for a steak well done. That should be pretty hard to screw up.  Came out rare. Sent it back. They didn't fire a new one - I assume they shoved it in the microwave because it came back same as when it left, except now shoe leather. Pretty disappointed, even for a chain. Boxed up our stuff, my dogs will eat the left overs.

Don't come to this urgent care AT ALL. I went there for a chest pain condition and first I was met by a nurse at triage that had a very bad impression. He did not verbally communicate nor happily explain the basic steps. He even gave me the look when I was confused where to put my stuffs down. His face basically said "I don't want to be here." Then, I was met my a Physician Assistant, not even a Medical Doctor. She was quickly checked me and told me to get a EKG and CXR (chest x-ray). She said she would call me back for the result later since they do not have a radiologist to read the result at the moment. I was fine with that since I understand how this procedure works. Now, 2 weeks after, I still have not receive any calls from them about the chest x-ray result. I messaged them via the online portal and they haven't even read it. The EKG result also could not be read by the PA neither so she once again directed me to see another cardiologist. How ridiculous the experience was! I went to other urgent clinics before but none of them was as bad as this one. Just don't go here. Go to MedExpress or Centra Care, at least they will give you a diagnosis or something.

Usually come here but the girl who works Tuesday nights with the long dark hair is completely terrible at her job. 

I came to fireside with some friends to celebrate my new house and she never once came up to us and asked us what we wanted to drink. She only kept going to a table for four young people and never to us. 

We are usually served by a red head but she wasn't there. We now will go to a different bar to celebrate things.

Seriously tho?!? This place is def one of the worst places I've ever eaten in my life. Dishes that our food was served on were dirty - even my kids plate. Food was mediocre at best. Honestly food at Applebee's or chili's would we better. I have no idea how this place has 4 stars. Very dirty and food is not good.
The hotel and spa are beautiful, as is the outdoor seating. The food, is half star (at best.) The service is virtually nonexistent.  As a place to dine...I wouldn't recommend it.

Customer service is rude, disrespectful and poor. Most are teens who don't care about their job and others are sad middle aged people who don't care about you or what you need. The only good part is the food, good popcorn and tasty snacks.

Sadly, neither corporate nor the restaurant care about the food quality. Corporate 2as not even going to tell this restaurant about my complaint. KFC at ALL locations has lost my family's business due to the fact that corporate did nothing, and the owner never contacted me. Very sad. I was not compensated for inedible and inferior food, and we are done. I would give -10 stars to this location and zero to corporate for their unprofessional handling of my complaint.

So disappointed!
