This used to be my go to place when ordering sushi but it seems I am going to have to find another place. #1 spicy mayo is now extra money now which is not a deal breaker,#2 found a long hair in my spicy salmon roll and had to throw the rest of my sushi out, #3 like in a previous review the dumpling sauce is filled not even a quarter of the way full, #4 No more sushi lunch specials that I could find on the menu. I really wish I could just go back in time and order from somewhere else. Guess I will not be back :(

This places sucks. Long lines, disinterested employees and the guy who sits at the desk taking people's numbers is an a**hole. I didn't catch his name, but a classic New Jersey jerk. If you don't like your job, get a new one Einstein. Life is short.

Good food, horrible service. We dined in on May 10 for dinner. The hostess was so rude. No kind of greeting at all, not even a smile. Just asked how many and showed us to a small table that had chairs on one side and a shared booth on the other. We were there for a special occasion and the restaurant was about 25% full.. was about 7:30ish, so we asked politely if we could have one of the many open booths. She rolled her eyes and said they were all reserved, and we can sit on the "booth side" of the table, which made no sense since only 2 people could fit on that side. I knew that could not be true given that it was a weeknight and almost 8pm so I pointed to one of the smaller booths and said even that one was reserved? Another eye roll, then she said "I mean...." like we were being difficult by asking and said "fine, whatever". Clearly had a lot of attitude and was just all around rude. Once we sat our server was friendly, food came out quickly and was tasty. After that we didn't see her much and no refills on water, took forever to order dessert and get the check. I never did get my water refilled. The family next to us had to get the manager because they were sitting down so long and hadn't even been greeted. The manager was nice and was able to help them, but that shouldn't have been necessary, that serve only had 3 tables, one bring ours and by that point she wasn't even stopping by. No complaints on the food, but not worth coming in for the rude hostess and slow service. So many other options in cool springs now.

Bad Chinese. Fried rice was not good. Mushy and pasty. 
Kung pao was okay but sauce was runny and thin. Hot and sour soup lacked flavor. Don't bother.

Yes, the Sonoran dog is good. 

The fries were soggy, the fondue was rather tasteless even with the chorizo. And everything came out at once instead of app then main course. We thought the salsa was all pretty bland too. Maybe the other location is better. ‍

Our waiter was friendly, but slow. Another table beside us waited for a very long time to even get anyone to come take their drink order.

Um, never again. Came to visit a friend & decided to come to Applebees. Wasn't too hungry & decided to get my goto food when im not too hungry which is a house salad. Actually was enjoyed it till I saw a piece of black hair in my food. Now i have long red hair & the people i w/ dont have short black hair, so whos hair was it? Instill don't kno...

I had my worst experience shopping for a car. 
Sadly I don't remember the guy name. 
I'm looking for a new car. Being new to US I don't have all the paperwork with me and obviously I am not ready to buy before 2 weeks. 
Once he understood I was there for a primary contact (took 1 minute cause I told him upfront) he started to be rude and basically telling me to go...out...
I'm a long time customer in Europe but obviously it will not be the case in US. 
For new expats I have visited better places

Wow. We have problems with this location every time, but tonight was the last straw. Our pizza arrived lukewarm at best, and both pizzas were made with the same toppings instead of the two different pizzas we ordered. After a ten minute phone call, they finally said they would replace the pizza but we would be put at the back of the line and it would be another hour or so to arrive. We asked if we could come to the store and exchange the pizza and were told it would still be an hour to replace. We elected just for a refund as it was already after 7pm and we were hungry. In order to receive a refund, we were told we had to drive the pizza back ourselves. That's the last time we order from this location. It used to be a great store, but current management seems to have no concept of customer service.

I arrived at Fuel House Fitness Studio on March 17, 2018 around 8:45a to participate in a 9a.m Body Shred class. However, the studio was not open yet, so I sat in my car. The staff arrived at 8:53a and I entered the studio at 8:55a.m. This was my FIRST time at Fuel House Fitness Studio, so I stood at the counter to register and pay for the class. However, I entered the Twlight Zone and suddenly became INVISBLE and was never acknowledged. The staff and clients walked around discussing the latest episode of Scandal while I stood at the counter!!! (Someone hasn't liked Liv in two seasons.) After which they started the class with me STILL STANDING at the counter seemingly INVISBLE. At this point I WALKED OUT!!! 

Now if people of color are not allowed why not post a sign stating that instead of the rude, racist and unprofessional behavior that I encountered. I would have saved my time and gas! I would not recommend this studio to any black or brown people!!!

I'm not exactly sure how this place is getting such good reviews. Besides the fact that the staff was kind...I ordered guacamole and chips, a chicken taco, and a beef taco. The guacamole was old and bland...it literally tasted like nothing, the chips super oily and tasteless, the tacos were cold. The chicken had a odd taste...possibly nutmeg? Not sure but it wasn't for me. I prefer more spice/heat for my tacos. The beef was also cold and didn't have a good taste. I could of done better with an Old Elpaso taco kit from the grocery store. I'm sad that I wasn't pleased. But maybe it was just me because at least 4 "soccer mom types" were waiting in line for pickup??!!! Haha

This is not a place I would recommend. 
I have had two bad experiences here and there are way too many Nail Salons to choose from instead of going here. 


I had one experienced girl who used shortcuts and finished my "dip powder" in about a half an hour. The last time I tried them again I had a girl
who was horrendous, she missed half my nail with the color and the result looked as if a 5 year old polished my nails. 
I would stay away

Went last night with friends for birthday celebration.  A total disaster for 3 main reasons.  Frist, an dinner was forgotten and we had to wait 4 mins for it to arrive-an eternity.  Second, coffee ordered was ice cold, had to wait 5 mins for hot coffee, an eternity.  Third, it was a surprise birthday and was set up prior to us arriving.  The waiter forgot about  the cake that was delivered mid afternoon, the wait staff started putting down desert plates before the cake arrive blowing up the surprise.  The food was expensive and only average.  Certainly not worth what we paid.  Never again.

I really wanted to love this place. The ladies are very nice and friendly. They took their time and worked on my feet etc. The location is clean and nice. My complaint lies in that my gel manicure didn't even last a week. I had a regular pedicure that also started chipping within 2 days. I have tried other places and have had better results.

Currently waiting for my order to be taken in the ToGo area.Two employees are next to me and didn't greet or see what I needed help with. No one at the register. Waited 5 minutes and then he said she will be right with you. If this wasn't the closest place to work I would go elsewhere

I've been going to Williams for 20 years and I think the subs are great, that's why I was so disappointed with the hygiene today. I only get to stop in every few months when I'm working around there. Today this young woman was making subs and she has decided to grow her hair into dreadlocks. I couldn't care less about her hair style but with this particular style it involves months of not washing hair with soap and causes lots of breakage, I could see the broken hairs all over the shoulders of her shirt, she was leaning over the deli station and all I could think was how is nobody making her wear a hair net, GROSS !!!  Do what you want with your reggae hair but put a hair net on for crying out loud !

STAY AWAY!! This is the absolute WORST Wingstop around, and the owner has been told directly. He doesn't care. He shouldn't run a business. 1. The employees are shitty. Rude. 2. The food is never actually hot. Always cold. 3. The fries are soggy, no matter how you order them. Well done or not. 4. They like to randomly close early, and claim employees just walk out. 5. Tonight we call, and they are out of traditional wings. We gave in, and ordered boneless. They call right back, and say "we are also out of fries" like what??? LOL. This place is a joke. Save your money.

Food was good and restaurant was clean. Two tacos made incorrectly, one extra taco not ordered, nachos were made with crushed chips and no mild sauce anywhere in the place.  

I did experience workers practicing clean as you go.  The kitchen was very clean and tidy. The manager was visible and staff was friendly and helpful.

Visited again 8/6/2018 around 11:20.  Received food around 12:25.  Brandon apologized for "The rush had everything behind".  We watched others come in, eat and leave.  We were forgotten.  2nd bad experience out of 2 attempts.

Awful awful smoke in food court and everywhere we went. Wasn't very impressed with atmosphere even in non smoker section either. Food in food court was amazing though at Cuban place, but wouldn't recommend any of others.

I wish I could give worse than one star because this place deserves it.  We were there on a Saturday night and had to pay a cover to get in. 15 minutes after entering we were told we have to leave. We wanted to wait inside for an for one minute. The bouncer came over and started yelling at us to get out because they were closing, however there were many people still inside. He proceed to call my friend a "f#%king p~$sy" for not wanting to stand in the cold. Would not recommend

Was excited to go here because of its location but I ended up getting food poisoning after and was throwing up all night. I know this was the cause because it was the only thing I ate since breakfast so about a 6 hour window. Then got sick about 1 hour after eating. Also, nachos were the weirdest and worst I ever had. Truly disappointed.

It was a very disappointing visit.  Our first and last time here.  We ordered the grouper bites for an appetizer and it came with an already opened packet of buffalo sauce that we had them take back.  The monster fish sandwich was a total disappointment; the leaf of lettuce was wilted, the top of the bun was stale, the bottom of the bun was soggy, and the fish was flavorless.  The only good thing was the fries.

I've been coming here for a while as i work across the street and i will say the food is good and the staff is nice. My only issue is I've never had an order from here that was correct. There's always something missing or something added that i did not want. It got to the point where i didn't even call to let them know anymore. Now nobody from my office will be returning there and we will go to Plaza Azteca instead.

The pick up food on the other side is amazing, always on point. But the restaurant has went down, the seafood gumbo had no spice, my shrimp po-boy did not taste good, and some friends I was with had the classic crawfish. No seasonings even on the crawfish, definitely will not go to the restaurant anymore!

I'm a fan of this place.  It's very clean and the salads are yummy.  BUT, I am at a loss for while they are always out of white milk for the kids meals.  The last 3 times I have been there over the course of 5 weeks, no milk.  Why can't be solved?  I'm not a restaurant manager, but here's some ideas... 1.  Stock more milk.  2. Have the person that is holding the front door open for people walk across the parking lot to Costco or Target to buy some milk and then poor it into the kids cup you use for soda.  3. Offer to take $1 off the cost of the kids meal since you don't have the milk.  4.  Stop publishing on your kids menu you offer it, if you don't intend to have it.

first and last time coming here! horrible service for high prices! #1 when i came to get a pedicure i told the guy the water was too hot and he insisted on telling me keep my feet in the water! #2 burned me with the wax! didnt apologize or anything! #3 nail polish came off after 4 days! and i came back to get it redone and they told me no! definitely will not be coming back

We had spicy miso ramen and spicy tonkotsu ramen. Both were equally spicy. The spicy miso noodles were thicker than spicy tonkotsu noodles, which looked like thin sphagetti noodles. Unfortunately, they were not quite the type of noodles I like in my ramen. Other than a few slices of pork, half an egg (semi-hard boiled), and some corn, there really isnt much else in the bowls of noodles. Pretty plain for the price. Personally, I think their prices are too high. Overall, the ramen didn't impress me. 

We also ordered octupus balls and they were ok. Nothing spectacular.

I must add their parking is not suitable for big vehicles like a toyota sequoia. Parking lot is very cram and not enough space. We ended parking along the street.

My first time trying this place and I will never return. We've had catering from here for many many meetings and it has always been yummy so when I had to grab lunch on the go as most grad students do I thought this would be a good spot. 

To begin, I stood for about 5min (no one else waiting in line) before someone acknowledged me so I could order. I ordered a pesto chicken sandwich- no changes or substitutions. I go to pay and after a few minutes an employee places the sandwich on the counter and gestures to me. I ask "pesto chicken" to which he replies "yes". I grab my carrots/sandwich and run off only to discover after walking about a mile to work that I was given the WRONG sandwich. If I didn't find the smell of tuna passionately disgusting and it was a turkey sandwich instead I might have just eaten it but I'm sitting here now nauseous from the smell, without a lunch, and out $9. 

I highly doubt I will get a refund and I will just give this sandwich to the sweet homeless woman who sits near my building. Only positive outcome is that she will get a warm lunch today!

Spent New Years here
I was very disappointed. When we checked in no one could help us find our room. We asked three people!!! How can u work in hotel and not know where to go ??? 

NYE was s joke!! If I was 20 something snd sleezy I'd go back, but never again will you spend the money on the hype that isn't really s hype!!! 

Hotel even messed up our NYE dinner pldnd cause allegedly they didn't know restaurant closed at 9??? How How again can you work in hotel and have no clue what goes on????
So disappointing!!!!

Gotta say I was seriously disappointed in Mr. B's. The Gumbo YaYa was disgusting. 
It just tasted like a terribly burned roux.
The BBQ shrimp were just bland and the service was not good. Won't be going back there anytime soon!

absolutely unprofessional.  I contacted them last Tuesday indicating that my HVAC unit in the basement was leaking fluid and would like to schedule a diagnostic. I spoke with Matt who indicated that they could have someone out the next day at 4pm.  I left the office early to ensure that I was home in time; they never showed.  At 8:15pm, I received a call from Bob(?) stating that they hadn't forgotten about me but that they were down a truck.  I replied, "you were supposed to be here over 4hrs ago."  Why would he wait 4hrs to tell me he was down a truck?  Wasn't that known at 3:30pm?  No apologies, no attempt to waive the diagnostic fee, nothing...he quipped, "when can we come out?"  Ummm, it's July 4th weekend!!!! They threw a wrench in my plans to have my unit serviced, at the very least diagnosed, before the holiday.  He hurriedly scheduled me for the next business day.  Honestly, when people don't respect my time, I can't give them my money.  It seems that I avoided a headache & misfortune after reading these reviews.

Went in for lunch today with my husband and ordered two burgers medium rare- husbands burger came out perfect but mine was medium well. I was talking and didn't realize it until I was on the second half of my burger( literally had half a burger left) and showed the waitress each burger and said it was ok but to let the manager know that they need to make sure the burgers are getting cooked to order. She said ok and left. Then some girl who looked barely 18 walked up and asked what the problem was. I let her know about the burgers and she had the nerve to tell me that "next time I come in and noticed this BEFORE MY MEAL WAS FINISHED she would be able to help me". I let her know that my meal was only half way eaten and that I had just noticed it. I also let her know that I was not trying to get her to comp my meal and she said she understood and was not there for that reason. ? Really- you call yourself a manager? I worked in restaurants from 16 to 26 and would have never treated a customer that way. I paid the bill , left a 20% tip FOR the waitress and left. Never to return to this particular restaurant even though I love Islands and they are only 2 minutes away from home.  Nope. I'm good. Good luck in that shopping center- restaurants don't last, especially with rude managers

On the other hand the waitress/ bartender was awesome! Great service. And the fries were fantastic! This review is only regarding the manager, the over cooked burger, and the unusually high bar stools that are extremely uncomfortable.

I just went here for the pie. That's it. The coconut custard looked and smelled like eggs not coconut. The pecan pie we bought for 16 dollars was soggy, and the filling had the consistency of bread pudding. The crust under the pie was both soggy AND burned. I am SEVERELY disappointed. This was my first time at this establishment and will be my last.

It's was 6:40PM and they had the doors locked to the dining room. We awkwardly made eye contact with the employees inside working... then two little kids came and opened the door. The employees didn't attended to us at all and pushed us off and made us wait (nobody was in the drive thru). Of course shake machine was down; like anywhere else around here. We just got two tacos and left.

perhaps good beer and atmosphere, but horrible food, never going back.
food was extremely salty, very bitter, very unpleasant
barely edible
tacos with little in common with Mexican food 
the fish tacos were edible, but unpleasant, and with the bitter briny  flavor of and extremely large amount of salt
and the chicken verde tacos were inedible, even more salty, and bitter
perhaps we came on a bad day...but just horrible if you want to eat what is on the menu

The customer service was horrible I'll never come here again. Right when we walked in we waited to be helped about 4 minutes and a worker even looked at us and walked away. THEN we ordered 4 shredded chicken burritos and when we got them they were cold and the rice was so so hard. We asked for new ones so they made us "fresh," ones. They were the same hard rice. We asked for our money back didn't take more than a bite and the manager on duty wouldn't talk to us they said she only speaks Spanish. If you're a manager you should be able to speak English so you can help your customers.This is the worse customer service I have ever gotten in my whole life. I'm dumbfounded I just wanted my money and they wouldn't give it back and she wouldn't tell me her name. Tomorrow I'm calling corporate don't ever come here

TASTELESS is how I describe our takeout meal today. We were so disappointed in our meal. I don't understand how you can make baked beans, cole slaw, mac n' cheese and barbecue sauce so bland! And for a restaurant that is supposed to specialize in these dishes. We got takeout, and the first thing we noticed when we opened our sides medium containers was they were just 2/3 full, what a rip off! Bad practice for a restaurant. But after we tasted them, we knew we weren't going to finish these anyway since they were FLAVORLESS. Was really hoping to find Dickey's was a good option when we feel like barbecue, but it was a total disappointment! Not returning.

HORRIBLE!!! 
Worst service and food I've ever experienced!... Better off going through a taco bell drive through. 
Wish I would have read the reviews before entering this place. The guy with the long pointy tail was rude and the waitress had no clue what she was doing. Dirty spoons and the soup was the worst! looked like they tried to wash the spoons in it. Expensive GARBAGE.
When we complained about the soup coming after the meal and it tasting terrible the guy actually said "we should not have ordered so much"... Really?!! One bowl each at $6 of dirty water.
I'm Mexican and can tell you this place is a disgrace to our food.

I had a terrible experience here, as I am a vegetarian the choices were very limited and the server did not cater to that, as I only got 4 toppings on spring mix, which he did not say was organic and thus cost extra as well. Half of the sauces on the menu were not there as well. Service was terrible and the food was overpriced for a couple of leaves. Would definitely not recommend to come here

We went for valentines dinner.. reservation was at 7 pm . We did get in at 7 pm however we did not get our drinks and first course until 740 pm . We actually called the keg to see if we can come in for dinner .. 
We were seated by the kitchen which we had servers racing  by us the entire time .  The sever was really nice but when I did speak to the hostess of our concerns we did not have any manager come by to speak to us . 
Poorly planned and delivered for one the busiest nights of the year for a restaurant. I wouldn't making plans on visiting this establishment any time in the future.

I'll begin with how excited I was to try this place because of all the hype!! I have tried 3 times to come here only to see a line around the building. I FINALLY get there only to be greeted by an older gentleman manager/owner? He asks how many in my party I tell him 3 he says everyone has to be there to be seated... I say ok 1 is parking and the others down the street i head outside and ask for a menu I so I can look with my friend he tells me no menus outside so I ask if he has a menu online he says yes I say thank you and head outside....NOT 2mins later a party comes with 4 Older white professionals , he shows them out just like he did me then the group tells him our friend is down the block can you seat us? This manager/ seats them! I tell him My other friend is parking now so can we be seated he says no smiling I say you just let those people be seated and their friend is down the street he looks at me and says they are ordering for their friend I say well so am I. Only then do I get seated. Tonkotsu Red I ordered food was good I will not go back because of this horrible customer service. They just want you in and out it's like don't even try to enjoy this place..Obon ramen tonkotsu is better it actually has the 64 degree egg and much nicer people!

This joint continually blasts loud rap music around the clock, disturbing the peace and quiet with this sonic garbage of dozens and dozens of travelers waiting for their plane to depart. 

Turn down your damn loud speakers, you self-centered noise-polluters!!!!
Great food but HORRIBLE service. Also they charge if you ask for more complementary bread. I would suggest eating there but make sure to check the bill
Extremely small 6 piece roll made of mostly rice. Very overpriced considering what you're given.

I was very disappointed that after sitting in the drive-through line, I was told by the employee taking my order that they could not customize the chicken wrap by heating up the chicken. He stated that it was a health code violation, and that they could not do it during their busy hours. Which is it? Doesn't violate a health code or when they are busy they cannot take the time to prepare the food up to the customer's standards? I love Chick-fil-A but I am extremely upset that, per their employee, they cannot accommodate changes to their menu during "busy" hours.

We went here while in New Orleans because it was close to our hotel and our flight was leaving soon. From a convenience standpoint, it makes sense. That being said, I would never go here for any other reason. There are way too many great places to eat in NOLA. I got the crawfish egg benney and it was meh. There was too much hollandaise sauce and an unidentifiable taste. Service and coffee were great though.
Ate the lunch buffet. Not impressive at all. Food was room temperature and variety was lacking. Not one non-chicken option was available. Pretty disappointed.

I'm not sure which type of tour the bulk of these yelpers went on but the free tour is disappointing.

The brief visit to the stables is by far and away the best part. The rest of the tour was standard brewery tour garbage.  Brief history of the brewery, a sample of Bud or Bud light, upselling the birch chips to make the water beer seem better. I wish they would do something more about the history of the buildings. If they did that it would be a much better experience.

I would have given the tour 1 star except they were patient with me sampling the tappers at the end.  I settled on the Goose Island saison and it was delicious.  The bartender told me the staff drinks that over Bud so that should tell you something about the beer!

Where can you get a better free tour you ask? Come to Milwaukee and Miller will hook you up. From the history video, to the caves, to the building histories, to 3-4 free samples the Miller tour is a much slicker and informative free tour. I think Bud could stand to send its employees on it to get an idea how to improve its own game!

My girlfriend and I both got food poisoning after eating from here... I got the Chicken Korma, and she got the Butter Chicken. If you're looking for curry check out Cafe Masala - very similar in price, and much better curry... oh and no good poisoning

I don't like leaving poor reviews for restaurants, but unfortunately this location deserves one. 

You walk in and the only menu you can order from is a folded-up takeout menu that was somewhat greasy from previous patrons. The cashiers were cordial, but problems with the order either fell upon the cashiers taking the order incorrectly or staff making food improperly. 

I had multiple people in my party order everything from pizza to sandwiches to the wings and nothing was up to par. We were asked what sauce we wanted on the wings, but when the "wings" were served, they gave no sauce. When we asked them to fix it, we were given a dipping cup.

The sandwich was properly made, but it was somewhat undercooked and fell apart after the first bite. That could be the mark of a juicy sandwich, but in this case it was just shoddily put together.

The pizza itself was passable, but not terribly great for a namesake dish. The one silver lining had to be the drink machine, which really shouldn't ever be a silver lining for any situation.

The rest of the atmosphere was fine, if a little strange. There were an abundance of large TVs, but you would think at least one of them would be in Full HD (they aren't). The sliding glass door is always open, but I'm not sure why it was needed to begin with.

I don't know, it just seems like this whole restaurant just won't be worth most people's time. Yes, it really is that bad. Yes, you will probably regret it. Sorry to be the bearer of bad news, but that's the way Dan cooks his pizza.
Overpriced!!!AYCE lunch heavy in the rice,chewy seaweed. PEPSI IS OVER $2!!!! FOR A SODA.. Staff was nice but wouldn't recommend the lunch sushi at least.

Ordered take-out by phone for lunch - the girl on the phone couldn't tell me if she was on the river side of Jefferson Hwy.  Told there would be a twenty minute wait.  Got to the place to pick up, greeted by a very young lady, with a very young man at the grill.  Ordered chef salad with grilled chicken, and fried mozzarella sticks.  After she spilled all her receipts in the dish water, she grabbed my boxes.  I opened them to look for sauce (none provided for the cheese sticks) and utensils.  After trying to give me  cocktail sauce, then a couple phone calls, they finally found the marinara sauce.  Got to my office to discover that my chef salad was lettuce, meat, and cheese.  No tomatoes, no onions, no eggs.

Called to ask when the miniature golf course closed, was told 11, and online said 11....show up at 10 and are told it's closed cause they are understaffed....after calling to make sure. Guy working the front was rude and had an attitude as well. What a joke.

I really like Korean BBQ. When I heard this place was opening, I was very excited to try this place. When I finally tried it, I was very disappointed for a few reason.

1. This spot is probably one of the most expensive Korean BBQ places around town.

2. The side dishes were horrible. The kimchi was also not good. 

3. The meets had some flavor, but it feels like they don't marinate 

The reason I couldn't give this place 1 star is because of their service. They were very informative.

Bread great! Steak was not cooked to order at all, but it was comped after we said something. Cioppino was in a dee red paprika like sauce.  It was ok.  Mahi was good.  Kids grilled chicken was terrible, overcooked and dry. Kids popcorn shrimp were good.  I'd skip it for the price and find elsewhere. The giant fish tank you can view from the outside hallway and the gift shop is worth a view too.

No alcohol...wtf?  I wanted a draft beer and the server said they don't have draft beer.  I then said no problem, I will just have a vodka tonic...."we don't have alcohol either"...lol.  So I just had an iced tea which was fine.  The food, however, was terrible.  The restaurant looks like it hasn't been updated in 50 years and was just a dump inside.  Being from New Jersey and being a chef I have had great Italian food in NY, NJ, and many other states. This was very poor quality Italian...the red sauce had no flavor and tasted like they just opened a can of sauce.  The cheese was a cheap mozzarella also with no flavor.  The menu was very limited and it was hard to order anything because everything sounded so basic.  I had the chicken parm,  the serving size was small, it was overpriced, it didn't come with any pasta under it or on the side...just chicken on plate.  Very poor presentation as well.  I had a side salad with the meal and McDonald's makes a better salad than his place.  If you want good Italian food...don't go here:

Came for few days for conference. I would never voluntarily stay here. Basically the quality of a holiday inn but with large fake garden in it. Food is very low quality. You always expect to pay more when stuck somewhere, but Gaylord charges exhorbitant mark up. Breakfast of scrambled eggs with home fries and milk...$30. It has all the kitsch of Vegas or Disney, same prices, but no casino or entertainment. Not close to downtown Nashville. Would not voluntarily subject myself to the Gaylord opryland.

The food can be better. 
There were lot of dishes and lot of choices, both in vegetarian and non-vegetarian. 
The ambience of the restaurant is grand. 
The taste of food is not matching the grandeur of the restaurant.

Not sure whats so special about this place. Ive been there twice. The first time the service was good the second time, the cashier obviously did not want to be there which isnt a huge deal but ok. I paid 16 dollars for cookies and 2 small ice creams. I could understand if the cookies were something special but honestly ive had better cookies at frys. How is your whole business model based around cookies and there is absolutely no creativity in the cookie choices. The "premium" cookies have some flair but maybe try something other than chocolate. This place is way overpriced and not even that good. Im not wasting my money there again.

What a scam!  Buyer beware.  They advertise a huge custom frame sale.  Over 60% off.   I go in and after designing they tell me the cost is over $600 for a relatively small picture and with the sale it will be around $250.  Other frame shops near by quoted me around $300 for the exact same thing with NO discount.  Seems like AC Moore did the ole' jack up the price so the sale will actually equal more then the regular price.  Shame on you.

Lil Dizzy's -  Wow,  it's been a minute and since the restaurant has moved it has been a big disappointment. The whole experience warrants this 1 star.

I don't like when the server puts a check down before your order comes , and she rushes payment by saying "I need you to pay so I can close out" while we were eating. They closed at 2, and it was about 1:45pm. There was a buffet and she didn't explain that I couldn't get my side from the buffet, therefore she charged me for "smothered potatoes" which were not and she still brought the side of smothered potatoes from the same place I got mine from! The salad was old and wack. The fried chicken was overly greasy, and over breaded. There were no good side options. Just don't go there unless you are looking for an early heart attack from greasy, disappointing food and bad customer service. Maybe it was the timing, but that should not reflect on the service we had, or the food.

I have been coming to GSR for a very long time, to the point that many of the employees know me or my husband. I have been to Lex many times, mostly getting a VIP but sometimes just to enjoy a nice out. My most recent visit to see Fetty Wap was horrible, it's sad to me that an establishment like Lex doesn't have a better management and is completely unorganized.  To start we got in the VIP line and our ticket that had our table # was lost, so we waited a good 45 minutes to even get through the door.  I had already given them my credit card when we got there. When the hostess came to our table and took our order she asked for my card, I told her I had already given it and she said ok she would look in the back. She came back about 15 minutes later and said they couldn't find it. Me and my husband had to go out to the front and ask around to look for it. Apparently it was randomly in on of the black books they carry out front.  So now the hostess leaves to get our drinks.  They never brought our mixers or our ice so the hostess had to get everything herself, she was actually working very hard.  I appreciated her. We finally get to having a drink about 2 hours later. 
If that were the last issue I don't think I would be so frustrated. I read another review where the manager responded they don't deny guest water.  I walked to the empty front bar to ask for water and the bartender told me they don't provide water I would have to buy it. After I just paid for my VIP, I see one of the front guys I believe his name was Roman and I tell him. He said don't worry I got you, he sends a bucket of water with a receipt for $36 I told the random hostess I'm not paying for this I just wanted one water cup for my husband who wasn't feeling well. She gets Roman and he acts like he had never spoke to me and didn't know what I was talking about and the girl snatches the water off the table and walks away.

The food here is so average it's not worth the money. Go next door to IHOP... prices are pricey for a Diner....
I got the all American Burger and it Didn't taste like ANYTHING... the patty was not seasoned and it didn't even come with any condiments or fries!!!!! Just a 50 cent bag of chips... no pickle.. 
Hubby got the French toast breakfast,,, and the toast well... it tasted like white bread with eggs whisked in... disgusting.. 
the portions are rather big but it doesn't make up for the fact that everything lacks flavor.. never coming back here

I went to DiNardo's because I love seafood and ready many reviews that this was one of the BEST seafood restaurants in Philly. Well, I disagree. We went for blue crabs, but they ran out 9 days ago. Okay, it happens. We ordered the crab soup. It tasted like canned vegetable soup. We ordered a pound of overpriced snow crab legs. Nothing to jump for joy about. We paid extra for garlic butter, and that was the saving grace. We also ordered the broiled seafood platter where you got the smallest sea scallops, a soggy piece of farm raised tilapia, 6 jumbo shrimp, a half pound of snow crabs and a silver dollar sized crab cake. The crab cake was the standout on the dish. I opted to take the fish home and finish cooking it. 

We also ordered cocktails. They were just okay. The ambiance was dated and could use new or cleaned carpets. We tried it. Likely will not be back. Next stop: Devon's!
I love Popeyes and unfortunately this is the closest one to me.  The service is horrible, you'll end up waiting forever to get helped.  They can't seem to get their act together here.

Upon arriving for my 7:30 reservation a bit early I was told quite quickly by the host that it would be about 5 mins. That was it, no please feel free to grab a drink at the bar, have a seat while you wait, nothing. After about 10 mins waiting I made my way to the bar to order a glass of wine for me and my guest. The bartender walked by multiple times without acknowledging me or offering a menu, I took a menu from a guest next to me. When he finally come to take my order there was no hello, no how are you, no sentence at all. It was just a simple word.. Drink? No smile nothing at all to make me feel welcomed.

When we were finally sat, our server came by. Once again no smile, no hello, how are we tonight? Just her name and weather we wanted tap or bottle water. Through out the course of our meal, she was inattentive, in-personable, barely smiling or trying to interact with us. 

The biscuits they dropped at the beginning of our meal where the highlight of the evening, the butters perfect and the biscuits wonderfully fluffy and layered to perfection

We started with some snacks, pig ears came out overly salted, and room temp and chewy. As if they'd been sitting a minute. The conch fritters were good, well seasoned and the sauce added great balance.

We finished up and what I'm assuming was a service manager or floor manager came by with our second course... mind you we had not been cleared or re-silvered from our first course. Instead of turning around and clearing us before dropping food, he simply dropped the courses and walked away.. coming back after a few minutes to clear the dirty plates and drop new share plates. 

Our second courses were the gulf shrimp with Calabrian Chile's which were tasty, and a very good dish... the tuna tartar on the other hand was again extremely salty, maybe due to seasoning before considering that salty tobiko/caviar of some type was going on top which made the dish almost inedible. 

This time our plates were cleared and we did get re silvered. For our entrees we ordered the "acclaimed" curry goat and the red fish dish.

Neither dish wowed me. The fish was one dimensional, there was no textural contrast in the dish. The sauce, the fish, the garnish, was all soft, room temp, and this time extremely under seasoned. It was lacking some sort of acidity and crunch to wake it up. The goat was under seasoned as well and lacking depth. Though the gnocchi was very well cooked and made it was not enough to save the dish. The sad thing is, even though our distaste was apparent, the server made no inquire as to why we hadn't eaten our entrees. no manager came to check on us, it seemed as though the staff was just floating through their night. 

I expected a lot more from the service and food for a restaurant as widely acclaimed as this one is. Nothing about this evening screamed best new chef, James beard award nominee, or eater hot 38. This was appalling service from start to finish and the food to match. Definitely sucks when you're on vacation and this is your one special meal and you get the bill and are out 200 dollars after tip for something you wish never happened.

We ended up skipping dessert and going someplace else.

Edit* Extremely disappointed at the fact that I have yet to receive any response from the management. You would think that they would want to at least try to redeem them selves for this but alas... just floating through on the laurels

My husband and I each had the breakfast sandwich - would say it was decent with a good portion of eggs but nothing that we couldn't have made at home. I would be willing to try the other location but unfortunately this was an hour long breakfast that would have been 15mins anywhere else. The employees there was nice but they are grossly understaffed, not compatible with a kitchen where the eggs are being cooked on a dorm style griddle.

Do they charge a down payment for parts before they can order the parts.... Because I'm bein charged $500 down payment for parts on my 99 Cadillac Deville. Which needs the ignition switch repaired, a cylidar, battery and keys... They failed to mention this information on Monday when they told me that the rapairs where goimg to be $973 to start with, which included taxes, labor and parts. Someone please tell me if I'm supposed to make a down payment for parts......?

Nothing really went right during this experience. Ignored by wait staff, wrong food given, exceptionally slow service, over 1 hr to receive water after placing food order.  As a life long resident of New Orleans I normally try to avoid tourist focused restaurants like this, and tonight confirmed the reason why

I was hoping for better given the reviews. The delivery was quick, but came with no utensils. I was staying at a hotel, which they knew. The chili dumplings were excellent. The lo mien was very average.

The play area is quite good and big. They have a few pretty impressive play structures so lots for the kids to do. I had the banana bread and breakfast sandwich. The food is much to write home about. The banana bread taste like it's probably store bought and the breakfast sandwich resembles the pre-cooked variety. They are not unreasonable for the price. My biggest dislike about this cafe, however, is the fact that all of their utensils, cups, and plates are disposable. For that reason alone, I probably won't come back.

This place was just OK. They did a really good job on my nails... but they should have considering it took 90 minutes for a fill and pedicure!!  I'm used to getting both done in 45, so this felt SOOOO long. If you're in a hurry, don't go there.  But if you don't mind a little extra time, you might be just fine!

Had an appt for hitch install. Called the day before to verify. Spoke with call center cause no one answers their phone. Call center said hitch was available. Showed up for appt and hitch was not available.  And that I only scheduled for light kit. Also saying hitch will not fit car even though their website says it will.   Don't come here. Terrible service. No one has a clue what's going on.

Had better buffet in Reno for breakfast. They should really learn how to properly make an omelet. Take lessons from charlie's buffet at Atlantis Hotel! Cook ingredients before putting the scrambled egg. County Fried steak was hard.

The armature works location thinks it's okay to not wear anything on their head... there was hair baked into my pizza. When we informed the employees all they had to say was "oh" and had the nerve to ask if we wanted to take it home. Spare yourself the extra hair in your food and try somewhere else.

Bought a house through CF bank, and the bank sold the loan to 
Franklin American mortgage. It has been a nightmare! I hand delivered the checks because I wasn't receiving the "mortgage due" statements.
They never contacted me. I had to call the bank infinite times asking for the information. Then I manage to contact someone, set up the automatic withdrawal from my bank account, and Franklin removed it!
They sent a letter 3 weeks later saying the names didn't match! It was a middle initial which didn't appear on the bank account, then franklin sent me a letter saying the mortgage had not been paid! It's ridiculous how  the notifications to blame you for  supposedly Not paying the loan, arrive at the correct address and NOT the statements or the paper telling you they removed the automatic payment!
I sent checks with 2 month payments on them, but they  took weeks to post, but they sent me the letter saying ti was going to collections, and default! Even though the checks were cashed! They are absolutely the worst, I have to believe it's a scam to ruin people's credit.

Very disappointed when we visited this restaurant on Saturday. First off you pay for parking I think $5.50 an hour (we bought two hours which was unnecessary, machine had small sign say Buy one Cocktail get one Free at Sculleys). Hostess asked where we want to sit, we said on the water, she said first come first serve, and we were pointed to the 3rd tiki and take a right to a dock with a platform of seats. We sat down at a decent place. I got to order margaritas blind sided with no price ($8.75 per small solo cup for house margarita btw). Ordered the firecracker shrimp because the waiter admitted when asked about conch fritters that it's mainly bread. Anyway, we won't be back due to only one drink was buy one get one and the food wasn't good, tasted like fried frozen food you can buy at local grocery. Save your hard earned money on something fresh and authentic, if you want expensive cheap food that you can get fast....then then is your place.

Garbage of hotel. I checked in, got into the room and left the AC unit cooling down the room at 67 degrees, after two hours i returned and the room is 76 degrees still.
Went to the front desk at around 945pm and i was told they were sending someone to check the AC. 
At 11:50 pm we still didn't have anyone come check the unit and it kept turning on and off. Despite the complaint the clerk at the front desk said she will have maintenance check . The guy came and all he said was "it's cool" in here , it's 70 degrees and walked away.  
I will never stay in this garbage again. I had a long drive to Tampa and all I wanted was a cold room to relax. 

DO NOT RECOMMEND!!  Plus the rooms are extremely small and overpriced !

My friend suggested we go here after I took her to the phenomenal tea room in Wayne called A Taste of Britain. Unfortunately this place doesn't even come close. I think the only reason people go to The Simpson House is because of the Groupon/Local Flavor coupon voucher. That alone should tell you something. First, the people who work there have an attitude and are not welcoming at all. Next, the food was horrible. We got the $20/person tea for 2. The sandwich selection was horrendous: only 2 savory and the rest sweet. Plus add a sweet scone and a dessert! You body will go into diabetic shock if you eat all that sugar! For what I ate, it was completely overpriced. They also have this weird rule that you can't take the dessert home. Odd. No matter, I will never be back. And seriously, if you're looking for a quality place to have an authentic English tea experience (owned and operated by an actual Brit) drive to Wayne and try A Taste of Britain. You won't be disappointed!

I was denied service dog access by the manager the Sunday before the last. I had documentation of his services but he denied me access because he said "the dog is too young". This is inaccurate and it goes against Federal law. I had to leave the dog on the boat and had to stick with my group in order for them to aid me. I never even attempted to go inside the establishment wit the service dog I was outside in the patio with him ...I felt horrible after this event.

Forget the star, I wish I could give crossbones. They Steal Here. It pains me to say it, but I in fairness must. I checked in with a pair of "Beats" headphones. When I checked out, they (whom ever, I suspect housekeeping) had "borrowed my Beat's Headphones. My suggestion is if you can't carry it in your pocket, don't bring it! Naw'l better still stay where they don't steal! Never again will I stay at this overpriced, underwhelming dump! PS. They steal here!!!

This place is SKETCHY. As soon as my sister and I sat down, the nail technician insisted that we get gel polish instead of regular polish. I get my nails done regularly - I know when I want regular polish and when I want to upgrade to gel polish. When we asked what the price increase would be, we were told that it was "just better" and would "last longer" rather than giving a straight answer. We assumed the price increase was minimal, which was our mistake. The whole process was rushed and awkward. My sister did not receive a pedicure or manicure, just a gel polish change, and her total was $65!! When we asked why it was such a steep price when she didn't receive any manicure services, we were told that "that's what gel costs" when she had REFUSED to tell us earlier! Also, the nail techs force you to say how much you want to tip OUT LOUD, rather than signing the receipt yourself. And above all else, the worst offense of all - my nail technician ran my card for me while my toe nails dried and he forced me to tell him my PIN NUMBER!! When I asked if I could input the PIN number myself, he simply said "no." I'm contacting my bank tonight and getting a new card in the mail tomorrow. There was no one else in the salon when the two of us were there, and now we know why.

Stopped by for a late lunch today around 1:30pm to miss all of the crowds from the convention downtown. We were told service at the bar would be quick but experienced the complete opposite. Wait staff was friendly, but our sides arrived after we had already finished our burgers. As well several other staff were shouting at each other from across the bar interrupting any type of conversation being had. Would only come back for the ice cream!
Voorhees restaurant had a horrible musty smell that ruined my appetite. The only reason I stayed is because I was with a large group, otherwise I would have walked out.

I doubt the young lady behind the bar could be any more pretentious. It's a fucking cocktail.  Back in the day we called it hospitality.  Since when has the bartender become more important than the customer?

How many people does it take to change a lightbulb? At this chipotle about 12 people. I went there and there were 0 customers in the store and about 10-12 employees. I waited about 5 minutes until the 1 employee in the front cleaned off the prep counter or whatever he was doing and took my order While all his coworkers stood around and were talking to each other, on cell phones ect.  Manager/owner needs to monitor his business/ employees better. Next, I don't know why..but when you ask for avocado they are so stingy and they never forget to mention "it's extra money".  I agree to pay extra for it so Stop acting stingy and give me a full scoop, and not a little bird turd scoop.  I'm paying extra for it and it's not coming out of your pocket. WTF. Maybe you should start charging extra for plastic forks, spoons, napkins, and hot sauce. Then when I get to the register I asked for a receipt and the machine was out of paper. Someone was not doing their job, wait...about 10 people weren't doing their job. Seriously, go get a job at Walmart where you can stand around, do nothing, and get paid. You get 1 star because compared to the one at the Plymouth Meeting Mall, the ingredients seem more fresh at this location. Other than that 0 stars for this bad experience
waited for a 37 min on food. the place wasn't even crowded. two other couples just left money for their drinks on the table and walked out.

Don't come here for a birthday celebration. This is how your table will look while you are eating your desserts. 
This was absolutely disgusting and made our first and last experience here awful, on top of the SLOW service and waiting 20 minutes to be seated even though I made reservations.

Food was good. But my daughter and I had food poisoning. We got food on Friday August 24th. And we were sick all night and the next day. So, on Saturday we couldn't enjoy Nashville because we were sick.  Very disappointed.

Local ice cream shop in a small town. I love supporting the local mom and pops stores so I came here expecting great things! Frosty Boy have decent soft serve ice cream in vanilla and chocolate flavors. They do have a weekly special flavor as well so keep your eyes out for those! I was disappointed that they do not offer sprinkles, only dipped or crunch toppings. An ice cream shop without sprinkles! What?! I was shocked when the cashier told me this. But milkshakes are good and have a thick consistency to it. The strawberry milkshake actually tasted like strawberry and not artificial flavoring. They have a large selection of food if you want to swing on by for lunch or dinner. Overall, it is a decent ice cream shop but nothing too special.

This location is TERRIBLE. Order from any other location if you can. The last 3 times I ordered, my pizza was delivered AT LEAST an hour past when it said it was supposed to be delivered. This past time, when I called to check on it, I was told "I don't deal with the delivery end of things." I had to wait 15 minutes on hold just to find out the status of my already 1.5-hour late order. Seriously.....ANY other location is better than this one.

Very disappointing experience- none of the food that is advertised on the website and pictured on yelp is actually served in-house. Selection is limited to literally 5 menu items (thats all for apps and dinner). Even the regular bar menu that is served during the week wasn't available on a Saturday. Drinks are ok but nothing to come back for....3 drinks cost 60$)

Dirty. Dirty. Dirty. That's all I can say about this place. I love the food but this location was gross. There was a spilled drink all over he ground as soon as you walk in. The bathroom had a puddle of god knows what on the floor. I wish I went to the drive through. Won't be going back to this location if o can help it.

After eating at Golden Corral I have to say that I was very disappointed overall. After walking in I could tell that the restaurant was more hectic and crowded than a normal buffet. The best part of our evening was our waitress Kristen, she brought a friendly vibe to our dining experience, but after that everything seemed to go downhill. The chicken was dry compared to the last time I was there, but the fish was good. All of the other food was nothing special and could be made at home. One of the better parts of my evening was the desert section because they had a chocolate fountain which is rarely ever seen at restaurants. There cheesecake was very good even though the pieces were very little, but there red velvet cake was dry. I was also disappointed because there ice cream machine froze so I was unable to get the favor I wanted. If your looking for average food and want to pay way too much than I would suggest Golden Corral.

This is the ugly stepsister of the three Marriott properties in the Reno Area. The rooms feel worn out and in need of an update. I am a Marriott Gold member and honestly surprised by the prices that Marriott charges. If they charge those price shouldn't their customers expect more? 

There are plenty of places to eat nearby but remember you are not close to downtown.

The person at the front desk told me that they would be updating the hotel soon. 

I might check back in 2019 but in the meantime will choose somewhere else to stay.

I visited here for the first time today.   I have to be honest, it wasn't a good experience for me.  The place was disheveled, some of the basins for the pedicures were really dirty, and it seemed chaotic.  After reluctantly sitting down, I was given a lousy 20 minute (at best) pedicure.  Where the dry stations are located is so small, so cramped.  I couldn't wait to get out.  After leaving, I noticed several toes weren't even polished completely, the tips were white and my heels were rough.  I couldn't go back in; I had an appointment to keep. When I got home I completely repainted my toes.  Just a total waste of money.  I'd never go back!

Unfortunately, just a real disappointment. I am a fan of the Billion Dollar Buyer and expected so much more. Love McCormick and Scmick's. Love Morton's. Entertain clients regularly at both venues. Took my sales team to Landry's just outside the Hilton Curio Union Station in St Louis. Ordered plank salmon and it was so overdone and dry that I turned the entire cedar plank board upside down and the burnt salmon stuck to it. Our server was great and offered a replacement meal. My guests were well into their meals, so I just ordered a shrimp cocktail. I guess I expected so much more being that this is the flagship. Beautiful venue in an area that is going through a resurgence. Nonetheless, it really fell flat in a great food town like St. Louis. With restaurants like Morton's and McCormick in the arsenal, dining patrons expect an elevated experience. I was so excited to go. First impressions mean so much. Lack of execution was all I could think of. Expected so much more. A $500 evening needs to be so much better than this.

Giving 1 star because no option to give negative stars. Used to be an ok enough diner but thoroughly disgusting now. My sandals were sticking to the very gross carpet! Salt was all over the booth seat. Explains why there was only 1 customer in the whole place. We couldn't stay. Gave us the willies.

I walked in and stood at the counter for 2 minutes before even being acknowledged, manager walked by and didn't even greet me. Very poor customer service. After I ordered to eat in the restaurant and got my drink, I had a seat and waited for my food. I saw an employee walk around with a to go bag looking for who it belonged to, she went back behind the counter and then emerged with a receipt and an empty tray. She aplogized for putting it in a to go bsg and handed me the empty tray. The food was served hot and typical for the chain, but what is lacking is the human interaction and customer service. I refuse to order at a do it yourself kiosk, that is what the employees get paid to do. Without the human customer service...what do they have?
Someone needs to teach these guys how to make a Rueben. Worst I have ever eaten. If rest of sandwiches are the same I will not be back!
Overpriced and not worth the hype. The food is okay, but nothing I couldn't cook at home. I don't enjoy spending 15 dollars on a meal if I don't leave full and I'm not wowed by it.

Nothing against these post offices we walk into. My problem just occurred this way: 
I sent an overnight package (they can't guarantee anything else). $27 guarantees it gets there by 3 pm or my money back. It got there a day late. Went to get my money back. Online doesn't work. Called phone number. Long hassle. I go through it. Then, "wait for next available agent. Your wait time is between an hour 40 minutes & an hour 50 minutes!! This is at 10:15 on a typical Thursday. 
I have always been a big fan of the Post Office. But who can stay on hold that long. That's absurd. And I tried calling customer service but you can only respond to what they offer you to respond to.

This casual seafood restaurant is situated in an atmospheric spot at the end of the pier in Santa Barbara and had been recommended to us by two different acquaintances. However, we were all disappointed with the quality of our meals. The New England clam chowder was pasty, thickened with flour. The coconut shrimp tasted like what I can buy by the bag frozen at Trader Joe's.  And the prices were quite high given the quality.  Overall, we've found the quality of food in the Santa Barbara restaurants to be amazing, but I wouldn't recommend this place.

Great food. Drink orders took forever, and for a while my table of 5 were the only ones there. At the end of the meal they informed us that they could only take cash because their machine was down. Didn't offer to take an imprint the old fashioned way. Nope, they said that there was an ATM down the street. We were having torrential rains, and we were told to go get cash. A friend said this happened to him before. 

Not worth the trouble.

Terrible food great location (Hyde Park)
Italian Restaurant ?the bread is Burger mini rolls???
Kids' chicken fingers:Almost black(Fried in very old oil)
Calamari:Almost Black 
My daughter (8 years old) suggested me not to go there anymore which I agree.

Our server, Brittney, has zero respect for patriots. I told her that the way she talked about customers was unacceptable and rude. She could only say OK. Her coworkers fed into it and discussed others within our ear shot. We will not be back to this location.

We love Chinese and Vietnamese food.  We tried this place twice thinking the first time may have been a bad day for the chef.  It's a two time loser.  Don't bother.  I have yet to find really good Chinese food in the area.  We will continue our quest.

Not sure if this is a mistake, but google maps says this McDonald's is open 24/7, but I came at 12:30 and the woman in the drive through said it was closed. My bf called and the woman picked up and left the phone off the hook, we could hear her shuffling around in the background.

Was scheduled to have lawn cut with over grown fee today. Quoted $82 dollars. Upon arrival of the lawn care professional, who I must say was very kind, i was sent a new quote. Because of the time scheduled by the company (3:30 p.m.), he told me that the lawn would not be able to be cut today. Now I had to wait until Sunday for my lawn to be mowed. Furthermore, the new quoted price from the company was $154, almost a 50% increase on their quoted price. I'm not sure if any company that would charge over $100 dollars to cut this lawn, very disappointed.
This was like cafeteria or dorm food but without any of the flavor. Good staff though

I recently moved to St Pete from NYC and at first glance I was excited for a great healthy smoothie. $14 for a smoothie and $5 for a coffee. Those prices are ridiculous compared to NYC. The coffee was regular drip not some artisan coffee. The smoothie took 30min to get because the staff was too busy talking.

Really disappointed with this place. We paid $20/person to stand in the back of a tiny packed room. I was still able to see the band just fine though. We went for the last show at 10pm on Saturday night. The whole band was half asleep. No energy. No soul. Sour faces. Reluctantly getting up to play. Eyes closed when they aren't playing. All frowns. It was really sad...like they were overworked horses. It really killed the mood. Understandably, the audience was all stiff because of it. Didn't feel like a jazz band at all. The band leader on piano kept talking, but we couldn't hear any of it because he's so soft spoken. No drinks sold inside, but they let you bring in drinks from outside. 40min show. Honestly, I enjoyed the free bands playing outside more.

This place NEVER HAS BRISKET!!!! We went for the first time to try it out. (We've gone but they never have brisket so we leave) so I decided to try it out. Heck I was starving so why not.  Turkey was not good at all, my son hated the mac n cheese, he hardly touched the turkey. I'm telling you coming from a prior TX resident. Do yourself a favor and don't try this place. What a let down.... will NEVER GO BACK!

Portion sizes are kinda disappointing for the price. Many of the rice dishes are basically just some pan fried chicken breast smothered in sauce and served with plain white rice. The general tso's and teriyaki are decent, but I find that the meat is often dry and rubbery. Not really impressive, but if you need a quick fix of cheap and spicy Americanized Asian food, the $5 general tso's is hard to beat for value. The salads also offer pretty good variety, but I wish the ahi tuna salads had large chunks of fish, rather than the kind-of ground up raw tuna that they last served it with.

If you're expecting the regular brunch foods, don't come here! The menu is decent but maybe we just weren't in the mood for such heavy meals. My boyfriend and I both got eggs and biscuits (two sides) - way over seasoned with pepper and made us feel like crap after.  It got busy at noon but at 11am there was barely any wait. Staff was friendly and we didn't have to wait long for our food. I give it two stars because I don't think they use quality ingredients and there's no reason to dress up an egg so much.

Once again visiting the wonderful city of Tampa. As we carefully choose our place to have dinner, we made the mistake of walking into American Social. As we approach the restaurant from the outside, we see 10+ tables outside, empty. We are then told there is a 45 minute wait to be seated outside. One of the best parts of Tampa is the waterfront. When we mention the empty tables outside the hostess was very aggressive towards us saying "there are reservations dude, you should of called one in."

We then ask to talk to a manager who was as useful as a waterproof towel. He explains how they take reservations hours in advance and reserve the tables until the guests arrive. 

I guess this establishment did not want to make 3 paying customers happy and therefore lost our business. 0/10 
A bird in the hand.
Beer was great, food was okay, service was abysmal. Every staff member besides the hostess was so rude. Wasn't even busy so I don't understand why they were so unpleasant.

This place is ok, it wasn't good.  I'm actually surprised that so many people rave about the food.  Maybe I ordered the wrong thing?   We had pizza and a salad.  The salad was just meh.. and not worth $11 for a small salad.   The pizza was not that good...wasn't impressed.  Honestly I make better pizza at home.  I hand toss my own pizza dough and know the difference between hand tossed and rolled.    The crust is too thin for the pizzas here, and it has the texture like it was rolled and cut in a circle.   The edges/crust of the pizza were burned.  These should be toasted.   It's like they were trying to be New York style pizza, but they missed the mark completely.   

I wouldn't be surprised if they use pre-made dough because it just didn't have a decent texture.  You could tell the yeast in the dough wasn't doing it's job.  They likely make the dough way ahead of time and then try to get it to rise.  But if you leave mixed dough in the fridge a few days after it's bee mixed and the pull it out to ride the chemicals will not react the same and the dough will be super lack luster and not rise enough.   The crust at this restaurant was just not good.  The pizza sauce was a bit too sweet.  The pepperoni was on the sweeter side as well.   They should make the sauce less sweet so it's sweetness doesn't overpower the pepperoni they use.

I don't think I'll go back.  I wasn't really happy with the experience.

One of the worst restaurant experiences I've ever had. Bad music way too loud - they literally played the Electric Slide at top volume at 7:30 as people were eating. service was atrocious, and at 7p on a Sunday night they'd already run out of the two dishes my wife and I wanted to order. What was served was awful - congealed lobster bisque. Please avoid this place if you truly want to "chill".
Very disappointing seem to be prepetully temporary closed. The excuse was maintained at first now what excessive heat possibly.
do not a rent car from them  u will loose your money. they will charge u after u deliver the car for clean even if u clean it. and they charge u for smoke even if u didnt smoke. they just thief

I was really looking forward to visiting Newtown's first French cafe. What a disappointment. There is nothing about it that seems French other than a small assortment of French pastries. My family of 4 was the only order they had to take while we were there on a Sunday afternoon. They made each item (2 crepes and 2 waffles) one at a time and brought them out one at a time, several minutes apart. By the time my daughter got her undercooked (wet inside) waffle, everyone else was done and ready to go. The crepes were just ok, but my children's waffles did not come with the toppings they ordered. One ordered bananas and Nutella, the other strawberries and bananas with Nutella. Both had weird toppings like apple, cantaloupe, blueberries, and grapes. We sent back the last Waffle and left, resulting in a very disappointed child. I will not be back. 
Only positive: my husband says his latte was good.

The service was great but the food was TERRIBLE. I had the driest chicken in my tacos and cant tell if the corn tortillas were either old or poorly defrosted, I'm not sure, but they were chewy in a bad way. I was really disappointed overall and don't care to revisit. At least we got free chips and salsa when we sat down.

Unbelievable first time experience here at this Wendy's  in Tucson.  Ordered my meal which came to $15.17. I gave them a $15 gift card and a dollar bill to cover the 17 cents. Simple right? After the cashier called another teenager over because he did not understand how to do the gift card they handed the gift card back to me told me that I had $.83 left on the gift card. I explain to them that the gift card was $15 and since the total was 15.17 they owed me .83 cents. THEN.... The teenage female manager gets involved trying to convince me that I have a balance on the gift card! After explaining twice the SIMPLE math involved she gives me my change which was incorrect so I waited again to get the correct amount of change. Very scary Knowing this is Americans future in making it great again!  I understand now why it has a two star rating For this store. Need some adults here to supervise the children

I just went to try to mail something and they are not open. I walked over a mile to get here with two kids and says they're open until two on Saturdays but they were CLOSED. 

Your best bet is just going to the post office because they at least are open when they say they will be
Worst experience ever. Provided by the management  assuming we "stole a table" from other guest. We ended up getting up and leaving because it was so uncomfortable.

We have been to this restaurant on multiple occasions. I have given it an honest try! But each and EVERY time they get the order wrong or items are missing!!! They make you pull to the front and wait for your food, which would be awesome if they got the order correctly, since they're supposedly making our food while we wait 20 minutes or more sometimes! I'm done! Will NOT go back to this Burger King! Waste of money!

Have you ever eaten food from one of those sketchy Freddy Krueger looking gas stations in the middle of BFE New Jersey? You know the places where you just know you can't make it out of there without at least a touch of something that will make your belly swim around the stink tank for a couple of days? Well if you want that same experience but without the drive or risk of loss of life this place has got you covered. 

Completely average, yet very dry, cheesesteak with a very nice wait staff that refused to provide us any water with our meal. Enjoy!

The food here was "just OK" in my opinion. I had the Pad Thai and it just didn't have that authentic flavor I've had many times before. It wasn't a stand-out. Spring Rolls were very good. Friends had the fried rice and stir fried veggies with brown sauce and they have had better at other Thai restaurants. They weren't impressed either. Nicely decorated restaurant....food wasn't that great.
Not the best experience I had the Thai Shrimp Salad. I would just say I am reminded why I never go to this Applebee's.

Really deserves 0 stars for customer service, ability to diagnose issues properly, and price.  Incorrectly replaced 2 tires to correct a problem they diagnosed that had nothing to do with the tires.  Asked for a discount to do the actual repair and they offered a few dollars off that still left the price higher than their competitors.  Don't let them do any auto repairs unless you want to pay more money for poor workmanship and service.

Update:  I was offered a refund for the 3 tires they replaced.  The catch is that I had to bring 3 new tires and pay for having them put on the car.   Can anyone explain how that makes any sense?  Neither could they.    Laughable.
Some of the rudest service i have ever received. The man at the counter literally threw my credit card at me. While being a total a$$.

15 minutes plus wait for a drink. Great location but it seems as though they've already turned into a nicer version of hooters. Too many guys and too many bartenders that no drink making skills but look great. Wish they would've made it more like the Miami version. Bathrooms are a miss being so small for a place that large.
They did not have baked beans!!! This is prepostrious!!!! How could they not have the most basic necessities that all "good" restaurants should have!

The Man behind the counter made reservations for Us but forgot to mention they were at another KOA 30 miles away.
This KOA is on a busy Freeway.
5 feet between Sites
Dont let this happen to you

There's always wet floors from soda machines they always leave it wet. And popcorn all over the floors no one cleaThe theaters a lot of times people aren't quiet they just act stupid all loud laughing. People are gushing them and nothing is done. And a lot of the reclining seats are broken. There's a young African American manager I tried to talk to and he just walked away instead of dealing with the issues. Had to wait to speak to another manager when they came in hours later. 
This AMC needs to have someone check on people. There's people there that just come in for free.

How do you run out of potatoes at a breakfast restaurant on a Sunday morning? This the 3rd time this has happened to me at this particular location? It's not like there is a potatoe shortage? Make more potatoes. I am able to write this review because this is taking forever. Time to find a new breakfast restaurant

My family and I took my mom here for her 61st birthday. It was her first time experiencing the habachi grill. Our chef was amazing and the food was delicious, which Is why this review even got 1 star, but our server was the absolute worst. We were a party of 12 and when we were seated the table did not have enough dishes or menus. Our server was very rude when we requested more. My aunt has a mushroom and shrimp food allergy but the server proceeded to give her a soup full of mushroom flakes anyway. Once the chef began preparing our food, we did not see our server again... she didn't stop by to check on our needs and even the chef was looking around for her. All of our cups were empty and in need of a refill, so I had to get up from my seat and search around for our waiter to inform her that we needed refills. She exclaimed that she had other tables to tend to... which is fine but she never returned to check on us. I'm not sure if her customer service skills sucked because she knew gratuity was included regardless if she works or not, but thanks to her we will choose a different habachi restaurant in the future. Oh, and to put the cherry on top, my husband wanted a to-go water, since we had a 1 hour drive home, and of course our server was absent after we paid, so I proceeded to ask another server near the sushi bar, and he and his coworkers laughed right in my face and told me to ask my server... at this moment I was disgusted knowing I gave these people our hard earned money. Never again.

A very poor first response.
The service was so slow and the food was just okay.
Another restaurant in Santa Barbara that thinks mediocre food and service can be accepted by the tourists and who cares about the locals.

I was very disappointed with the breakfast food. I ordered delivery through UberEats and the hash brown casserole had a hard and dry cheese top and tasted absolutely horribly.The rest of the food we ordered was mediocre at best. I definitely will not be ordering food from this restaurant again.
Not the best check in. It took forever. For the price they charge maybe they should keep the rooms a little better. For top dollar I expect a little better.

Fui con mi familia a comer a este rest. Q nos habian recomendado pero el mesero nos trató de la patada muy malcriado y hasta tirando los platos al ponerlos en la mesa. Una experiencia horrible no volvemos ni lo recomendamos

I would of put 5 stars but this store doesn't have much as far as animals I went in today and they didn't have any cats didn't really have a good selection for the reptiles most of the tanks were empty. I did have a good encounter with staff they were very helpful and professional.
This place is awful. The whole staff talking bad about everyone who walks in and then are just rude when you are there. Definitely don't go here

Did not mind going to this restaurant though I don't consider it one of the best seafood places. But because it's less than a mile from my house and convenient I go. I do not participate in their $40 Buffet because I cannot eat $40 worth of food. And of course you cannot take it home with you. So I normally go in and order Seafood by the pound and take some home and make other meals from it. Last Friday I went, and it is busy because of Lent. However I  did not mind the  40-minute wait, Until they seated us and told us we could not order crawfish by the pound. They had a sign on the wall that stated how much crawfish was by the pound. Do you think they could have told us they were not selling it by the pound. Well if you think you're going to bamboozle me into a $40 Buffet you have another thought coming. I went to Perino's their crawfish is much better anyway tho it does cost more.  I will likely never go back to Zydeco's. I just think that was extremely disrespectful, inconsiderate, and rude

My husband and I have dined at this restaurant in the past with no issue and had a great experience. However, we decided to have dinner there last night and we were incredibly disappointed. We asked for a table for 3 due to us having our infant son in his carrier and were told the wait would be approximately 15 minutes. Well, 40 minutes go by and we understand that due to it being a Saturday and also prom night that it would be very busy. My husband went in to ask how much longer it would be and was told our "table for 2 would be called next." My husband corrected the host stating that it was a table for 3. The host told us "oh well that changes things it will be about 50 minutes." Obviously, we left. It's one thing to be busy, but we were basically punished for the host's mistake and were not even given an apology. Very poor customer service!!!

I have eaten at many Cracker Barrels all around this country and this by far was the worst service (other that our waitress) and food I have ever had the displeasure of visiting and eating at.
