Where to start, oh that's right, there was nowhere to start because EVERYTHING was bad! For starters although in some countries eating hair may be a delicacy but be rest assured its not in the U.S.A! The biscuit's were hard and overcooked, the hash browns were undercooked and mushy and their was a hair in my mothers eggs! Honestly, I could understand the hair thing because I have long hair and it sometime has a mind of its own but the entire meal was not cooked right and that is why I felt it was necessary to post a review. I have been there during the day and didn't have a problem but the night crew was "deplorable"!

What a disappointment. Was really looking forward to this since it was relatively close to work. I tried what they recommended at the most popular and it was really bland, even after I tried adding Shiracha and chili oil. Doubt I'll be coming back.

This is the worst establishment I have ever been to. They do not make your food properly here. I've been here 3 times and each time they have made my sandwich wrong. I keep giving them a chance and they keep proving they are awful.

A visit yesterday 5/10/18 turned out a very unpleasant experience. I wanted to love this place after walking past the place many times and seeing an interesting and varied menu. My husband, myself and mil went in around 4:40pm and were seated promptly in a booth. A drink menu was set on the table but all of us preferred just water. We looked over the menus and mil and I got Chicken breast with bacon on country bread with fries and husband ordered fish and chips. After waiting what seemed like forever( it was over 40 minutes) our server Jeff kept telling us our meals were on the way so we figured they went fishing or had to find a chicken to fetch on a farm?? The meals finally arrived..I must say the French fries were fabulous! The chicken a bit dry but edible with a smear of the mayo! My husbands piece of fish looked like a beached whale and when he cut into it out came runny oil all over the place with fish that was gray in color. It looked like blubber!! I asked a server to get the manager as we were disgusted already and now this.  She said oh I will get you the manager( she will probably comp you a free dessert???Really..that is going to make a wrong right? Manager comes over after a problem at the next booth and says "Oh I'm terribly sorry" I must find out what the problem is in the kitchen. Very surprised about your fish and chips cause it is a favorite of everyone. She came back totally walking past us not explaining at all but walks behind the bar and stood talking. Jeff the server comes over and says pick a free dessert..seriously???? The bill came and evidently took off the platter of fish but never came back. My mil had a comp anyway so it didn't matter at all. Very poor way to run a new establishment in the #1 casino in the state of Pennsylvania. I know that we won't be coming back there....reading other reviews on here I know I'm not the only person that encountered issues here.

The only good thing about this restaurant were the tortilla chips! They were authentic and tasty. Otherwise, everything else was void of flavor! Not sure how they call themselves authentic or Mexican when everything was bland bland bland. The queso tasted blander than white gravy, the chorizo wasn't spicy in the slightest, the rice was far overcooked and had no flavor! Do not eat here if you like any taste to your food!
Limited variety of frozen yogurt flavors to choose from, several toppings are available though to try and compensate. Price is reasonable, needs more seating.

OK, besides being INCREDIBLY overpriced, the food is muhh. Not much over a so - so quality. The waitress was new and therefore not very knowledgeable and service was slow and mediocre. I had such high expectations I guess because the name gives you good vibes like the song by Fats Domino. Fats would cry.

Writing this review from my booth. Let me preface this by saying I'm not one to complain. It took 15 minutes of being seated before the waitress showed, only came back when she delivered the food, never offered refills on drinks or brought waters, waited 20 minutes from finishing food before she came by to check on us and bring the bill. 1st and last time visiting this location.

Due to the paper thin outside walls, and proximity to the highway, if you love the sounds of nascar zooming around inside your room this is the place for you! If you don't avoid it like the fucking plague because when you ask for an inside facing room they will lie and tell you the hotel is full. Uh, it is a Tues. night and no one is here. 

I will never stay in another hotel owned by IHG again.

I came here while on a business trip based on their Yelp reviews. Ordered the beer cheese burger and it was beyond bad. Luckily the staff was very nice and the atmosphere was good. Probably a good spot to just drink.

Today was a nightmare at the salon. We've gone here before and not had a problem, today not so much. There was 3 nail technicians doing nails and I sat for over 2.5 hrs waiting to get a fill in. Upon walking in they gave no notification that they were running behind so I sat down not realizing that most of the people sitting at the nail stations had not been helped. Once the tech approached me to do my nails she took my polish off then someone walked in wanting a wax done so she stopped helping me to go do the wax. At this point I seriously thought about and should have just walked out but I stayed at which point another nail tech, a man this time came to start the process of doing my nails. I brought my own polish which was a glitter polish which I know was see through with blue and silver flecks of glitter because this was what I wanted. The male nail tech then told me I needed to put a color underneath, I DID NOT want a color underneath but he was not satisfied with that so he pushed until I caved and got a color (blue) that HE chose NOT ME! Had I been able to chose the under color I would've chosen a nude color because I DID NOT want solid blue nails, if I had wanted blue polish I would have chosen blue when I was asked about a color. They're excuse for the wait was that "it's tax time right now so we busy", how about y'all are usually busy so you were just under staffed for a Saturday. I am very unhappy with the service I received today as well as the way my bails turned out. Once I got home I notice a gap between where the acrylic is and where my cuticle is at my nail bed. I can honestly say that I will no longer be doing business here and will no longer tell anyone about this place.

Man, sad to say because I really tried to like this place. It's quiet and has a relaxed vibe, I'll give it that. It always seemed a bit over priced and a bit full of itself personality wise with bar tenders who seem disinterested or aloof but I'm forgiving if a place has a cozy feel. 
However, when I order 2 pints of dragoon IPA and hand over a twenty and wait for change and am then informed that they were $10 a pint, that is the line, I'm done ! NO BEER should cost 10 bucks a pint - where the hell am I, Manhattan? I thought I was in Tucson? Also, I've been to Manhattan, many times, and never paid 10 bucks for a pint of even, really good, beer. 
A local bar, serving beer from a local brewery, to local customers can do better than this. And I can do better than this place.

I am giving this place one star only for our server whose name started with a T. She was very sweet and deserves better.  The pork belly bun was under whelming. I got the vegan ramen and the only thing good about the bowl was the broth. I asked for an egg which was left out and then brought to the table, frozen and hard boiled. Gross. The noodles were all wrong and the fresh vegetables were not fresh.  The service besides our server was awful. When we arrived the staff was sitting at the bar and no one even got up to greet us. Our food sat in the window with servers coming up to it, looking at the ticket and just walking away. This includes the man who seemed to be the manager who acted like he didn't want to run our food because it was up the stairs. Lazy. Saying this place is a disappointment would be an understatement. Don't waste your time or money.

Would like to rate this place, but super bad attitude and harried waitress got upset because she had to wipe down the table and wasn't interested in having more customers I guess. We've been ignored before at other places when too busy, this was a first today though - outright hostility!

I'm being kind. The only good thing here is the beer- always good choices on tap and pints- not the lame glasses at most brew pubs. The food is miserable. Fatty ribeye cheese steaks range from terrible to ok. They have the worst bar pizza I'm ever eaten- no exaggeration. It was a pita with sauce and cheese on top that wasn't even crisp. The waitress said how good it was- unreal.  Wings were badly undercooked.

Food was good, but service was awful. Waited 30 minutes to get drinks for kids before finally just going to get them from another server. No offers for refills, so had to get them myself. It took 45-60 minutes for food to come out and our starter came out after the main course. Charged more than menu price for soup and was told the menu was wrong - most restaurants honor listed prices (especially after they are pointed out).

Planning on moving? Take my recommendation and DO NOT hire United Van Lines to move you. By far the worst company me & my wife have ever experienced in our entire lives. Our overall move experience was a COMPLETE NIGHTMARE. From start to finish our relocation was extremely poorly handled by United Van Lines. Being guaranteed during our quote that if we signed with United Van Lines they would have our belongings loaded and arrived at our new location by 8-1-17. After numerous interactions with the moving coordinator and being lied to about the status of our property, our belongings weren't delivered until 8-11-17 and 8-14-17 due to additional loads being added and our stuff being split into two separate trucks without our approval. I drove from MN to AZ and incurred multiple moving expenses due to the lies about when the truck was leaving MN with our property. Given these multiple delays we notified United Van Lines we would not be at our new house to receive the first truck due to a family wedding we were in. United Van Lines then wanted us to pay additional money to have it stored overnight for all of their mistakes & incompetence. In a new city where we know nobody we made arrangements to fly someone down to AZ to be present while the first truck was unloaded while we flew back to MN. Obviously even more unnecessary costs incurred because of United Van Lines . United Van Lines is responsible for numerous damaged items as well as 9 lost boxes that are irreplaceable. This kind of service is absolutely ridiculous especially coming from the largest moving company in the entire country. To add the cherry on top our claims process has been equally miserable as the move itself. We submitted our claim on 9-26-17 and did not receive the claim check until 2-17-18 to replace all of the property that was damaged & lost by United Van Lines. The claims coordinator for United Van Lines never kept us in the loop as to our claims status, we always had to initiate the conversation and even then were lied to about its status as they continually told us a new date to expect reimbursement. United Van Lines should be embarrassed with their customer service during our move as this process is inexcusable and no doubt the worst service we've ever experienced. I will NEVER recommend this company to anyone looking for a successful & easy move. Rest assured my letter to the Betterbusinessbureau will say this exact same thing about United Van Lines. If only one person reads this and decides NOT to hire United Van Lines then I have done my job and I've saved them from a total nightmare experience that's easily avoidable.
Not a good example of a philly cheese steak. Franchised out. Fatty meat and bad quality bread. Your better off walking 10 steps over to Chick-fil-A.

Overpriced. Mediocre service. Waited almost five minutes to be seated on a weeknight when there were only three or four tables being occupied. Food was not that great, at least not for the price. Server didn't seem to care, forgetting what we were drinking and placing silverware and the check out of our reach on the far end of the table. On the plus side, the fish tanks are pretty cool. Though when I asked for a table next to the tank I was told no despite there being three tables open. Pass this place by unless it's your only late night option in Downtown St. Louis. Even then, walk 10 miles to the next available restaurant.

Took 50 minutes to get our salad  

Looks busy but I figure there's mostly tourists down here. Food is standard. Fish tank is cool.

Not impressed. We came for restaurant week. I wasn't impressed by the menu - overpriced for what you got. I ended up ordering off the tasting menu and my steak was over cooked. My girlfriend got the tasting menu and didn't feel like any of the dishes had much flavor. I think there was a reason it was easy to walk in and get a table.

We booked an overnight stay here after leaving Destin, Florida. I will never stay here again! The decor was nice, but the customer service was horrible! We arrived and valet pulled the cart up for our bags with no assistance. Once we loaded the cart full of our bags the valet pushed it in the hotel. We left out for dinner and front doorman/valet did not open the door. He was actually really rude. It was like he didn't work there. Almost like he was just standing on the street. We spoke to the manager she immediately comp the valet charge which we did not expect or want. Upon leaving the hotel we called for the bell man to come gather our bags. He never showed up. We carried about 15 bags downstairs. Our vehicle was there so that was a plus or so we thought. Another valet worker was at the door this time staring at us as we came near the door. Once, again no help to open the door. I was shocked! The kicker I got in my vehicle and the seat was sitting up right. I left the seat folded down with my jackets on top. Someone other than the valet was in my vehicle. This was a horrible experience after a wonderful vacation. Management needs to work on customer service with their employees.

Worst service on the planet.  Scheduled an appt for 1:00 PM.  Service agent said it might be a brief wait because they were busy.  An hour and 15 minutes later, my car was still not pulled into the bay for service.   I asked if it would get in soon and they said it would be a long wait and at at least 8 cars were ahead of me.  Took my keys and left.  It was obvious they were placing all walk-ins ahead of me and had no concept of how to prioritize appts and had a complete disregard for customer service.  Really didn't care that I was leaving.  Thanks for Wasting My Time!!!!!

DO NOT EAT HERE!!! Management is horrible, the restaurant is understaffed. I feel bad for the friendly employees here. I ordered one beer and boneless wings. I got here at 10pm and didn't get out until almost 1am. I spoke to the manager who apologized and promised to comp my meal, but it still took ANOTHER 45+ minutes just for the bill and nothing was discounted. I didn't need a discount, no big deal, I told him I just wanted to leave, but he clearly couldn't uphold his promises and I was held hostage unless I wanted to walk out without paying. I will never come here again.

We visited this location while shopping in Hyde Park and it was pouring rain. There was no slip mat at the front door and I was the first person to walk in the door. I fell so hard and slipped on the wet concrete (no warning sign) and the entire store looked at me. They didn't offer to help me or at least a free coffee.

HORRIBLE food and staff!The take away food was YUCKY!!..Raw uncooked food!! Lime served with the dish was pre-used by someone else  .. Can you imagine???Absolutely DISGUSTING!! They take orders until minutes before the kitchen closing time and end up serving absolutely shitty food.
The manager is super rude and cant speak English..Responds rudely to customer concerns ..Serves terrible food and gives excuses  to customers that the poor quality is due to high number of orders..This has happened several times...Guys avoid this place!!!!..
There are a number of better Indian restarants in and around Nashville.
Yelp wait list for this joint doesn't work, hostess is the rudest person, will not spend any more $$ here

Horrible service. Absolutely NO manners. Absolutely NO respect for their customers.
Food is "ok".
But the rudeness of staff forces me to NEVER eat at this place again.
Time for new management and new training program.

This place was crazy in a bad way. I came here for lunch during the week and experienced several problems even though the restaurant was relatively empty. To start the wait time was excessive for both the salads and the sushi. When the sushi arrived nearly 25-30 minutes after ordering the order was incorrect and parts of the fish used were frozen. Additionally the service was terrible I wasn't even given the opportunity to talk to the waiter about the incorrect order because they 1 never came back to check and 2 didn't even look back over to our table which seemed intentional. Will not come back here again.

So the manager was the one who messed up my hair.. a simple comb over with a hard part fade.. fairly common.. before we started I told her not t9 disconnect my ledge cause that's where my hair rests and what does this woman do?? Took the whole damn thing down.. now I'm buzzed on both sides and the long top.. looking like some kinda country ass bumkin with a rebel flag waiving on my truck as u drink bud light driving down the road.... really really not happy with this one.. I don't think I'll ever let that woman touch my head again and honestly I doubt I'll ever go back.. 
What pisses me off the most is the first time I went Becky cut me up and it was proper and clean.... this woman... messed me up on Valentine's day.. and I have a date tonight... Thanks, thanks alot.... #neveragain #trustno1 #wontbeback

Ordered from here 2x for lunch (delivery). My first order was pad kee mow. I'll give it an ok-to-good rating. 0 spicy even though I ordered a 3/medium. My second order was a grilled chicken salad. The chicken was rubbery and completely inedible - literally the worst chicken I've had in years. Plus the dressing (although in a small container) was spilling everywhere, so it was a major mess.

So ive been to place several times over the years. I was just basic.I just don't really know about this place. I was in there a week ago(after about a year since my last visit) and had a good meal and great service. The young man who was in charge at the diner area was awesome. The Food was perfect. Hot tasty I left very happy. So being in the area again I decided to go again but this time were back to the old ways. Cold bland food and the hash browns, why can't this place get hash browns right.  They look crispy but then they are just not cooked properly through and through. Service was horrible. The old guy at behind the  counter really needs to give it up. He just tries to do everything  but can't do it right. 1 glass of water the whole meal because he's busy worried about everyone else.
The week before he was NOT there, so maybe that's why everything was great. I am just done with going here.

I have been renting at PHL national for one year and I have to say it has slowly gone downhill. Drop off last Friday was a 20 minute wait with the line extending out to the service road and wrapping around the corner.  There were cars parked everywhere in the lot.  Pick up on Monday was a choice of 4 cars; one had no key (which makes me question how it got to emerald aisle in the first place), 2 muscle cars and a Nissan which had not been cleaned on the inside or the outside. I took the filthy car due to weather. 
 The area for returning cars was still full of parked cars, and some even blocking the exit lanes. Too many cars and not enough employees?

Warning: this review is only getting 2 stars because I've had good service in the past here, but today was a nightmare. 

So my SO and I show up to Don Pablo's at 1:30pm on a Sunday, as soon as we arrive, I can see about half the tables are not bussed and dirty old plates and cups cover most useable seating. The host took about 15 minutes to seat 3 tables before us due to him scouting which tables were clean. After being seated, we were not given a drink menu and after 10 minutes of waiting for a server, I decided to run to the restroom. I overheard the host talking to a server about how he sat her section and she had no idea that had happened. I returned to the table 2 minutes later, the server dropped off a drink menu finally. We order our drinks and food at the same time, after 10 more minutes we finally received our margaritas. So after being there almost 40 minutes, we got our drinks in a restaurant with only 1/4th of the tables taken. I open my silverware and find cheese stuck to the knife, told the waitress and she replaced them with another knife covered in cheese. It took 4 tries to get some decent silverware. The waitress then brought out our food, she apparently heard chicken fajitas when I definitely ordered steak fajitas. So I waited 25 more minutes for my correct order to come out while my SO was basically done her food. The fajita was good, the drinks were good, but the service was god awful. I'd be embarrassed if I worked there today, I won't be going back for awhile.

I've been here several times and usually pretty good.
Today not so much. The food took forever and we where Told several bad excuses. When it did come out one Order was missing. A kids chicken fingers took over 20 minutes to correct. We asked for silverware several times and I finally had to run to the bar to get myself. We asked for something as simple as ketchup and again had to get up and get our own. Not say I won't be back but come on guys do better

Wish I could rate the food but the place that is supposed to be open until 11pm decided to close at 10pm. Coming from a retail store manager, there is actually a chance at making some good money in the last hour, especially in Bellevue when everything but Krystal closes at 10pm.

I love the wing lovers meal.  It is what I eat at El Pollo Loco.  Rarely is it not available.today I'm sick, and that is what sounded good.  Not only did the restaurant say no they couldn't have it today, but when I asked again. They said enfatically NO!  If there is an item guest enjoy then the restaurant should plan on having enough to provide to their guests.  Off to KFC I go.

Prior to arriving at their beach front restaurant for lunch, drinks, and sunshine I emailed the address provided on their eventbrite advertisement. I simply asked "if entry fee needed to be paid if we arrive prior to 3:00p.m." (the ad stated $10 entry for an event at 3:00p.m.) The employee responded "no ma'am, wrist bands could be picked up upon entry" Upon arrival I was told if we didn't pay $25 each we wouldn't be allowed to stay for the event and to enter it would be $10  to stay until 6:00p.m. even though it was 1:15p.m. I explained the situation about my email correspondence and the employee (Devone) stated if we had gotten there at 1:00p.m. we could have gained free entry. Confused and wanting to obtain a correct answer I went inside to speak to a manager. Kenneth at the front desk met us with an immediate rude demeanor. When I explained why id like to speak to a manger he snatched my phone with the emailed on it stated "The manager won't want to come out to see this email I need to take it back to "her." He returned stating the person who emailed me assumed I was staying the night at the hotel and not just a customer of the restaurant. I reaffirmed and pointed out in the email I never stating that I was staying the night at the hotel and would like to speak to manager about this issue since we are paying customers of restaurant and have visited this establishment many times. Kenneth stated entry is NEVER free at ANY TIME and that I was lying about the previous time I gained free entry. He refused to ask the manager to come out and speak to me because determined my issue insignificant to their business. If proper information was given we would have gotten there before 1, or paid the $40 in advance, but based on misinformation we were charged $100 with not so much as a sorry for the misundertsanding. Plenty of other beach bars in Florida who honor their words and treat all customers equally. I'll spend my vacation else where next time.
This was absolutely the worst experience- the set up and scheduling was unreliable as was the pick up.

I swear to god they have messed up my coffee 5 times in a row it's like a joke to me now lol idk WHY i dont learn my lesson. I have never had one good experience here. The customer service sucks and you can just tell that the employees don't give a crap about their jobs. It's pretty sad that this location is 5 min from my home but i will definetly be going elsewhere now.

Put up a freaking sign on the drive thru entrance if there will be a minimum of 10mins wait so it will give customers a chance to get out! Don't keep people trapped in your drive thru and waste time waiting!

Let's talk about customer service ... you knew that what I had bought was to be delivered yesterday. Then when it didn't arrive, you did not call to inform me of my delivery being late. When I call you this morning to follow up to see if my order has arrived for my to pick it up your response is " Oh I just found out today." I'm sorry, you found out today, but yet the due delivery date was yesterday and again you failed to call me as the customer?! Then you begin to tell me it won't be until NEXT week that my order won't be in the store for pick up?! To top that off when I ask for a manager I get "Oh there not here..." you've got to be out your mind to talk to a customer like that! My order will be returned, I expect a full refund and the number to your corporate location to escalate this further.
#PoopInShrimp Store manager is rude. Hope this lessens the 2 star ratings... Poop poop poop it's awful

After today, I have to regretfully give Marathon a two star rating. I have eaten here a few times before and the food has always been pretty good. Their burger is tasty, juicy, but a little bit messy. Their Philadelphia-style take on a Caprese is very good as well. On their food alone I would give Marathon four stars, but there are other issues. The noise level (extreme) and cramped sitting room (they try to pack in as many people as possible) takes that rating down to 3 stars easily. Today I ordered a Caesar salad with *blackened chicken* to go. There salads always look fantastic when you watch them go by your table while you're eating there. The salad I got today though was awful. The chicken was, in my opinion, undercooked and cold, and certainly not blackened. The salad itself was drowning in dressing and the croutons are bland and leave a bad taste in your mouth. To top it off, the salad by itself is $12 or $13, if you add chicken it's $16. This is high even for the city. I expected a much better tasting salad and my opinion of this place has taken a major hit.

Cute little diner and I was so hoping it would be good.  
I had coffee, two eggs, bacon, toast with a hash brown.
The eggs were okay, the bacon was stone cold, and had been deep fried when cooked, rye toast (with some sort of butter type thing that was NOT butter...it looked like melted cheese wiz....I never even attempted to eat it. It was absolutely DISGUSTING looking), the hash brown left a fair amount of grease sitting under it on the plate and the coffe was weak.  There are too many good Breakfast places in the Bay Pines, Seminole area to consider this less than mediocre breakfast place.  I was VERY disappointed.

Ok so i went there last night because my boyfriends bday is today and wanted to look nice for him. I called ahead to make sure that they could get me in because it was kind of late in the day and didn't want to get rushed through and they told me to come on in. I got there and go my pedicure and the lady that did the pedicure was awesome. She did fantastic!!!! She didn't rush through until the guy came over that was doing my nails and started working on my nails. And i couldn't understand what was said but seemed like he rushed her to get done. So after my pedi cure he had me come sit in his chair and completely rushed through my nails so instead of complaining then because it was about to close i waiting until today to go back and TRRRRY to have them fixed. I got there and all he did was file them down. Didn't even reapply the polish and just said ok better, and i said well i guess I'm just going to go somewhere else. And on top of everything i spend $70 and also tipped them $10. So $80 later I'm in tears and headed somewhere else to get them fixed!! I'm beyond upset and wouldn't recommend going here. So on top of everything i went to a new place and spent $30 more to get my nails fixed so $110 on a gel nail and a regular pedicure!! Ridiculous!!!!!

Ordered scallops with risotto for $20.95.  Boy was I disappointed when my platter had a total of THREE medium size SCALLOPS.  Will never go back! This was our fourth time here.  The waiter was great!  He went back and talked to someone.  He felt bad but there was nothing he could do...not an extra scallop or even a dessert.  Terrible customer service.

We order here from work & it was pretty good for a bit, but now it seems like they are never open.  It's difficult to give a review of a place when they don't have a consistent schedule.  It would be nice to be able to give a place a rave review & honestly, the food is pretty good with enormous portions, but when they are rarely open, it doesn't say much for a "business".

Don't order unless you have over 40 mins for a couple smoothies and 2 aloe shots. Then they just hand your stuff over and walk away. Then when we finished the aloe shot the employee walks up and reaches in front of my face a the window counter the grab the tray without saying excuse me or sorry for the wait or anything. That was a very bad first and last experience.

I really wanted to like this place! Super hip ambiance but poor execution with the food and subpar service. Pizza was undercooked. Not sure how you mess up pizza to be honest...perhaps they were having an off night. My friend said her cocktail was good so it wasn't a complete failure. These elite members raving about this place are clearly sipping that kool-aid!

6/9/18 I went to this restaurant for the very first time. I was in the mood for a calzone, called ahead and ordered one to go. I picked it up, and starving as I was, I began to pick at it in the car. The taste was funny. I pulled another piece off, and it tasted odd also. I then looked at the calzone itself and that's when I noticed it was NOT COOKED completely. The bread itself was doughy on one side. I tore another piece off and stretched out it with my fingers, horrified. I turned the car around and spoke with the P.I.C. and was a given a refund. I will never go back to this place again.

So, we used to go to this place a lot when it first opened. I'm sorry to say that this place has really gone down hill and I don't think we'll be back. The place needs a deep cleaning. The staff is always looking unsure of themselves and overworked. It's a shame.
Not a good place at all - we saw a cockroach BEFORE we ate. Decided to leave ....and informed the manager about issue .... poorly run _ overall this place should be avoided!!!!!!!
$6.42 for a 24 oz iced vanilla latte seriously highway robbery cheaper at Kahwa caffeine buddybrew and Starbucks won't be back unfortunately until I become a millionaire

Currently on minute 25 of waiting in line at this place. This has to be the worst Starbucks in the history of the world. 

We finally made it to the window and one of our drinks is wrong and they're out of lemon cake, blueberry scones and basically everything on the menu. Only come here if you want to make yourself late for something.
Good beer selection usually but unfortunately they serve some of the more desirable beers in ridiculous goblets and don't switch when you request a pint. Also service is pretty poor. Sad.

Terrible worker lady running around putting clothes back on racks was extremely rude. Practically knocking into me as I was trying to look at items on a rack . 
She never said excuse me or apologized. 
Then she was banging on all the dressing room doors asking abruptly if everyone had a number for their items. 
Seems they are in need of some customer service training.

Great good but terrible parking!  If you don't want your car dinged then don't go here.  They purposely made the spots the absolute smallest possible at your expense.  Perhaps management will see this and reconsider their greedy parking.  I recommend only coming here on a tri-cycle, motorcycle or moped only.

Wed 6 pm run in to get a to go order and drink. Sit at half filled bar. 615 pm leave with neither. Watched bartender not move from the register except to look at her texts serve somebody else and answer a phone order. 15 mins I walked out told the hostess great customer service..no reply...went across the street full bar busy had a drink and asked for my order 2 mins. Have a business on Manchester take clientele out weekly and Joey bs obviously doesn't need my business. Great customer servicer

As a long standing patron of The Palm Tree on Pine Street, I have to say the Manayunk location is horrible. I bought 2 turkey sandwiches on rye with lettuce, cheese and avocado, the other one had peppers. These were wish sandwiches...wish I had some meat!! Not only did they have 3 thin meager pieces of turkey, 1 sad slice of cheese, I pathetic piece of lettuce, the rye bread was stale. Maybe they think they can get away with this substandard product here, because of all the college kids, but I'm a grown ass man who just spent 30.00 on crap. Neadless to say, I will be going to Sorrentinos or WaWa moving forward. The owners should change the name here lest they  cheapen their brand. It's a freaking sandwich, how can you screw this up so badly?
This McDonalds doesn't honor the any drink for $1 on it's unsweet tea (which is undoubtedly cheaper than soda to make). Stop at the Circle K across the street. Any polar pop (tea or soda) $0.79.

I have used this bookstore several times and each time I go to sell back or return a rental, there's always a problem getting back the in store sign posted return rate and I've had to argue for what's rightfully my entire amount due. They often try to tell you something other than what their sign says.  Like their unwritten policy should outweigh what is posted.  This last time was the final straw.  I ordered a text book they didn't have in stock.  Went over to the UNR bookstore and found one. I went back to this bookstore immediately and told them I no longer needed the order. They cancelled the order but THEN told me there were no refunds!  So I didn't get the book from them and they still charged me. I have had to send in a dispute with my credit card company to try to get my money back.   Ridiculous.  I will only buy from the UNR bookstore from now on.

Employees are unnecessarily rude. I had placed my order at the kiosk, paid at the register, and waited over 15 minutes to get the order. They finally called my number, went up to grab my food and was told I needed to pay first. I politely explained that I paid already. The employee screamed across the room to ask the cashier if I paid, she said yes and that I was fine. I didn't even want the food at this point. It was extremely embarrassing, will not be returning.

We were staying at the Hilton with a group of people. We decided to go down to the bar to have an appetizer and drinks prior to dinner. After hanging out for a couple hours spending around $700 for our group of 10-12 people, the manager approached us to tell us we needed to conduct business there or leave. What in the actual? In my town that's real money. My husband was so pissed he wrote on the check, thank your manager for the tip. In 15 years, I have never seen him not leave a tip. She then had the gall to come berate us for not tipping. Btw, while our server was polite he was not very attentive. For the remainder of the trip, we walked directly across the street to the Intercontinental bar and had great food and service without anyone busting our chops.

I am super surprised that this restaurant is listed as good for groups. We went here for my birthday and was told that the system was down and they couldn't do separate checks. We had to spend 30-45 minutes calculating what everyone owed by looking at the menu and calculating our own tax and telling the waitress what we owed. We went back tonight for my friends birthday and they just flat out wouldn't split it at all. Very frustrating and a lot more work for their customers! 

Also, they seem to keep keep changing their menu and taking the best items off! This used to be one of our favorite restaurants, but now we don't even want to go back. So sad!

I just returned from having dinner at American Social. Worst dining experiance I have had in a very long time. The restaurant was very loud. You  have to scream to have a conversation with your companions across the table from you. Ordered the grouper strips and cheeks. The fish was over breaded and over cooked. The fish had no flavor. I complained about the fish to the waiter and he apologized and asked if I would like something else. I selected the steak sliders. Mistake!. 3 sliders. Took a bite and it was all grissle. Second bite I could not eat it was so loaded with grissle. Spit it out in the mens room. Complained again and they did not charge for the meals. Nice ?? To add insult to injury. The parking charge for  2 hours and 3 minutes in the underground garage was $15. Not going there again.

We've ordered from Queen Sushi since we were college kids 12 years ago and the food has always been decent, especially compared to competition in the area. When we moved to a new house we weren't sure if they delivered and tried new places but recieved a menu from them as a mailing and happily resumed ordering through them.  
However, today when we tried to place our order (like we usually do once every week or two) we were informed that we were "too far for delivery".  That is pretty strange and frustrating considering we're 10 minutes away, they sent us a menu,  and we order for delivery all the time without issue.  Next, when I expressed confusion the statement was changed to you're "too far for delivery" to it's a $30 minimum (our order is pretty consistently around $18).  As the conversation continued the minimum was changed magically to $25. Next she had to check with the driver to see if they "felt like it " (they apparently did not). 
A company absolutely has the right to dictate delivery radius and minimum delivery amounts (their menu states "fast delivery min.: $10.00). The inconsistency is ridiculous which prompted this review.
They were not very pleasant and this was the worst keot of the 3 or 4 or 5 Plato's Closet stores. I felt disdain from them.

The vibe of the space is great.  The food?  Meh.  I've eaten here three times now.  Omelets have been dry and uneventful.  The food (I've had) in general wasn't very good.  I think if they added a great chef and dialed in the training in the kitchen, this place would be amazing.  Also, don't serve your food on paper plates.

I ordered take-out again from this restaurant on Aug 07, 2018. The calamari appetizer was extremely disappointing. For $9.99, most of the container was filled with fried crumbs. There were only about 10 tiny fried calamari rings. Such a rip-off! I will definitely not order this item again.

Omg. It's 3:30pm so in between lunch and dinner, shouldn't be a problem waiting right? Everyone standing around, no one acknowledges me. One lady walked in ahead of me for some pita bread, place was empty. Guy doing paperwork finally says, Anyone waiting on you?  I said, Nope! He said, Okay. I'll be right with you.  He continues to do his paperwork as two employees walk past me and briefly chat with him. Am still waiting. He's still doing his paperwork with is back to me. Still waiting. Was so disgusted I walked out as he saw me halfway out the door he said, Okay. I'm ready!  YOU'RE ready?? Seriously?? There's NO OTHER customers but me now! I will never go back in this place and I eat organic and Paleo and Whole30. Would never recommend this restaurant. The customer is obviously not important enough.

I know that working for fast food restaurant tends to be something that is done in high school wow the frontal lobe is still developing. But it is extremely interesting to me how little attention to detail and how on responsive to customers the staff at this location can be fit I know you get what you pay for but holy smokes some new hiring policies might be entertained here.

We had friends in town yesterday and decided to try Tank 13. I have eaten BBQ all over the country, and I was excited try some ribs from their smoker. I could not have been more disappointed. First, the ribs were not smoked--they were baked. There was no smoke flavor or smoke ring, and the ribs were completely inedible (I was asked if I wanted a box for my uneaten 1/2 slab... no thank you). When they arrived, I noticed that three of the ribs had been completely removed from meat. Smoked ribs done right should not be "fall off the bone." They should have a little bite to them. These were easily the most disgusting ribs I have ever seen, and I would never have served them to any guests at my house (I regularly smoke meats in my own smoker). That I paid $14.50 for this terrible meal is a mistake I will never make again. And to top it off, the service was subpar--no one bothered to ask how our meal was, and it apparently wasn't strange that I left a completely uneaten 1/2 slab of ribs on my plate, when that was all I ordered. Will never recommend this place to anyone for food. I assume the beer is good (I didn't have anything to drink), and it would be a decent place to watch a ball game. But stay away from their BBQ... it is among the worst in the city (in a city with generally terrible BBQ), at least on the day I visited.

The hostess was very rude. Their were two empty tables and a line of people waiting to be seated. When asked about the empty tables the hostess started getting an attitude. Don't waste your time and money.

I hired them to inspect my current house before I purchased it. They didn't catch anything. I had a furnace that leaked water. I ended up having to spend close to $1000 for a chimney liner to fix that problem. The central air was improperly installed. They didn't notice that the front door was too small for the house and  I had many other issues. Do not use!

Unfortunately the pizza here was definitely not fresh. It was a soggy pre-frozen pie. I can't speak for the other food but as far as the pizza goes, it did not seem fresh made or baked. It had the signs of a frozen pie.

I usually come to this place a lot and enjoy there smoothies and acai bowls all the time. Sometimes the wait can get pretty bad but nothing too crazy until today.  I ordered a Hercules smoothie which I get all the time and the wait is usually 5-15 mins. Today I waited 30 mins for a smoothie.  I go up and ask about my smoothie after waiting 30 mins and found out they haven't even started it.  After that I watch the guy behind the counter make my smoothie in less than a minute.  Honestly probably one of the worst smoothies I have ever bought and I dont think I will ever come back.  I could have made a better smoothie.  Just very disappointing.

So dissappointed. My husband and I came here when we were engaged years ago, and even had our rehearsal dinner here. But I guess time hasn't been friends fly to them. My husband's steak was about as good of quality as an outback steakhouse meal. The peppercorn crust was completely unnecessary to the dry age, not to mention their steak knives are so dull he looked like a lumberjack sawing through a tree while cutting it! My meal was just ok, small portion of fish with a drizzle of hollandaise sauce. His drink was watered down, so while he did get two full glasses from the canister, it was really more of one drink from actual alcohol content. I really wish they had kept themselves more unique, I would have loved to come back. But now all I can do is stay away until they can be different from a generic chain steakhouse.

This place is not worth coming to, dont waste your time and MONEY!! They steal your money, don't give correct change back and then lie about it! Like wow how do you not pay attention and do basic counting skills. Dont come to this Dunkin, its a bad one for sure. They STEAL!!!

Visiting from out of town, looked like a great place to try. We were there at noon on Monday, only one other couple was there. Should have been our first sign. Menus were old and ratty and limited on choices. Pretty pricey too. The atmosphere is very nice. So, I ordered a Turkey sandwich my sister ordered the cheeseburger. Waitress came back with a menu because they were out of the Turkey sandwich I ordered. Really! What restaurant runs out of a staple like that. Like I said it wasn't packed, only one other table eating. So, I ordered the roasted beet and goat cheese salad. The salad had ice chunks in it, very special to bite into, and they tossed in some canned, not roasted beets. I can't recommend this place until they get it together. Clearly, poorly managed.

On April 18, 2018 around 5:30pm I stopped at the Cracker Barrel in White House, TN for dinner. I ordered meatloaf, mac & cheese, hash brown casserole, and okra, with fried cornbread and unsweetened tea to drink. When my order arrived, the meatloaf was burnt and looked several days old. The cook took fresh ketchup and poured around the top of the meatloaf to cover up the dark and burnt meat. The manager happened to walk by and I told her that I wasn't eaten this meatloaf. She asked why. I showed her what was served and she said she doesn't eat meatloaf and didn't know how it should look. She asked if she could get me another piece and I told her no, that it would come from the same pan. She replied, I guess your right. The server came by and filled my tea up with sweetened tea. When I poured sweet lot into the glass, it made the tea too sweet. After I finished what I was going to eat, another waiter brought me out another glass of sweetened tea. My cornbread didn't arrive until I was ready to leave. A picture of the meatloaf is attached. I have had several bad meals at this Cracker Barrel for dinner. Never a bad breakfast. The sad thing is that I own stock in the company and fill obligated in eaten there. Please go rather a couple of exits north at the Franklin, KY, or a couple of exits south at the Long Hollow exit to eat at a Cracker Barrel.
Don't know how their food is- been trying to reach them for several days now to place a potential pick-up order for my coworkers and I - but they don't answer their phone ‍
Very disappointing.  I got fried green tomatoes. What machine breaded these and sucked the flavor right out of them? Florida is still the south and these are a travesty. Not worth $2, much less $8.

This was the first time I ever ordered from this Abington chipotle restaurant. Are usually use the Chipotle in Willow Grove Pennsylvania on Moreland Rd. But because it was was the one nearest to me - I had to use the one that was closest to me. My rice was under cooked,  it was brown rice which I wanted. , I also had some kernels of uncooked rice. The fajita veggies  were way over cooked mushy and had no taste. l took  them out because they were so over cooked. I really doubt if I'll ever order from this particular chipotle restaurant again. Also the items on the DoorDash menu is small and you can't add any extras, like extra meat or cheese or anything.

I do NOT recommend this hotel to anyone!  My family and I flew in from Miami, Florida and we checked in on Thursday, May 24, 2018 and were booked to check out on Tuesday, May 29, 2018.  (We booked 4 rooms) We were looking forward to enjoying family time together in the hotel until Saturday our big event were to take place.  However, that family time included us enjoying the pool that was on premise.  The day we went to go to the pool area we were told by staff that the pool is not available; that it was reserved for a girl's soccer ball team.  I have never EVER heard of such crap like that!  We thought maybe it was just for that day but later on was told that it was not available for the entire 5 days we were booked to stay there.  I'm now thinking "This is absolutely INSANE!"  So not having the pool available left us with not much to do but stay inside of those small rooms we rented.  Therefore, we decided to check out earlier then we originally had plan.  This cost us extra money to change our flights but in the long run I feel it was worth it.  Why give "Element" anymore of our money.  I tried to check out much earlier but the Marriott Courtyard that was across the street were a bit pricey due to the Memorial Holiday weekend.

Front desk staff at this location needs more professional training when dealing with the public.

Ok, I was willing to give it another chance. I stopped by and I saw a better working team. Even the manager was focused and involved. The place was much cleaner and spiffy. I ordered the 8 piece bucket Original recipe. The worker pulled the pieces from what looked like freshly fried tray. I am thinking YAY! Now why is the mash the obligatory side to have? I asked to swap for spears and was told it was extra. I was like, let's not spoil this good moment and I said OK. No biggie. Got home and was ready for some good stuff, so I thought. So far, so good until I took a bite. Did someone at KFC change the recipe? I was looking for that Original recipe bite and goodness. What I got was so bland! It is like no one seasoned the chicken! Well I'll be a damn.... And the consistency was like boiled chicken, refried and breaded. Quality control is clearly lacking here. Kudos for the team, MEH for the chicken. Publix Fried Chicken still the winner!

I came in for a manicure and was told it would be a 15 minute wait. The fumes in this place were so overpowering, I had to leave. The place was so dirty, dark, and had a tv blaring. The polishes were not organized by similar colors/brands - random, sloppy display. If you want a relaxing, spa experience - do not go to this place. Take your money and go elsewhere.

Summary: the menu has the word "curated" on it. Either you're into this type of place, or you're not. I'm not, but I did pay $7 for an environmental disaster of a dessert, so here's my take. 

First off, this place is pretty overpriced. $7 for a small cone of soft serve and cubes of cake is hardly a good value. I'm not sure if I'm able to fully judge the desert, I got a curated chocolate flavored cone that was supposed to come with chocolate ice cream, chocolate cake, and chocolate ganache. There was no ganache in or on the cone, which probably would have helped overall. 

The dessert is sold in a cheap, fragile clear plastic cone. I suppose this is for Instagram users, but I would assume most of these people would be concerned about the massive amount of garbage this is creating, for no benefit other than AESTHETIC. This aesthetic would be served better by serving the dessert in a glass reusable container that doesn't crack in your hand under a slight bit of pressure. 

This establishment would do well to invent something portable, cheap and delicious to house the dessert if they don't want to use glass. I'm imagining maybe throwing waffle batter in a really flat griddle, made fresh for the customer, and rolling it into a cone shape while it's still malleable. You could call this thing a "waffle cone". If the staff is overwhelmed, maybe the dessert curator could come in and make them while the severs fill them...

Just came out and tried to charge me $400 for a slightly clogged pipe. Lol, no. I found somebody to do the same job for 130 - these people rip you of and take advantage. If you enjoy just throwing your money away go for it !

Worst place ever. I order some tacos and my husband order some muscles calamari and more. The food was take out. And once we get home I saw the tacos it only had one shirmp per taco. I reach to the manager. Who was extreanly rude. I reach to the general manager. Its been 1 month and nothing.  I am a manager for a local hotel on State Street. I will not recommend this restaurant to any of my guest.

Employees walked around and one was on their phone while boxing up my order. I was quite annoyed because I don't want people touching their phone when they are touching my food. Plenty of germs when they do something like that. 

Food was not bad, but could've been ore flavorful in regards to the special chicken orders.

I LOVE LJS fish, & it's been ages since having some. So, yesterday evening we went here despite the reviews. We went with eyes wide open, knowing the service would suck. It did. Food was good, but waiting in line was forever as cashier cut up with employees & customers ahead of us, who were apparently family as we noted they didn't have to pay very much...finally a manager came up from the back & told dude to just clock out & leave if he was just going to cut up. He did. As I said, food was good...when we finally got it. Table & booth were almost adhesive with old grease, though. Nasty. Health inspection was noted to be a 98, but with the lack of cleanliness, I can't imagine how. Next time, I'll wait forever, but get it to go.

Well- ordered prime rib. Looked fabulous. The amount of salt on it- could do 10 pretzels. Add to that- it was cold. The potato was smoking hot.
Kudos to the imported cooks who don't read English.

Still can taste the salt.

Had dinner there last nite. Not cooked to order. Jambalaya was nasty. Cajon chicken dry and overcooked. Jumbo part was reheated and there were lukewarm warm and warmer spots. If wasn't so hungry with parade outside would have sent it back. Service was medicore. A lot of other places to choose from.

I am a long time Starbucks customer and I usually go 5-7 times a week. I use the mobile app almost every time and they still manage to get it wrong. I rarely get an acknowledged when I come in and I always always say "thank you and have a good day." I would say 1 in 20 times someone looks up with a half interest and then goes back to what they are doing. I go anywhere from 6am to 3pm and it's always the same. There was one guy working the register Sunday who was very personable.... hire more of him! I would almost rather pay the 20% upcharge at the airport just because they are friendly and always get my drink right!

I'm not one to complain, but for the money spent in this place you would think they would do better with insect control. To scare to even sleep to long because I'm on alert looking for bugs. Killed a few in just a couple hrs. Now I know why the overwhelming bleach smell when checked in.

Today, we visited this restaurant in Philadelphia.
We drove from New Jersey to come here not a very inviting welcome. Almost, borderline rude this place will never get anymore of my money!!
If proved you shouldn't go to places you follow on Instagram. Not sure how the food is as of yet didn't taste it yet. Just put off by the vibe!! The lady at covered in longs and scratching her hair. A worker comes in she working in her coat topping food,packing food.. WTH once we finally got our food my husband checked the bag to make sure all our food was in there, It started to leak out everywhere no came over they saw the mess. When, I asked for more bags because it was leaking bad he said what kind of bags......
They customer service suck assssss, we drove from NJ just to come here. What a terrible experience..

Not a clean location. The prepackaged food could be a safer purchase in comparison to the self serve hot & cold foods. I waited for a staff person to complete their cleaning of the ladies restroom - retraining is necessary; you don't want the details.  This location seems understaffed.

Not worthy of one star! Husband and I worked all day. Decided to order 50 wings we picked them up came home. 30 of the wings were raw!  Upset our stomach from the sight of raw chicken. We will never go back!
Eh. Cool ambiance. Rude bartender. Okay drinks... maybe go on a busier night........ maybe.

It really a 0 for the service (because of the waitress) we had. The food was 3.5 stars inventive and interesting. But this review is for the owner and the customer to be aware of our experience first and will sadly will be last. 

We arrived on a nice afternoon they were not busy, we were seated not to long after so far so good. As soon as the waitress (dark hair, with nose ring) approached us we politely said hello, and right away I can sense the attitude in her face and demeanor. OK...? not sure why?? We ask for menus and proceed with our order, again she didn't seem too happy that we wanted to order from the Happy Hour menu, umm... ok??? We have never been here so we wanted to test thing out, but why does that matter?? Moving on, the appertizers were good so we decided to stay for dinner, drinks were not bad so we order a second round. Ok, here the next interesting part, so we ask about the Lamb course and she turn up the attitude, saying "I don't eat LAMB!!" Oh... OK...? So now we know you don't eat LAMB thanks so very much for letting us know your preference. Should I apologized for asking, I mean it's on the menu! But the last time I check I didn't ask Do you eat LAMB? Did I miss waitress? You have Lamb on the menu so it's your job to explain the dish to your customer and not put your own opinion and feeling on my dinner. We didn't ask you to. Thanks!! So when she said she didn't eat Lamb with chucks full of attitude and judgement on us as meat eater. Oh, no how dare us??!!! I told her we eat them all!! She turned and gave me a silent side stare/glare. Again, your job is to served and be respectful of your customer decision about what to order and eat. 
The lamb turn out to be a great dish it was a first time on the menu and we applauded the chef for creating the dish. I hope that the manager and the owner know that we like their inventive food and cocktails, but due to the waitress that served us unfortunately we will not return. It's a shame restaurant have nice potential.

I have to be honest, I'm shocked at how bad this place actually is. We stopped by here Sunday for some sandwich's to go. Big mistake! We ordered a variety for us and some friends.

Presentation wise, all the food looked good. We ordered pastrami sandwich. It was terrible! Overly salty and covered in lettuce. The rye bread was by far the best part. The turkey club was equally as bad. The turkey was beyond dry and the bacon wasn't very fresh. You could tell it was reheated, it was chewy but rock hard. The Italian hoagie flat out tasted funny. The meat was cut super thick and it was also very slimy. The hoagie lacked seasoning but it was covered in onions. Due to the taste and look of it we trashed it. The pierogis were easily forgettable. They were your typical stuff and not very good. They turkey special, again the turkey was dry. The thousand island was good but again something out of a jar, cole slaw was the same. All
Of the sandwiches are large but that's not always good. I'd prefer quality over quantity but that's just me.  The cheesesteak egg rolls were the best part of our meal. They were actually edible.

Overall it was a terrible experience and we would not return. To say we were disappointed would be an understatement. It's really hard to mess up one sandwich, let alone 6.

I'm not sure if Fiorello's is under new ownership/management, but I've been disappointed in our takeout from here the last three times. This makes me so sad because this was my favorite local Italian restaurant, especially for take out. Their Caesar Salad used to taste homemade and delicious. Now the dressing tastes like it comes from a bottle. Our mozzarella sticks had O% cheese inside, our pizza crust was tough, and the chicken parm tasted off. Usually Fiorello's food is ON POINT. I'm just not sure why their quality has gone downhill.

Waited for customer service for dam near 30 minutes Watched another clerk call them twice and get no response There were 3 or 4 other people waiting behind me who gave up and left before receiving service I explained I have my dog in the car I just wanna pay my power bill can someone help me with no response finally Wilma who was watching me from the booth where apparently she eats her lunch Finally approached me after watching me for 30 minutes every plied I was on lunch so I couldn't help you maybe they should have somewhat cover their him please while they take their lunch or maybe Wilma could have took the time to speak simply explaining that's the situation Instead of staring at me for 30 minutes within earshot and doing nothing I work construction and even I have better customer service skills than that If I could take stars away from them I would  My service was unacceptable and Wilma should take a class on customer service if she's gonna work the customer service counter I'm only giving this one star because I have to to submit my review

Service was very,very slow considering it is an order at the counter place. I got the salted caramel donut which was good, but not great. The donut was a little heavy. I also orderd the cinnamon roll which I did not care for. It came swimming in gooey icing and was soooo overly sweet that you almost couldn` t taste the cinnamon. Plus they had sprinkled sugar on top of the roll too!  Sometimes balance of flavors is more important than just throwing everything in. If they had free wifi I couldn`t find it.

First time trip to the Parx Casino to see Patton Oswald.  More on his show later.  Decided we eat at the Liberty Bell Gastropub.  Let me just say I hate casinos in general and in particular any outside of Vegas.  Loud, bright, and full of people who look like they haven't had a minutes fun in YEARS!!!  I also hate restaurants with "Gastropub" in their name and in that respect Liberty Bell did not disappoint.  Our 6:30 reservation was seated on time but at a hightop at the end of the bar.  Not real happy about that, but OK.  My wife was hungrier than me and ordered the Crispy Chicken Burger
House-made pickles, spicy remoulade sauce, old fashioned cole slaw, house-made fries.  
I played it safe and ordered The Pub Wings.
Food came faster than we expected, unfortunately the wings, 8 small rather dry examples that looked like they had been under a heat lamp for most of the day.
The Chicken Burger showed up minus the remoulade sauce AND the cole slaw.  Dry as a bone!!  We called Parker over who apologized and went about getting the order fixed.  A manager showed up to, I assume, facilitate the order.  The sandwich came back now smothered in sauce and cole slaw, but by now, unbeknownst to me, who's wings were now gone, with cold chicken and cold fries.  Soon enough the meal was over.  But to add insult to injury, another waitress show up at our hightop, AFTER we had finished eating, with both our originally ordered sandwich and wings!!!!  What a mess.
While mistakes made in a busy kitchen happen and for the most part are forgiven I was most upset when presented with the bill and not even our drinks had been complimentary.  
Liberty Bell Gastropub is a one and done!!!
As for Patton Oswald, a comic I have enjoyed for years, and drove an hour to see that night, he spent way to much of his one hour set on crowd work.  Some women in market research and a young unemployed flower delivery driver.  Listen, if you don't have an hour of material, maybe hold off on a tour till you do.

got food poisoning right after I left the restaurant  made a reservation a few hours before and they didnt have us down so we couldnt sit at a table for date night and instead sat at the community tables. Overall disappointing because it was over-priced for what you got :(

I am a raving fan of Tijuana Flats.  With that said, I feel like I'm betraying myself by submitting a 2 star review, but when you come expect greatness from your favorite taco joint and get let down you gotta say something.  I was introduced to Tijuana Flats in 2001 and will go out of my way (as I did today) when the craving hits me.  I came in today for Tijuana Tuesdaze and ordered an extra taco.  I went to the hot sauce bar and before I could finish picking my hot sauces the food came out...it was almost like it came out of the Star Trek food replicators it was so fast.  It was also well below the Mendoza line.  I'm being nice by saying that the food was barely warm.  The flavor was also off.  I don't know if it was a change in the taco seasoning or a lack of seasonong altogether...but it was mediocre.  I felt like a ate a mismade order that was for someone else before me.  This part is bad enough in itself, but there is more.  I come here for the hot sauce bar.  Tijuana Flats is all about the hot sauce, and so am I.  I am particularly a fan of the tear jerker grade sauce.  Guess what?  There weren't any tear jerker sauces on the bar today...instead there was a sauce pump that was dedicated to Heinz Ketchup.  WTF?  Your offerings are in an area clearly labeled HOT BAR.  Get that fucking ketchup off of there and give me what I have been coming for for the last 17 years.  For real...if you're working your way through an identity crisis then put the red plastic Heinz squeeze bottles on the table and quit shitting on your branding.  For the 1st time ever, I left Tijuana Flats completely underwhelmed.  I come here to eat a good quality scratch taco and burn my god damn face off...which you guys are normally damn good at.  Leave the cheeseburger flavored taco to the choke n puke flavored cardboard menu at Taco Bell.  I'm sure it would go great with their pre-fab frozen french fries slathered in cheese whiz or whatever canned garbage they sling to drunks all hours of the night.  I get the need to test market and experiment, but why make a raving fan go wihout for the sake of putting something as lame as ketchup on your hot sauce bar?  What's next.  Crystal?  You got 2 stars instead of one, because I love your brand, but in reality it was 1 star all the way today.

Food: Luke warm 80 minutes before close 
Customer Service: got the eye roll for wanting to wait for my Mac and cheese instead of just getting another side. Got ignored at the window when my order was wrong. 
Probably the worst customer service I've had at any KFC location to date.

This is one of the worst steak n shakes. The service used to be hit or miss. Now it's just completely garbage. They're almost like McDonald's - there's always an issue. The customer service is terrible. If the other restaurants nearby weren't even WORSE then we probably wouldn't get our food here. ‍

The food is great, but honestly they might have the worst service in the city. Be prepared for an excessively long wait to be seated, when half the restaurant is empty and even longer waits to order and receive your food. Endless chips and salsa? More like one round and then you don't see your server again til 45 minutes later when your entree arrives. Despite the god awful service, I continue to come here, so I guess they're doing something right.

Very very poor communication, posts on social media of my dog clearly not happy and harness on wrong, set off security system and did not notify me--I found out from the alarm company first, brought in new walker without telling me, didn't tell me my dog was peeing on the floor and sofa out of fear when she was greeted by them--had to find out from roommates (thank god for them or I would never even know of these issues). I work in a stressful ICU and want to be sure my dog is safe and happy, but these walkers only added more stress.
Express scripts is the worst insurance prescription coverage I've ever had. It is a nightmare to get my prescriptions filled.

We stopped in here 3 different times.  My husband had a Bloody Mary and really liked it.  On another visit we had a Po Boy.  It was ok, not great, not bad.  The third time we stopped to get a drink and the bartender was one of rudest people I have run into.  There were several people at the bar but only one bartender.  We had been sitting waiting for a while when the bartender asked someone who had just walked in what they wanted.  I said something and the bartender came over, insulted me, and was extremely hostile.  I realize he was busy, and may not have known I was there first but that was no excuse for his behavior.  If you can't be civil then maybe you shouldn't be in a customer service job

I called US Door N More to ask about ordering some 6 panel doors to use as closet doors. I asked the lady who I first spoke with about using them as bifold doors and she said "Oh, yes. People do that all the time! These doors would work great for that!" and then she said that she would look into how much the doors weighed and what hardware to use and would get back to me. 

A couple of days went by and I didn't hear back. So, I called again. She wasn't there, but the gentleman on the phone was happy to talk to me about my project. He said "NO! You absolutely should not use these doors as bifold doors because they are too heavy. They'll look alright to start, but they will sag over time. You should do floor/ceiling hinges." Then he said he would look into hardware and call me back. 

A few days passed and, once again, no call back. I should have noticed a pattern at this point, but unfortunately I persisted. I called him again. He didn't recall our conversation. He had no idea what hardware to use and informed me that this company doesn't even sell hardware. I said "ok, can I at least buy the doors we discussed?" He said it would be easier if I just went online and purchased them that way. 

At this point I have spent upward of a week playing phone tag with these people trying to get my questions answered and doors ordered and I am right where I started: online ordering doors. 

On March 9th I ordered doors that were supposed to ship within 5 days according to the website.

A couple of weeks went by and I finally got a call from someone. They said that they didn't have one of the sizes that I ordered, but that they would order more from the manufacturer and that the doors would all be delivered to me in mid-April. I was a little angry because all of the doors were supposed to have already been SHIPPED at that point and I was just waiting on these doors to list my home for sale. But, I reluctantly agreed and asked whether there would be any kind of a discount for the inconvenience of waiting over a month for doors that were supposed to ship within 5 days. They responded that "they didn't have the authority to do that, but they would ask."

I never heard back about the discount.

On April 8th, I got an email saying that the doors would be delivered on 4/30. Great... another 2 week delay. I responded via email expressing my disappointment with yet another delay and asked whether there would be any discount. My email never got a response.

Fast forward to 4/26 and I have heard absolutely nothing from anyone. The doors are supposed to be delivered on 4/30 and I know that they are going to be shipped via freight from across the country, but the website says that they are still processing the order and the doors haven't been shipped. So, I'm concerned that they will not arrive by 4/30. I tried to ask the instant message customer service person on the website about my order: they didn't  have any info. So, I send in emails and call. I get a call back a couple days later saying "we got the other size doors from the manufacturer, but they didn't exactly match the original doors. We didn't know what to do." 

THEY GOT THE DOORS AND DIDN"T KNOW WHAT TO DO!? Maybe call me and ask instead of doing absolutely nothing!?

I asked him to send me pictures of the doors so I could decide whether I wanted them. They were close enough, so I said "fine, I'll take them." Once again I asked whether I would be receiving any kind of a discount for this incredible inconvenience. The guy on the phone said "I'll ask, but I don't think you are going to get anything because these doors were already discounted when you bought them."

The doors arrived on 5/3. I never heard back from them about any sort of a discount for taking almost 2 months to deliver doors that were supposed to ship within 5 days and for me having to settle for mismatched doors. Oh, and the cherry on top of the poo pile: in the time that I was waiting for these doors, one of my neighbors listed her place for $70,000 less than what I was planning on listing for. Had I gotten the doors in time, my place would have already been sold before she ever listed.

This was the worst customer service I have experienced in a very, very long time. I cannot believe that they think it is acceptable to do business this way.

Then they had the gall to send me an email asking me to review them.
I think this place is going out of business, they didn't have any soda, ranch, or curly fries when I went in. Guess they're having a close out sale?

Friends and I went to the St Pete Beach Seafood Festival on a Saturday but decided to have seafood in a restaurant. We chose Shark Tales. That was a mistake. Evidently management does not know how to staff to provide even mediocre service. The restaurant was nowhere near capacity yet it took over an hour for our meals to arrive. And the food was cold when we got it. The server was friendly, but was trying to please too many tables. With several other restaurants in the area it would be hard for me to chose Shark  Tales over the others. Sorry management. You get one chance to make a good impression and you flopped.

We stopped in knowing what we wanted - to get me the iPhone 8 Plus. We were not spoken to for a while. I understand when all your employees are with someone, but any one of them could have at least said "someone will be right with you" or anything to at least acknowledge our presence. The only person who seemed actually friendly with a great attitude was the assistant manager EJ, who we wish we worked with from the beginning. 

When we were finally approached by Carlos, he gave off an "I don't even want to be here" vibe. He did tell us about the promotions going on for iPhones. He had me downloading an app, talking about cost, all before going to check if they even had the phone I wanted. (Spoiler alert: they didn't.) We ended up wasting a lot of our time here. 

We later stopped by the Gandy Blvd. location who had the phone, which - by the way - would have been nice if he had called other locations to see if they had it in stock. We decided to leave because although he told us they could ship the phone to us, I was mentioning to my husband that I can't trade in my phone and be without one for days. I assumed we would still have to trade in in-store. That would have been the time he should have mentioned I would be able to ship my trade in myself once I received my new phone. We went to the Gandy Blvd. location who let us know they couldn't accept my phone due to cracks on the edges. 

They told us about being able to ship my trade in, so my husband called Henderson to make sure they would be able to do it before we headed back. He first told us that the Gandy location "lied to us" about not being able to accept my phone, which was a really unprofessional way of talking about other locations. Later, after talking with his manager, he told us that they were actually correct by not accepting my phone. It was just too much of a hassle and waste of time to go to this location when a much more amazing location (Gandy) with incredible customer service is nearby.
Enjoyed the cruise, the band was good but food is AWFUL!!! I've had better TV dinners.   Dinner cruise is definitely not worth it.  Take the cruise; save your money and buy snacks from the snack bar.

I don't get it. I really don't. This is a review for drinks only. My husband and I went after a happy hour down on Passyunk to grab one last drink and finally check out ITV. Our server was a bit slow to get to our table and there seemed to be an air of resentment when we said we were only drinking. We both ordered the drink called 4 down, 7 letters and my husband really liked it. I guess I underestimated the Campari a bit (like a dumbass) but I was not a fan of mine. The service was painfully slow even though a table of 6 had been checked on several times while we were waiting to place our drink orders. From a practicality standpoint I get it- bigger table usually equals bigger tips esp. when they are getting food but how about not being so obvious about it? 

We waited for several minutes and I usually would rather die than return a well mixed drink to the bar but as it was my last drink of the night and I really couldn't get past the bitterness of the Campari, so I waited for more than a few minutes to kindly ask the server if she would mind switching out my drink (a bit of a pain in the ass I know) but she never checked on how we liked our drinks so my husband decided to go upto the bar and ask directly. They were all professional about it but you could tell there was a bit of irritation there. The server wasn't downright rude but there was a not friendly, resentful air to the whole thing. Some of the staff needs to work on their friendliness.  

Did I mention a lot of the menu seemed a bit overpriced even for Passyunk? My best advice is to save your money and just splurge on Laurel one night- its absolutely worth it and the service we received there was not the least bit pretentious or resentful.

Garces is at it again.  Ordered delivery tonight and only received half of the order.  Claimed they were out of meatballs for one of only four sandwiches on the menu.  No call to ask for substitution, they just assumed the person who ordered the sandwich did not need to eat!  Had same experience with Garces' Rosa Blanca before it went under.  No wonder he is crashing.  But I guess it's my fault.  Fool me once....

We were excited to get to Reno to eat at Macaroni Grill. I am disappointed to say it was Horrible!! I ordered dpi i h and artichoke dip. It can as we were finishing our meal. It was ice cold inside, the bread was gross and microwaved texture. The Bibb and Blue salad was tiny and had an overwhelming flavor of the pickle juice from the pickled onions. The service was terrible. We waited for about 5 minutes for silverware AFTER getting our food. I have to say the five of us all had a horrible meal. We will not be going back. Awful food and mediocre service at best.  Steer clear!

I've been here twice now and both times my gel manicure lasted only a week before it started chipping whereas they usually last 2 - 3 weeks.
