I also don't understand why when I was there the second time, one woman did my manicure and then my pedicure when there were three employees there literally doing nothing but checking their phones. In every other salon I've been to, if there's the ability to do both simultaneously, they will. I don't think I'll be back.

Lively diner in the heart of the french quarter. Lots of locals inside. That aspect of it was fun.

But I'm not sure why this place gets good reviews. None of the people in my group liked the food. We came here for breakfast. My pancakes were average and came with fake syrup and margarine instead of butter, both in little packages. One of us ordered eggs over medium and they were not over medium. The little round sausage patties were dry and overcooked. The coffee was awful too but I pretty much expect that from a diner. 

There are too many great places to eat breakfast in the quarter to waste time on this place. Maybe they have good lunch or dinner but I wouldn't return here for breakfast.

Yesterday I came here to shop for the semi-annual sale and wanted to use my coupon, but the cashier told me it doesn't work when it wasn't expired and hasn't been used. She didn't scan my app for the reward points, but only scanned the coupon from it. She didn't really know what she was doing.

Food was amazing and the hosts and other servers were also.... just not our server "D" (not gonna call him out officially but makes sense for the disappointment) who put a bitter taste in our mouth. Not very friendly and his demeanor was just rude. We even made a joke that he had more of a Jersey attitude than I did. Nashville has been a great trip and we have had a great time except for the Burger Republic unfortunately . It got to the point where we just wanted to take our food (still didn't eat it yet) but common sense for him was to give us those mini boxes that couldn't the entire burger. Thankfully the rest of the wait staff saved the day. It is unfortunate but if you just wanna go for a quick bite, definitely would recommend this spot for great burgers. Just dont expect good service from the server we had.

Ordered food for delivery and it said it would take 45-50 minutes. After my boyfriend and I waited 45 minutes, they cancelled our order. Yelp then called us to say that the tablet that they use for their orders was out of service. Poor customer service!

not a fan...   Heard so much hype of this place.   ordered the Crabbie Fries which are froozen fries fried and old bay on them...   how does that make them world famous...   no idea.   and we ordered wings which were just a basic franks hot on them...   glad I tried them.   at least I got a picture with Lane Johnson....

I ordered lunch here last week and they said it would be ready in 30 minutes so I came 30 minutes later and it was not ready yet. So I waited patiently while they ran around serving the people who were eating and I was looking at them like is my food ready yet? And 20 minutes went by and thet hadn't even started cooking it yet. Another five minutes later, the old lady who works there said to me "we can't serve you." So I left. This is the worst service I have ever seen. I waited almost an hour. I will never be back. The first time was great but this time was the worst service ever.

This place is just terrible .  Started off with Lobster Dumplings that tasted like they came out of bag bought in Costco.  Pork Belly over some thing that I think was grits. My wife had some sort of grilled salmon with sweet potato hash.. And I had striped bass over far risotto...I have no idea what that was swimming in...They must of had a lot of left over pumpkin spice from the fall because everything tasted like it waste of 100 bucks....wtf

Absolutely horrible service. This was our worst experience in Nashville by far. The wait staff was terrible. Our drinks sat empty for over 40 minutes, we had to ask three different staff to ask him to stop by our table, and waited altogether over an hour and a half to get drinks, have our orders taken, get our food, drinks refilled. When food was brought out, they brought out wrong dishes, COLD food, and forgot an entire entree. When we asked to get things remade and brought out to us, the MANAGER, was horrendous. ("Sorry" was not said once)

"Our cheese just solidifies like that."

"Well I don't know what to tell you, we literally just made it sooo." 

"I guess we could remake that." 

"Here are those fries you were complaining about."

When checks were brought out, it was a MESS. Everyone's checks were wrong. Not a single check was correct, with food orders and drinks mismatched, charges incorrect, just a plethora of issues. 

Management here is horrible, the staff is rude and dismissive, the food was cold, undercooked and overpriced for what it was, and this was just a bad experience. This place REALLY put a damper on our last day in Nashville.

Unfortunately I didn't love the class. I took a fri hot 26 class and expected it to be challenging. Not only was it not at all challenging (in a calorie burn type of way) but the instructor made odd comments throughout the class. She constantly reminded us not to "half-ass" the workout, said fidgeting was a sign of anxiety that everyone around us would catch onto, called people out over and over for closing their eyes (during shavasana) or wiping sweat. I left feeling annoyed instead of relaxed. Probably won't be going back. I have had MUCH better experiences at CAMP Tampa.

The food is okay. If you are having a ridiculous Mexican-food craving, it will get the job done.
My problem is, they get my order wrong every. single. time. And they are not small mistakes. Something is missing or completely off (e.g. I ordered a bowl and got a burrito. Didn't realize until I got home and ended up scraping the food from the tortilla into my own bowl. Horrible waste of tortilla, I know, but I just don't eat it and didn't want it.) I didn't speak up the first time but have begun to now, and the staff honestly could have cared less.

My girlfriend and I went to happy hour yesterday,  14 Sept 2018, at a friends suggestion.  Ordered oysters to start,  couldn't really figure out what was wrong with the cocktail sauce,  it was so runny that you couldn't get it to stay on the oyster.  I asked for some ketchup and horseradish on the side,  so we could mix it to taste but got the same runny crap. The bartender / waitress was oblivious to our request for better service, and by the time she was done ruining to the back, for anyyhing she needed, the oysters were getting warm due to the fact they were not served on ice. In my humble opinion ice should not be an issue for a restaurant/bar, this of course forced us to eat them quicker than we would have liked.

I inquired about the Bistro burger which says on the menu ask server for details,which I did she explained what a wonderful burger w all the toppings, not one time did she describe it would be two thin patties over cooked. I distinctly asked if I order it medium it will be pink in The middle correct? Perfect time to inform me it is two thin patties...sorry misinformed,over cooked, over priced. Would have been happier w a thick burger from Hardee's

Twice I've came here and witnessed workers with non gloved hands eating tortilla chip right out of the chip tub behind the counter. . So gross! Both times they looked right at me and kept on eating them as I picked my shocked mouth up off the floor. Also got charged for guac I didn't buy. Gave me a refund to my debit card only for me to see the receipt said refund -CASH, which they didn't give me.  I'm going back w the receipt for my money

Went out for a family gathering of about ten people.   Bar and dining area was mostly empty.  We knew something was strange because we had half our group get their food and then half sit there without food for nearly fifteen minutes.   When they brought out the remainder of the food the manager came with them and I said oh that's really good customer service.   But alas, that wasn't why he was there.  He came out because my food was terrible.  They actually did not fully cook the macaroni noodles and they were literally crunchy.  They actually heard me complaining about it, which I did merely because my wife asked why I wasn't eating.  I don't send food back at a restaurant because having worked in the food industry I know better than to anger the cooks.  They kindly gave me two free drinks on my bill but I would never eat there again.   With the amount of competition in town for food establishments this was truly a poor showing by them.

Customer service is terrible... bar tenders are not always attentive...  at times, they seem to want you to beg for a beer...  
The bar isnt that busy to be ignored as much as they have.
Food is ok...  portions tend to be small

I stopped here to have lunch with my family.  The waitress brought us room temp tap water in a cup with no ice & no straw.  I had to ask 3xs for a straw.  We ordered & I wanted pork fried rice instead of reg fried rice, the waitress took issue with that.  I told her I didn't care about an up-charge that was fine, I just wanted pork fried instead.  Then I requested my spring roll not to b Shrimp bc I'm allergic & she was strange about that.  We got our food n ate.  I was not impressed the food was ok.  The pork in my rice was fatty & just not good. My veg spring roll had nothing in it no veggies.  Everyone's food was mediocre.  Next thing we know a party of 10 walk in & guess what they get..... lunch special menus.  We were not given that menu or option to view it when we were seated.  Had I paid less for my mediocre food & service I might have not been so upset.  When we asked the waitress about why we were not given lunch menus she said " you need to ask for it".  Since when is it my job & not the waiters job to ask them about specials.  Any other place will inform you about special either for lunch or of that day.  I will not be going back here & I don't nor will I recommend it to anyone.

this is my second review of this restaurant. and i just had to take the time to review it and it's been awhile since i've been there and i highly doubt that i will go back and this is why i'm putting this in bold letters. upon my immediately arrival to this restaurant i brought acquaintance of mine, that we used to always go out and dine together so when she had recommendations and i did i would always pass them along and vice versa. this was one of my suggestions. bad mistake i brought my service dog as usual as he follows me everywhere. i immediately asked for the first lady that had greeted me on my prior visit with such warmth and treated my service dog as one of hers as well and was greeted with the most rudest, poor excuse of a server i've ever met. not only did she treat me and my dinner guest as inconveniences but i could hear her whispering to her fellow employees that my service dog was probably fake and other little nasty comments. i was two seconds away from slapping all my documentation interface proving that he is real that i have for my dr and all the tags that he has on his body but i chose to hold my composure and show her that i was more then a lady then  she would ever be. i was raised with much more respect than that people that bring in these fake service dogs piss me off so much that those of us that really have a disability and need them get looked at crazy and get the nasty snotty comments from immature non educated people like my server was. little did she realize my dinner guest had not seen my service dog in years as he has known her since he was 6 weeks old and he is now 12. so never judge the outside of a person. but once he got his missing out of the way he set politely by my side in his bed and patiently waited for us to finish. our meals were absolutely disgusting and did the waitress yeah she was a waitress not a server tell us that the lasagna could serve two people no she did not. but it was slapped on a plate and looked like slop. my pizza was burnt and look nothing like the first post that i showed you. this review definitely got a 1 and please know if i had a choice to give it a negative something it would have because not only was i treated and my dinner guest treated with the utmost disrespect i would never show my face in this place ever ever ever again.  funny people show many faces, i'm pretty sure sure she showed her face to get her job. then her true colors came out. i wonder how many times true colors really do shine.
The worst! Filled with homeless people. So, they treat everyone like homeless. Very rude service! Even if you're a paying customer.

This was possibly the worst meal I have ever had in a restaurant. The Madeira Beach Chamber of Commerce should fine this restaurant for representing the beach so poorly. This restaurant is a typical example of a tourist trap. The food is overpriced, and the food quality is very low. 

We ordered a calamari which was served with a sauce that was obviously A can of diced tomatoes in tomato sauce. I ordered grilled salmon, which came with broccoli and french fries. The french fries had been fried in the same grease as the fish, and had obviously been left to soak in the grease after it was done. The broccoli, while fresh, was nothing but steamed broccoli, without even butter or seasoning. The salmon was bland possibly frozen. My partner ordered chicken portobello. The sauce tasted like a watered down lemon sauce and the portion was so small that it was shameful. 

The service was adequate although we did wait outside for a hostess for almost 5 minutes. Eventually we had to walk inside and request to be seated. Our waitress was adequate, although she clearly had other responsibilities which prevented her from giving us her best attention.

As a resident of Madeira Beach I am ashamed of this restaurant. I recommend that you go someplace else rather than this wretched restaurant. Don't be fooled by the view or the ambience, it is most miss-leading. If your hungry go to Delosas Pizza, at least you know what you are getting there, and you will get what you pay for.

This restaurant is in my neighborhood and I love coming here for good beer and food. I've been really turned off from coming to the 8th ave location in the past 3 months because the service has been pretty bad. It takes 15 minutes to put in a beer order and the servers usually are standing around talking and ignoring my table. I go with my boyfriend and we are both very patient customers who work in restaurants so we try to be understanding but I really don't think I plan on coming back anytime soon. The location on Charlotte has way better service and is less busy so I plan on going to there down the line. I live 5 min from the 8th ave location and 20 min from the West nashville one and I would rather drive further for the service. It's that bad at 8th. Food is great and so is the beer so it's a huge bummer.

First experience at this location, food was too soggy and greasy to finish eating, obviously bagged chicken strips with no quality. Tamale was soggy and doughy would never order that again. Too loud to have any kind of conversation. I'm NY honest opinion my money would be better spent at Kroger.

Lunch buffet is gross and has not much variety. Chicken tikka masala is Campbell's tomato soup base. They replenish buffet by dumping bowls of refill into trays, not replacing the whole tray. Ambiance is pretty so it's a shame. It's basically Indian fast food.

This has to be the worst place for customer service around! I keep going back for that damn stuffed crust, so i can't give it up altogether. However, each time i order, it takes 2-3 times the original quoted time to actually arrive. They tell me 30-40 minutes and it's at least 2 hours EVERY TIME. I usually do pickup, but there are times that I can't. I wish someone would whip this place into shape and at least give REALISTIC wait times!

St Patrick's day, they bombed. Went for lunch on St Patrick's day. Big mistake. Service was extremely slow. I was craving a rueben, not on the menu, so I ordered a BLT figuring it would be quick and easy. The music was very loud and we didn't want to stay any longer than necessary. I took a bite of the BLT and realized there was NO bacon on it, not just a small amount, NONE. Our waitress never came to check on us, empty drink glasses and all. By the time she showed up we were ready to go. I pointed out that there was NO bacon on my sandwich. The manager took a few dollars off a sandwich I didn't eat. As we left, parched from no refills, I noticed several people eating ruebens. Seriously, we weren't even told about the specials. Left hungry and thirsty after paying a hefty check. Please, if you advertise a St Patrick's day party, BE PREPARED, staff up and don't act surprised you're busy.

I've been to lunch twice, once on a weekend and another on a weekday. Being very busy on the weekend visit, I was never offered naan and had to ask for water refills several times. The service on the weekday was much better, as the restaurant wasn't 25% full. Both times the buffet was heavy on chicken dishes and sadly one dish tasted very much like the other. They weren't bad, just nothing that stood out. On the first visit the paneer was dry and firm, but was soft and much better on the second visit. The cashier being in the corner and surrounded by tables was very awkward while checking out during the busy weekend. Not sure I'll be back.

Been a few times and the food takes forever each time. I mean it's literally the first thing they warn you about when you sit down. I get that deep dish takes a long time to bake but even when we order thin crust it takes a freaking hour. Server explained that it's not just bake time but also because of 'oven capacity', so maybe they should get another oven??? How you gonna be a pizzeria and not have oven space for more than a few pies at a time?

I was super stoked and excited to finally try dutch Bros and I was very disappointed when I ordered a cold brew with light ice and gave me my coffee with lots of ice so I returned it and & I said light ice so she takes out all the ice and when she give me back the cup it was less than halfway full?! I was confused why didn't they fill up the rest of my cup? & so she said that she had to charge me for another can to fill up the rest of my coffee that I alredy paid for?! That's ridiculous the fact that they tried to recharge me for it!wont be returning! -_- lost me & everyone I'm about to tell this story 2! If I could rate it a 0 I would

My husband was there visiting our son last week. He had the short rib and gnocchi. Next day on his way to Arkansas began what would be a hellish whole week in with severe food poison! After being deathly ill in his air b&b room for two days, our son had to fly over to him to end up rushing him to emergency where they admitted him for 3 days! :(  let's make this morbid story short and say, it's been a week and 3 days later he's on a load of meds and still has the affects of it.  Bummer deal, but grateful he's back home in Wa.

I've always liked Kers. 
They keep the restaurant clean and always friendly staff.  But !!  Myself and two coworkers had lunch there yesterday (7/18/18) and we all became sick within minutes of leaving the restaurant.  
   The only common food we had was chicken wings.  We thought they didn't taste as good as usual but we didn't want to complain.  
    I'm hoping they caught the problem and prevented anyone else from getting sick.

Super disappointed. I ordered two dishes; one vegetarian noodle and a chicken curry. I asked for extra mixed vegetables in the noodle dish but that wasn't the case when I received it. Also, the chicken curry dish was all zucchini and bell peppers, I mean there was only enough meat to feed a small child. The curry was very bland too. All of this for almost $30. Only gave 2 stars because the portions were decent. Better off getting Thai food up the road by Winn Dixie.
Was charged $2 for water out the sink in a cup. Catfish was flavorful but not cooked to order.

Stay way from this place if you want to stay healthy. I have visited this place for couple of time and both times i have experienced different problems. In my fist visit, i found a piece of hair in my food. And in my second visit i just had a egg puff and pastry which upset my stomach instantly. They need to consider this seriously otherwise these guys will be in  big trouble.

Very rude customer service.

I went to return an online item within 30 days with a receipt. The woman at customer service scans the item and says they don't sell it anymore and she can't take it back.

I pointed out it was within 30 days and I have a receipt, when purchasing there would be no way for me to know the store was going to stop carrying an item. I was so omg told rudly, it can't be done and NO solution was presented.

I asked for a manager and it was taken care of in 2 seconds by finding the item number through my online order. So not only can it be done, but the customer service representative was very rude through the whole process.

We came here with confidence, giving the ratings on Yelp.... Big mistake! We had some crab cakes: tasteless and oily. Then lobster pasta and shrimp and scallops pastas: we are both pretty sure the seafood was frozen! A shame on a pier!!! Everything was literally tasteless, and the pastas were tasting like onion only. Finally, the wine was quite good, but served in cheap water glasses!!!! Sad and frustrating experience.... for 85$....

Terrible service aside from the trainee who got us started - sucks that it was his first day, he should literally get out now. Open seating but waited over an hour and never even got our food. At that point we left and ended up just grabbing a bagel for brunch. Worst service ever had. Would have been way better to wait in the lines of the actual good places around like biscuit love or pancake pantry. DO NOT COME HERE AWFUL.

This women does not care about making money. We walked in and were looking to buy a bunch of stuff to take back home when she literally kicked us out because she was on her "lunch break". Why is the store open when you're on your lunch break? Very rude.

Went through the drive-thru on the evening of 5/8/18. I ordered a bowl of onion soup and a baguette.  Not only was I short-changed (which I caught), but they neglected to give me my piece of baguette.

I will NOT patronize this location again.  Morons At Work.

Never coming here again. First off, it took FOREVER to get the food we ordered. Second, the drinks came in dirty glasses, and when we asked for refills, we got half a cup more of soda. The food was cold by the time we got it and instead of silverware we got plastic utensils. Additionally, our table was dirty. The dessert card was splattered with drinks and was sticky.

Apps and cocktails were great, but the pasta dish was wayyy too salty.  They remade it and same issue.  Wife had the same dish and it wasn't as bad.   They took mine off the check, but no manager visit or service recovery past the waitress, who was great.  Won't be back though

I really liked this place at one time.   Now the service has suffered.  Staff is pleasant enough, but not on their game.   Seated for more than 10 minutes without even an  "I'll be right with you"  I finally stopped the hostess walking by, and asked if we had one.  We stopped for a quick bite before heading to theater.  Normally go to Meadows, which is awesome!  We were late for our show.   No sense of urgency at all.

This used to be one of our favorite places for a quick burger,  even when there was a line. Tonight,  no line and waiting 20 minutes for 2 burgers and 1 fry? Done,  never again. We've seen it go down hill over the years but this is the last time.

Burgers say there 12 minutes while they made the fries... which were disgusting!

First off, I am in California. I ordered a used Rocktron Gainiac online from the Tucson store. I just received the unit today. The moron who packaged the unit enclosed the wrong power supply which would have damaged the unit. I am unable to plug it in to verify. The Rocktron Gainiac requires a 9 volt AC power supply with a minimum of 1.5 amp current. The dumb@$$ sent me a 9 volt DC power supply rated at 150 milliwatts. This power supply would more than likely damage the unit. I am unable to verify because I am intelligent enough not to use the wrong value power supply. In good faith, I paid for a working quality effects unit and I cannot even use it. This kind of incompetence really pisses me off. This makes me wonder if Guitar Center hires morons. I expect a functional power supply and an undamaged unit or I want my money back.

Maybe it was because we were there at 4:00, but the food was mediocre, at best. I had the shrimp & grits and it was ok, but would have been better if it didn't taste left over from lunch. My friend had the gumbo and crab cakes and she wasn't impressed either.

This diner is the definition of ironic, it's a run down dinner in the middle of one of the nicest (and most expensive) parts of Nashville. From what I could tell there was not a posted health score anywhere to be found, the floors are a lot cleaner than I read about in previous reviews. But my major issue with the place Is that while watching my burger being cooked the cook took a small break to eat some of her burger that was laying out in the prep area ( if I had to guess that's a reason for not posting the health score) to her credit she did remove her glove to eat and then put it back on when returning to cook my food
Upon receiving my burger it came without the bacon, but the cook very apologetic quickly fixed the mistake 


The food isn't bad at all, it's not great, but it's not bad. 

This could be a great place if properly managed!!!

I will return for another meal as I frequent the movie theatre next door 

A possible helping hint, don't advertise that all you're ingredients are the freshest, when they are very obviously frozen and canned, but still tasty
30 minutes for corn bread, no signs for men's/women's restrooms, not a fan. Oh and the hush puppies were worse than Long John Silvers. But Lee the bartender is a good dude...thumbs up Lee!

I don't even know where to begin aside from if I was able to give 0 stars I would. I wish I had read yelp reviews before wasting 2 hrs of my Friday night. We went there after my daughter's preschool graduation this past Friday since it was close to her school. Walking in it was a nice atmosphere, that's all I can say nice about this restaurant. Starting off it took 15 minutes to even order drinks. I ordered sprite for my daughter and asked for lemonade for my son.  They said they were out of lemonade but had Hawaiian Punch, I turned down the punch because of the high sugar content and opted for water which I'm certain came straight from the faucet. They came back with punch anyways stating the sprite was out.  We ordered the garlic bread since they were out of two other appetizers we wanted. They brought them out uncut and gave me a steak knife to cut myself. One was so burnt I'm confident they wrapped it in foil and put it in the microwave to catch on fire.  I sent that back and said to just take it off our bill. My husband and I both ordered the pasta with shrimp and garlic cream sauce. When it came out it was a big lump of extremely gummy mush that I wouldn't eat if it was 6 months in to the zombie apocalypse. The sauce was straight from a can and the top was covered in shrimp that wasn't even big enough to consider salad shrimp, all cold. I couldn't even order another meal as they were out of everything! My children had spaghetti, again cold and from a can. My nephew ordered a calzone,  then informed us they were out so he got pizza. Again,not cut they brought a pizza cutter for us to do ourselves.  There is so much more, but this alone was worth warning others. I am not even sure they have a working kitchen aside from a microwave, not to mention all the food is bought at a local grocery store I'm assuming frozen.Obviously I have no desire to go back. I am baffled they have stayed in business this long. It's so unorganized it's actually very sad. 76$ later even with items removed I had fruit loops for dinner..

I was really disappointed by my visit here. The donuts were very thick and rubbery like they had been sitting out for many hours. I tried 3 different flavors and none of them were particularly enjoyable.

For what I paid per night, this isn't a great hotel. I'm a Hilton honors member and have never stayed in a Hilton property that I didn't like until now. I have to point out that the staff is very friendly and helpful. That was the beet part of my stay. Paying $150/night on a Wednesday in August was a bit outrageous. I wouldn't pay more than $80/night for this place. It looks like the rooms were somewhat recently renovated but were done so in a cheap/hurry-up fashion. The bathroom tiles were loose and grout missing everywhere, the shower frame had black smudges along the bottom, the shower water handle was coming apart from the wall, there were black fingerprints and tape on the bedroom door, my key didn't work for the gym... I am not one to leave many negative reviews as I'm a simple person. But this hotel is not a value at $150/nt. Next time I'm in town, I'll be staying somewhere else. The free breakfast and nightly social (Mon-Thurs) is nice.

Tonight I attempted to order food from this restaurant despite the bad experience I had in the past. So I placed my order online, payment took off my card, once I got in my car and was on my way I received a call from the pizza hut stating We can complete your order because we don't have any product, when I was trying to explain my frustration the unprofessional young lady hung up the phone on me. Avoid this location if possible. The food is subpar and the service is very poor. Hope the owner or manager read these bad review and re-vamp his/her team, or the owner re-vamp the whole staff.

We have always loved the banh mi sandwiches here but our experience this weekend was disappointing. I got a noodle salad with shrimp, spicy pork and an egg roll. The pork lacked that char grilled flavor. The egg roll (which contained ground shrimp and pork) had a funny smell and tasted off. When my husband tasted it he said the meat was bad and not to eat it. We told the server and he brought out Lilly who insisted the egg rolls are made fresh daily and it was the taro root in it that tasted that way. We didn't say anything else but my husband, who is Vietnamese and owns his own restaurant said it was not the taste of taro because it's something he eats. He knows the smell of bad meat. I'm disappointed she did not at least offer to take the uneaten egg roll off our bill or replace it. 
Not surprisingly I got sick that afternoon from that one bite of egg roll and was in the bathroom and felt awful the rest of the day. I typically have a cast iron stomach but not this time.  I don't think I'll be eating egg rolls again there.

My experience at this restaurant today was extremely disappointing. The food wasn't terrible, but it wasn't great either. Everything from the steak to the side dishes were off and the food did not live up to all of the restaurant's legacy and hype. After today, I will never be going back here again. 

I may as well go buy some prime steaks or filets at the market on my own and make my own dish. I would never ever recommend this place to any of my colleagues, friends or family. If you want a good steak, go to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse instead. 

When we told the waiter how disappointing and below average our food had been, the response from "the back" was that they weren't at their best tonight because there were too many people. Okay... so great! That meant that they knew the food was going to be shitty, but they still accepted customers anyways.... 

In short, I do not appreciate this kind of laziness and irresponsibility when it comes to fine dining. I need my fine dining to be fine dining. There was no honesty to this type of response and food. This was not fine at all, folks. Not fine at all. Avoid.

Room was small.. when I arrived the door to my room was open and an alarm clock was just thrown on the bed. I went up front to double check if they meant to give me that room, they said yes that they had only opened the room to make sure it was clean. I then laid in bed for about an hour when I saw something move. YEP- bed bugs. So I smushed it, and began pulling the sheets back only to find more blood spots on the comforter. I quickly got my belongings out and went up front where I got treated poorly by the man at the front desk because I didn't want to switch rooms and I simply wanted to leave. DONT STAY HERE!
I could have done my own nails better, and I suck at painting my own nails. The people there are not very interactive, borderline rude.

The restaurant is nice and the food was not bad however the service was extremely poor. It was a date night and they even had a valentine's special going on. The waiter rushed us throughout.The main course was served immediately with appetizers.  The waiter even offered to take our plates while we were eating and we had to tell him we were not done. We were out of the restaurant in 30 mins. Not a great experience for a date night. Might be good for an everyday lunch/dinner when you want to finish your meals and get back to work/home quickly.
Not hygienic and Fresh. Ordered Chicken Biryani, Mutton Biryani, Palak Paneer. One of my friends had Stomach flu after having the food.

Came here for brunch - had an omlette ($19 + tax and tip = $26). Food was wayyyyyyy over-salted, and way overpriced. Atmosphere is nice and service was good; I've heard it's better for dinner, but for the price / portion size, probably wouldn't check it out.

I waited over 30 min for food that came out wrong and was met with indifference. The bartender was nice but seemingly clueless. It was just an overall bad experience and management was absent. No one came out to fix x the situation
edamame was overcooked, and not seasoned. My spider roll tasted old and was made poorly

Always seen this restaurant and never stop so today my husband and I decided to give it a try.  Came in through a store which was quite busy and had some interesting things.  I may pick up on the way out.  Got seated promptly and waited five minutes for our server Lacey to take our drink orders.... she asked if we were also ready to order food but I explained this was our first  time dining here so instead of giving highlights she walked off.... When she came back 5 min later with our drinks and proceeded to take our oder.... walked off and never returned to refill our drinks (coffee and water).   We had to ask another server  for that.  The next time she came back (15 min later) was to bring food.  The manager walked pass our table asking others how were their dining experience guess our opinion didn't matter.  Well let's get to the food:

Food was subpar we both ordered the smoke house breakfast.... the only thing from this dish that was good was the biscuits!!!  Both of our Grits were under cooked. My eggs were fried and chopped (there version of scrambled) and the gravy was bland.  Maybe this was an off day but I wasn't impressed if I come back I will definitely try something new and if this location I would need a different server.

We were there for a family dinner last Sunday and we had to be guided over to where the dinner was at. The place was huge! And parking, oh don't even get me started on that! The parking lot itself is a huge maze! The food was subpar, nothing like I would have expected from the Gaylord. The tropical plants were cool to look at, but it all felt very cheesy and overdone. The waiters were very nice. The only good thing about the dinner was the peach cobbler! I ate three little servings of that and I'm not a big fan of peach. I had to add some sugar to it but it was really good. That's the only reason why this place gets a 2 star rating instead of a 1 star rating.

Poor customer service and phone etiquette by some of the staff, Sig delays in responding to phone calls.  Woken up at 3AM by security loudly banging on the room door to ask if water was running in my room...No it's not, it's called "sound machine"!!! Waking me up for this??really??

Restaurant Week Fail! We met a group of friends to celebrate a birthday during Restaurant Week in January.  After over an hour waiting for food, they sent complimentary soups and bread. The soup was a coagulated mess. When the food finally arrived, it was a disaster and was cold.  One of the guests found a hair fried into their crab cake.  My steak was so dry that when I tried to cut it, it flew off the table. The tiny piece that I tried had an odd taste that led me to believe it was old.  The manager did apologize.  However, she attempted to convince me that the steak was put under a broiler and cooked too long.  I have had steak at every price point from Outback to Maestros and never had something so disgusting.  Pass.

Food was very bad. Don't know what else to say but save your money. Can't see this place staying open very much longer. Had fajitas and shells were old and beef was extremely over cooked and included cooked mushy tomatoes in the mixture. Not even steak not sure what it was. Mexican is hard to find in Pasco but I definitely wouldn't recommend this place.

This place could be really cool but It has been neglected and the food is kind of mediocre. Plus my waiter was terrible during a slow lunch it took forever to get anything. My coffee was cold and he brought me the wrong ramen. Instead of complaining I just paid and left.. what a way to spending a break from jury duty.

The reason I give more than one star is that at least I can grab an Upland Wheat on tap. Otherwise, my experiences here consistently fail.

I was a regular at the Bloomington Upland when I was at IU, and I rejoiced when I found out about this taproom upon my relocation to the Indy/Carmel area.

The rejoicing ended once I ordered food and felt the atmosphere. The food is inconsistently average. The atmosphere is not welcoming; it is not the home I knew and loved at the Bloomington Upland. I voiced this once to the manager on duty, and he quickly shut down my opinion. "This is not Bloomington," he said. But, this is Upland. My experience did not match my expectation of the brand I had come to love. 

I am compelled to write this review now that I find out that samples are $1 each. If you want me to become a fan of your beer, you should at least be willing to invest in shelling out .5 oz of the stuff to develop loyalty. 

I am saddened to write this, as every so often I try giving this place a chance in the hopes that my views will change. Maybe next time I come, I'll enjoy it a bit more.
He no longer accepts new patients. The receptionist was also no help. :-(

I am extremely mad!! I came from the one on oddie Boulevard. An they we're supposed to be open but no they were closed. I was greeted at the drive-up window with the sign saying they are closed for cleaning but I didn't see anybody cleaning inside. So that unfortunately meant I had to drive all the way over to. A jack on the box the 7th Street one in Reno.

I was not greeted or acknowledged by anyone in this store. Once a picked an item up and walked to another area of the store an associate nearby asked if I needed help. She had not offered to help me prior to me selecting an item. I informed her that I was still looking around and she offered no further assistance. I selected and other item and walked around the store looking for someone to ring me up. I finally found someone and she only asked if someone had helped me. I replied "absolutely not". She simply rang me and that was that. I then stopped by the shoe department and again no acknowledgement from anyone.

Went for Italian nite Wednesday. I had eggplant parm. and it was so salty that I was cringing from the saltiness. The eggplant was cut pretty thin and layered,which makes me believe it was not fresh. I didn't want to complain because we had brought a relative from out of town. They took the dish away and brought back noodles and salt taste was almost gone. My relative had fettucione and clams. He too complained about the food. 
Italian Nite did not go so well. Maybe they should stick to the fish dishes, etc. Always enjoyed the food on previous visits.

Call me heart broken!!!! Muriel's of my dreams has passed... I travel to Nola several times a year and Muriel's is always top on my fav places.  Unfortunately my dinner last night was sooooo bad I doubt I can recover.  

We were called to a bar side table no linen ok I thought not what want but go with it this is going to be good.  Server of team 17 came to the table and mumbled something ask 5 times for a drink order before she would bring a menu after I told her we needed to select wine after we decided what to eat... when asked about the Reds she said "I don't know but this one seems to be ordered a lot".  We waited nearly 30 mins between our soup and the app then our main course sat on a tray behind us for 12 mins.  My baby drum which is my all time fav was dry cold and burnt as well as the Sauce needed hydrated it was so salty.  Had to ask her to clear nearly every plate .. Desert was served had to ask for silverware and no mention of coffee or another glass of wine.   

Insult to injury she took CC and ran it 5 times setting off my fraud alert after clearing it with bank she ran it again and simply left it on table.  No apology not thank you nothing.
Food sucks, service sucks, would not come back. Not a lot of choices food wise. Drink menu small.

Came into today with my boyfriend and ordered an iced cinnamon almond milk macchiato, caramel nonfat frappuccino & a venti blonde roast with a shot of espresso. They messed up all 3 drinks and our sandwiches came out burnt after waiting for 20 minutes after ordering.

This place is absolutely terrible!!!! Never go here! My first time there was a bad experience and I decided to give it another shot thinking it may have just been a one time thing. I was wrong and my second experience was worse. I ordered a burrito with only rice, beans and meat without the veggies which would seem simple enough. NOT... I took the burrito from the cashier at the drive thru window and went home to enjoy my burrito. Once I took the first bite I realized that there was nothing wrapped in the tortilla other than plain meat and they had forgotten to add beans and rice! I was in complete shock to think that someone could forget to add the basics of a burrito! I had to drive all the way back to try to get my order fixed which was super inconvenient. What's worse is that I arrived to find the door locked a few minutes before they were supposed to actually close (It was a late night meal). I went through the drive thru in hopes that they would help me there but they didn't. The person inside saw me at the window and did not acknowledge me even though they weren't officially closed. Long story short I called several times with no answer and knocked on the drive thru window at the same time. After a million calls they finally picked up the phone, came to the window and "fixed" my order. They still didn't make the bean, rice and meat burrito correctly. Just a huge joke.

Was there for lunch this past Sunday. Placed order and after waiting an hour four our food, decided we'd waited long enough and got up and left. Our order was anything but out of the ordinary....... a bowl of gumbo, a bowl of oatmeal with fresh fruit and a chicken salad sandwich. We weren't the only ones having a problem. There were two other diners that also were fed up with the wait and left after waiting a little longer than we had. If I could rate the restaurant ZERO stars, I would.

The wait list for this place is awful and really mismanaged.  Poor service by the hostess and staff answering the phone.  Don't ever visit this place to eat!!  The hostess staff that who work here are worthless!!!  Learn how to hire better people.

When I heard that Felix's was taking over the Brisbi's location, I was excited. It's close to home & not in the Quarter. Sadly, it was a disappointment. I think they're used to feeding tourists who don't know better. The quality and quantity of their food was less than mediocre. We started with the charbroiled oysters which were tiny and dry. They were served with some hard, stale French bread. Then, I had the seafood salad which was supposed to be shrimp and lump crabmeat on a bed of mixed greens. It amounted to $18 for 5 boiled shrimp on a huge bed of old iceberg lettuce - the kind with brown edges, and the   crabmeat was definitely not fresh. Even the tomatoes were past ripe and inedible. I had one of their hush puppies from my friend's plate, and it was cold and stale. (Take a lesson from Zea's. Theirs are amazing!) My husband had the shrimp pasta and his had only 5 shrimp as well.  So, unless they improve their offerings, count me out. Too bad because the waiters were working hard and the location in the water is lovely.

Update. Today we really wanted to come and enjoy ourselves here. Service from our waitress was awful. She didn't ask if we wanted refills on our soft drink or our 2 for 1 drinks. She looked super out of place. Like she didn't know what she was doing. Never asked how we were. Waited an our for our food to come out. Then when our waitress brought our ticket to pay, she charged us for an extra drink and upcharged a meal. I had to let her know that it needed to be changed. Her response was, " oh. Ok I guess I'll go change it for you." It was 2 for 1 so it shouldn't have been a double charge. She made our morning brunch a bad experience. Even though we frequent ML Rose, we will probably not come back to this location if we were to get her again. Other than that the food was good.

Pros: 
Family friendly, convenient location, great crowd, clean and no drunks in the restaurant during the day!

Cons:
Service is horrible, a little too expensive, waiters/waitresses pretend you're not there, the space is small and crammed, do not expect to get your food served right when it is ready, and if you ask something to the waiter/waitress they will get an attitude and get offended like you are inconveniencing them. (Don't get the french toast)

Conclusion: 
If you want to sit down and take a break from the walking and etc., this establishment should be not the last choice but one not your first.

This place has seen much better days. 

I went to this theater so many times as a kid and absolutely loved it, but now I think I'm done watching movies there entirely. Now, as a film loving adult, this place's atmosphere and presentation are unbearable compared to what else is available. 

The past three times I've seen a movie here, the screen was way too cool in the whites, super blurry, and weirdly dim. At first, I thought it was a problem with the particular theater, yet it keeps consistent months apart. 

A few days ago I saw Avengers: Infinity War on my own at another theater about 30 mins away and remember the extreme details and vivid colors very well. And today I saw it again with my family here and I was nearly squinting the entire time because it felt like any sign of vividness or life had been sucked out of the picture. 

This place needs an upgrade, fast. Otherwise, it's just going to die a slow and painful death.

We stopped  in after dinner and the staff were very unwelcoming. We arrived at 8:30 and the place was almost shut down even though they don't close until 9. All deserts were put up and they were more concerned about closing up the shop than serving customers. You would think that 8:30 wasn't that late for a Friday night.

this place is popular because its trendy. other than cool instagram photos, they have nothing good going for them. they make their food seem revolutionary but they just overcharge for ok tasting burgers

I tried the chili dog with cheese mustard and onions with a side of fries.  The service was friendly, but the only part of my order that I liked were the onions and mustard.  The bun was blah, the dog was blah, the chili was blah and the cheese was wiz.

Sorry, but there are MUCH better chili dogs in the area.
Food overpriced for New Orleans breakfast. Unbathed homeless frequent the front steps. Cajun hash browns aren't the norm. Great area and restaurant appears to be nice. Worst breakfast in NO, so far.

I give one star because a day or two after getting my screen replaced, I was sitting outside with my girlfriend and the screen cracked straight across with out any provocation. It was just sitting on the table, we watched it happen. I figured they didn't put the screen on correctly or it was a faulty screen. When I called to tell them, they acted as if I was lying about it. The guy literally said, "at this point it's our word against yours." This crack was no normal crack, in a perfectly straight line right across the screen. He then said I could come in for him to look at but there was no guarantee they would replace it. At that point I felt accused of lying and opted out to have a professional replace the screen rather then deal with them any longer.

So disappointed in this place.  I dropped off an Alienware desktop for repairs, as it began glitching out and making beeping sounds. I was told they'd get back to me within 24-72 hours. Followed up for an update 3 days later and the technician was salty and reminded me that it was 72 business hours.  Said the computer was making a beeping sound - yep, that's exactly why I brought it in.   Three more days passed with no calls so I followed up and said I  still hadn't heard anything, so the guy apologized and said he would contact the technician and I would receive a call "within the hour".  Nothing.   Four hours later, I called again and he said he had left a message for the technician, so I  said I was coming by to pick it up - to which he said "ok, no problem".    Went by and picked up the computer and they guy literally said nothing remorseful.   Don't waste your time with this outfit if it's not a broken screen, as anything else is apparently too complicated for them.

Kelly's " for just about anything" is no longer, RIP. First visit since new ownwership. New owners took everything away that was Kelly's; good service, outstanding food, even the unique salt and pepper shakers - gone. Started out waiting for table, we were told 45 min. Ok, Sunday morning 11:00, expected that. However, 90 min later, still not sat. Approached hostess and was told we were next table. Waited another 20 min. watching empty tables not get cleared. Approached manager about wait time, he said, unapologetically, "sorry, my wait staff didn't let me know." Now seated 2 hours later, was met with unfamiliar menu. Where was the Benedict specials of the day? Again, no longer. New menu equivalent to a Denny's, nothing special. The special service you always felt you got at Kelly's, gone, replaced with sad servers and matter of fact treatment. I will forever miss the old Kelly's. Save your time and find a better place.

Take out. The food was ready in 15 minutes. The Thai basil stir fry with chicken was very watery, too spicy, not flavorful. There was so much liquid in the dish that my side of rice was not able to soak everything up. This is not what I expected to see. It was spicier than I expected as well - on the phone the restaurant said it was a little spicy. I think the extra spice hid the fact that the dish was not flavorful. It was almost as if the stir fry was done half heartedly and then water was added after the fact.

Maybe with another dish or dining in the food quality would be better. I'm willing to give this place another try but I was not impressed with what I had.

If I could, I would give this place ZERO stars. I know a lot of people might say racism doesn't exist anymore, but being in Philadelphia for two days & I haven't seen it more in my entire life. Walked into this place & was told the wait for dining would be about 20-25 mins, no problem. My boyfriend decided to get some beer from the bar where we were neglected by the first bartender. When we finally got seated, we placed our food order right away which was about 5:00PM. A couple who came in after us was able to get their food & drinks about 10 mins after walking in yet we still hadn't gotten ours even forty mins after. In that forty mins we asked our server twice how much longer it would be till our food was ready, both times he told us 'shortly'. After realizing another couple had gotten their food already & we asked him again which he then told us 'I have no control over the kitchen'. At this point, we walked out. I'm saying this is racism because after I took a good look around, I noticed my boyfriend & I were the ONLY colored couple there. People should realize we are humans just like them, & just like everybody else we pay money for a service.
Tastes like McDonald's, But this place is soooo slow. I often have to repeat myself when placing and order as well.

When I looked up the hours of operation here it said 7 AM to 3 AM. I arrived just before 2:30 AM after a late movie to get some quick food, however when I pulled up I was refused service. Had I shown up 5 minutes before their closing time I would get that, but they were open for another HALF HOUR when I arrived. Why have hours of operation if you aren't going to provide the service you're there for in the first place?

Recently moved to the area so my bf and i decided to give this diner a chance. We walked in very late saturday night/ sunday morning around 2:30am and were greeted by a very nice gentleman at the front (not sure if he was the manager or owner). We were seated for about 5 minutes or so and were greeted by a waitress named Shannon. She didn't have much to say, just asked for our drink orders, very quick and to the point. My bf and I just thought that she was having a long day since it was in the middle of the night and didn't think anything of it at that time. She came back with our drinks asked us what we wanted to order and my bf and i probably said thank you at least 3-4 times throughout ordering and not once did she say you're welcome or acknowledge what we said. Again, we just thought that she was having a bad day. As we're waiting for our food, a party of 3 walk in and sit down behind us being very loud and obnoxious and our waitress Shannon, goes over there to greet them. Mind you, we've been keeping our volume to a minimum to be courteous of others around us. Shannon is at their table for a little while, laughing and smiling and talking with them just hitting it off. My bf and I notice that her whole demeanor has changed from our table to theirs. She brings us our food and again minimal to no conversation between us. To top it all off, she didn't inform us that we had to take the bill and pay for it in the front. We sat at the table for about 5 min or so until I had to ask her if we payed up in the front and she leisurely said "oh yeah sorry" and walked off after she walked past our table about 3 times and saw the card sitting there. I had to ask HER what to do. I've been a waitress for many years and I know how customers want to be treated and that wasn't it. It really spoiled the whole experience for us as this could've been our new go to diner. The food was great but i wish the service matched it. I don't know if it was because my boyfriend is African American and she has something against that or what because the table behind us were all Caucasian and she had no problem having a conversation with them. It's a shame.

Started off promising with the pick your steak theme. Then it all starts when our waiter comes to the table to take the drink and app order ... drinks to forever to get to the table, not to mention he forgot a couple things like a kids soda and lemons for the table . After the drinks are down he then takes our entree orders which he requested to start from the corner table so that he knows exactly what goes where .. after we place our orders the food comes out about an hour after the appetizers.. I brush it off since I didn't want to ruin my mood for the 22oz bone in rib eye .... only problem was he didn't know what went where when he came back , and two of the steaks were ordered medium and came to us well which of course we sent back and waited another frustrating 30 mins while the rest of the party of 9 left.. so now the manager comes out with our steaks and apologizes, which is fine and dandy. Only issue was they couldn't get our steaks right ... one comes back medium well and mine comes back well again.

Pretty frustrating trying to eat your first meal at dinner time and everything is ruined because the steak house couldn't get the steaks right ...

Sad to say

The gentleman started to remove my dipped nails by lifting them off. I told him they were dipped and needed to be soaked off. He said it will be fine. I walked out the door. I should not have to tell you what to do. I will not go back!

Biggest disappointment since the new Star Wars movie, "The Last Jedi."

This is your typical beach restaurant where you wonder how they're allowed to own such real estate while serving absolute garbage for food. I'd give less than 1 star, but 1) The app won't let me 2) Their service was friendly all around.

While my siren & I appreciated the kind serving staff all around, the food cannot ever bring us back. We started out with beer, & mozzarella sticks. My IPA wasn't bad, but my girl's Boston lager was skunked. The mozz sticks were decent with subpar marinara sauce.

Ok so here's the Star Wars plot. The bbq pulled pork sammich was placed in front of me. In my basket was a small sauce container of sweet baby rays. That, alone, should speak volumes. The fries were decent, but too few. The pork was cooked okay, but what's the point when there's no flavor or bbq to go with it (no I'm not counting a little tykes container of grocery sauce)? I also had a side of ranch. While the portion of that was acceptable, it was flavorless. My gf had fish & chips. She said it was chewy, the batter was overly greasy, & that you could get better at McDonald's.

What could possibly make this worse? The price tag. Could've bought a yacht for what we paid for this uninspired seagull scrap.

Rise above the stereotype & own this real estate. Don't settle just because of a slight view & live music.

Typical franchise nothing to rave about but I will say when compared to OutHouse Steakhouse it's certainly far superior! 

There is just nothing exciting or dynamic about this place the servers merely go thru the motions as does the kitchen don't ask for anything special .  

Overall like I said it's not horrible but they certainly can try harder.

I've been a few times when they first opened. Food was good not great but good enough for me to return. The wait is ridiculous and that's why I stopped going for like a year.. Went today and ordered cheesesteak rolls and beef egg foo young. They changed the cheesesteak rolls. It was mushy inside and it was some type of pasty sauce and onions. Not a piece of steak at all. I cut open my 2nd roll because I wanted to examine it and again no steak. The it had a chicken bouillon flavor. So weird didn't want to finish it. The beef is the egg foo young was tough and flavorless.. The egg part was also mushy.  I normally eat at the Chinese store across from overbrook hs but they are a cash o my establishment. I didn't have any cash on me. Their food may not be halal but their food is 10x's better. Not going back to Chan halals again... waste of my time and money. Now I'm sitting here hungry.
Love Portillo's, but this location doesn't cut it. Long wait for food at 2pm on a Wednesday with not much of a line, lost tickets a real cluster just watching them work.

Food isn't that good as it is, but there's so many things on the menu I just deal with it sometimes. I ordered from here last night pretty late, by the time I got my food they had either closed or there lazy employees didn't want to answer the phone... they did not include my ice cream or travs. Like I stated I tried calling, but no answer. With ice cream and missing travs not being on the top of my list I went to work this am and remembered to call when I got home. The lady hung up as soon as I told her i had an issue with an order, called back and she said she can't do anything about it because it's another day... we'll if you would have answered I wouldnt have this problem today, correct? She hung up again. I dont like to hate on people's businesses but after the rudeness idc, the building is "SUPER DIRTY", there food isn't good, and there employees are trash. I'll make sure to copy and post this everywhere I can. Whoever was working the phone today sounds like she needs to be a Walmart greeter.

I was not greeted when I walked in. The customer service was not the best, they got my order wrong, I asked for a certain type of noodle and they gave me the wrong kind, when I asked them to fix it they made me take out the noodles myself and put the new ones in. There was also a small spider on my table as well there was also a number of flys flying around me as I ate. But the food was exceptional.

Not happy with service or meal. I ordered Bayou Red fish with Crawfish etouffe topping. There was no etouffe sauce, just a cream sauce. I asked for green salad in place of potato salad. When bill came, i realized...I was charged for the green salad. The taste wasn't what I expected in New Orleans.

The $10 off $30 coupon you get after visiting TEN times? It expires supposedly within 8 days of receiving it (doesn't say that anywhere on the offer and no one told us until it was too late and the offer was expired). 

I don't know about you but that is terrible business to me. Never coming back for their overpriced, lukewarm food again.

If you're ordering from this place, you should probably be there in person when they make it. I ordered one of their bowls and was eventually told that they didn't exactly make it anymore, so rather than give it a quick google to find the recipe on their website (like I did) and get as close to the OG salad as they could, they Frankensteined a salad with lots of random, vaguely related ingredients and left out the protein and avocado - the only thing that would make this salad worth $10+. Despite this one bad experience, I'd give it a second shot if I could be there to order it. I've also heard this place runs out of ingredients pretty regularly, so watch out for that.

We have a very long wait for food and we had just ordered wings and a salad.  When the wings finally arrived, I waived off the salad.  I let the waitress know politely that we had waited a while for the food.  She got defensive and blamed me for not telling her that I wanted the salad sooner.  I tried to clarify by saying we waited awhile for all the food, but she just walked off.  I got the boneless grilled wings with the Glory sauce.  The wings had a heavy smoke flavor and the sauce we almost inedible.  It tasted like vinegar with some honey.  I ate two pieces and left the rest.  The other party with me had the regular buffalo hot wings and they were pretty tasty.  When walking out the floor was wet and littered with food while the staff stood at the front door chatting.  Sadly we won't be going back.

Was excited to check this place out with a friend I haven't seen in a while. First impression is that it's LOUD. Server recommend 2 beers (ordered the 4oz taster) when I said what I like. One was ok, the other tasted like fermented grapefruit juice (very unpleasant). However the absolute worst part was the food. I ordered the chicken verde tacos. The plate looked good, but the SALT level made these tacos literally inedible!!! Fortunately they removed the cost from my check, but I did sense some annoyance about it. Won't be returning after an overall bad experience. We left this place, took a walk around the corner to another bar on Cricket street where I had a nice beer, a decent sandwich, good service. a nice atmosphere, and a sighting of Jason Kelsey.

Wow what can I say this kfc Taco Bell combo is the worst. I wanted some tacos to take home and they had no beef what in the world. None of the tables were clean. The workers were yelling while they were working. Just a bad place to eat.

My friends and I waited an hour for our table, which was okay because it was a busy Sunday afternoon. We then proceeded to wait for an hour after ordering for our food to come out. All of the tables around us had already gotten their food even though they sat down way later than us. When we did get our food, half of the meals were cold, it had clearly been waiting for awhile. My friend had a hair in her kale Caesar salad. The steak on the steak sandwich was way over cooked. The manager came over to apologize for the wait but didn't offer a discount or anything.

Overall it was just not a good experience. The waitress felt bad, but again we still paid full price for everything.

My wife and I went to Mr. B's Bistro on the third day of our anniversary trip to New Orleans.  The restaurant was suggested by our hotel's concierge. All other restaurants before this that were booked by the concierge were great. This one was the last restaurant and I had high confidence that it would be just as great as others.  Unfortunately, we had to end, what was to that point an unforgettable trip, with a dud, thanks to this venue.

Let's start with Jazz.  We were sitting in the restaurant without any Jazz for an hour.  They were in some other parts of the restaurant.  When the band arrived it was a group that could not hold a candle to many performances on the streets of French Quarter.

Moving on to the food. The appetizers in the range of very good to bad. The duck rolls were very good. The oysters were pretty good too.  Their gumbo was terrible.  We had gumbo the day before and Commander's Palace and those two can't be compared.

From the main course, if you are not ordering their BBQ Shrimp, don't bother with anything else as you won't get it at all or it will arrive very late.  We had two tables around us that arrived after us.  They requested Shrimp and were done before our meals arrived.  I first ordered brisket with grits (Breakfast Bowl) and was informed later that they were out of it.  I ordered something else but 1.5 hours into sitting and waiting, our food never arrived. We were starting to run late to our flight and just ended up walking away.  No one really cared that we were leaving very unsatisfied. The manager talked to us and just shrugged.

With so many awesome dining options in NOLA, including Sunday Jazz brunches, I would stay away from this place.

Shrimp cocktail, ceviche, shrimp and octopus over salad....three dishes all share the same unfortunate characteristics... all three lacked any flavor whatsoever, void of any sense of freshness (canned seafood), and just not good.  

Please don't bother with this place.  Not good food at all.

I just want to say that I had been dying to try Pizzeria Vetri, one of the only restaurants in the fairmount/ callowhill area that we had yet to try. 
Yikes. Only time we've ever tipped 10% on a dinner because the service was SO BAD it didn't even deserve 10%. 

We called in on a Friday night around 8 p.m. and the girl that picked up the phone said that they could take our reservation and it would be an hour so she transferred me to this guy and hes like absolutely not you have to be here to put your name in...So right there is a lapse in restaurant direction. So we went to PV and they were like yeah it will be an hour so go to a bar or something and come back. We wanted to grab wine for the dinner anyways so went to the bar at whole foods and ordered 2 beers and i get a text immediately that our table is ready and that it would be only held for 10 minutes. I called asking since we were told it would be an hour and to go to a bar, that it could be held for around a half hour. He said no and that there was a large group behind us waiting for seating. We chugged our beers and ran to PV where we were shown two bar seats, so clearly not the seating needed for a large group that we had to rush to get back. 

We ordered appetizers (salad and meatballs) and one of the pizzas, and we were disappointed to see it all come out at once, not only did we feel rushed and didn't have any room at the bar top (the pizza was literally in front of the woman next to us at the bar, so I'm sure she was annoyed) but the pizza ended up getting cold by the time we finished our apps. The salad and meatballs were very good, and pizza would have been good if it wasn't so cold. Just a note that the couple to my right also asked for their pizza to be warmed up. 

While we were eating cold pizza and our water carafe was empty, and we tried looking for our waiter when we saw him in his jacket with his bag exiting for the night. No introduction to the individual that was going be taking over our service for the rest of the night. We sat there for the better part of a half hour just trying to find someone to pay attention to us to order dessert. Keep in mind, it is about 10 p.m. and there were only about 4 tables still at the restaurant eating! My boyfriend ended up having to wave his hands to flag a waiter down. The waiter said "you guys aren't getting enough love aren't you?" Um...rude? but you're right, we were not. We ordered cannolis (still didn't get our water) and by this point, we were waiting and waiting for someone to bring us our check. My boyfriend had to go up to the counter to have someone give us our check because we were just so annoyed with trying to flag someone down. 

Really just want to note that this was an unpleasurable experience, not to vent via yelp, but this should be a lesson as to why restaurants don't have customers return.
I'm sorry but eggs over easy is the most basic of breakfast items. You can't prepare them correctly for $17.50. Hollandaise sauce out of a package on eggs Benedict for $16.50. No thank you.

It's been 14 years since I've eatten at La Parrilla Suiza having fond memories of past expectations, cravings, and authentic Mexican cuisine!! Boy is it gonna be another 14 years till I grace this restaurant with my presents... despite the numerous healthy food violations I witness well keep this short and sweet on the count of service and food. And when I mean service I'm referring to lack there of. Now after nearly a 20 minute wait on our simple ice teas which i could have walked to Circle K for faster, it took nearly 2x that for our food order. The food then came out faster then the drinks we ordered???. Lastly when it came to a refill of tea I would have had a better chance refilling it from behind the bar or hostess stand then at my table. The food was average nothing to go home to tell your auntie about and I could have found more flavor in a late night carne asada burrito from Los betos then this place... I'm just glad they had the Diamondbacks game on to distract me from what I was eating. I'll be sticking to my west side go tos from now on #MosaicCafe #1

I use National all the time but today in St. Louis I waited at least 15 min for the shuttle, others were there before me and all waiting could not get on. I called to let them know and could not reach a person no matter what menu option I tried. Need faster shuttles, and definitely a way to reach the St. Louis airport rental location. Oh, and the rap music on the shuttle was a bonus

I have always enjoyed Raising Cane's and the customer service I received so you can image my excitement when I found out one was opening in NoCo St. Louis.  Unfortunately the customer service I've received from the Lindbergh location has been less than desirable.  I ordered food today and found that there was a missing item when I reached home. I quickly returned with my food and receipt and was met with an immediate attitude. There was no apology just an annoyed stare after providing me with my food.
There will soon be a Chic Fil la in our area, guess that will be my new fav if this is what I can expect from Raising Cane's

They were great when I first started going there (when they initially opened) and have seriously gone down hill. The girls at the front desk were so rude. The one was even paying more attention to her boyfriend than the other customers and myself as we were trying to check in and ask questions. The waxer was popping her bubble gum in my face and looked like a total slob. She also screwed up my eyebrows so bad that I have some serious growing in to do. I'll never go back to this EWC.
Service was extremely slow, we were there over an hour before our meals arrived.  Food was okay but definitely not worth waiting for that long.

Been going to the Bagel Bin off and on for years, even after I moved out of the area. Stopped by on way home about 1pm this Sunday and ordered a dozen bagels to take home to my family. When we got home, realized it was nothing like the Bagel Bin bagels -- they were clearly grocery store bagels being sold as bagel bin bagels.  I'm not sure if they totally stopped making bagels in the store altogether or if they just ran out and tried to make a few extras bucks. Either way, should be embarrassed and have more pride in their product.

The manager was so rude to my mother and kept having a go at her even though my mum told the lady she didn't want to talk. Also, when mum ordered the food on the phone to the manager, she kept interrupting mum even though she wasn't finished talking and when she got there to pick up the food the manger spoke to her in mocking tone and when mum asked if she wanted to start an argument the manger replied with yes I do. Do not go here the service which my mum received was not welcoming or comforting, they were aggressive and impolite and even decides to fight woh the customer. Certainly a behavior which my mum or any other customer deserve. I was so angry when I heard this from mum and will not be going to this restaurant ever again.

People are very nice but the food is not good. I had the eggs benedict and it came out undercooked. The portion was insanely small for price w only one egg and a few pieces of potato. My friend had the biscuit plate and the biscuit was absolutely awful- almost tasted fermented. The prosciutto was also questionably sour and possibly spoilt. I will say the pastry was out of this world. Stick to coffee and their baked goods (except biscuits). Cute atmosphere and space.

Me and my boyfriend were on a out of town trip this location was horrible well it was St.Pattys day and of course it was busy this place isn't supposed to close until 3am!!!! We got there around 11:30pm and walked in with a lobby full of people and no one was at the front to greet us. You basically had to seat yourself and fight for a table. Well finally got a table that was dirty waitress came and got the dirty plates and didn't even wipe it down. Then told us you can only order appetizers or pizza. So we said ok. My boyfriend ordered a beer I ordered water. She brought my water but didn't bring his beer. Then we were ready to order we tried to order two appetizers and a Sicilian pan pizza which this pizza takes 45 min to make the waitress stated that the food was a hour plus behind. SHE told me in a rude way you can't order that pizza it takes to long and we are closing at 3! And the kitchen is shutting down but I looked at the clock and it was maybe close to 12am. Then my boyfriend asked about his beer he hadn't got 20 min later she told him rudely well you're going to have to WAIT!!!! VERY RUDE PLACE I wanted to try it out I have heard so many great things about but they left a bad taste in my mouth. We went down the street to hooters and got served with food and drinks and they were closing at 1am. Maybe another location is better. Definitely not downtown

I'd love to feel better about coming for a meal someday because we hear good things about the food, but I can't get out of my head my first experience going in there. A year or 2 ago  I simply came in to locate a menu to either look at or to take home.  I looked around to locate the menu and saw 5-6 pretty female employees standing over to my left.  They were not far from me.  They continued to talk during this time.  Not ONE of them looked up at me, and no one from there or anywhere came forward to welcome me, or ask what they could do for me or if I would be eating.  I felt uncomfortable.  It was NOT crowded.  Is this an overly picky criticism?   I really don't think so.  To me it spoke in volumes a non customer service attitude. Thank you for reading this comment.

Well let me start by saying i was very excited to go back to The Twisted Tail for dinner. Last week when we ate brunch it was excellent I had not one complaint. This past Saturday we decided to go to Philly because we were going to the Beer Garden, so we decided to try The Twisted Tail for dinner since we had a great experience for brunch. I was not as happy with the dinner menu compared to the brunch menu. I ordered the hanger steak medium it was okay it came out medium well , my wife ordered the shrimp and grits but the shirmp were more like prongs. Which if she'd known that she would have not have ordered because she doesn't like that. As we're sitting at our table in the corner I look up at the wall and was very turned off by the noticed of large chunks of just dust all over the walls. To me that was a complete turn-off. I would think as a restaurant serving food certain things would be dusted and cleaned. It just seemed like it was in complete different experience from the brunch that we had a week before.

Atmosphere is cool, Food is not great , service is terrible. I wont be back, and would strongly recommend you avoid it as well. 
We waited to be set down, then waited to get our drinks, only one refill the entire 2 hours we were here, then we ordered and they forgot to put my food in and said it would be at least 10 more minutes before mine came. My husband ordered pick 2, I said "would bbq be faster" they said yes and quickly brought a pick two like his.. not only did we not get an apology from a manager, they charged me for both meats. Then we waited for our check.. service was so slow. It took us a few hours for something that should've taken at most an hour. 
The restaurant was not very busy, and there just wasn't an excuse for such bad service and lack of trying to make up for this.
Sorry Blake but your service sucks! Went to the roof top bar and couldn't even get waited on. Even asking for a server no one came over. Disappointed

I really really wanted to like this place after the good reviews triggered all my childhood memories of eating raw cooking dough and hoping I didn't get sick from the eggs lol.  The location was a pain to find via my GPS, but once I found it the place is very cute.  The service was very friendly and the prices weren't bad, but the dough was disappointing.  Some of the flavors were blander than I expected and the texture was just weird.  Kind of gritty and not the creamy melt in your mouth feel that I craved.  Maybe it'd be better topped with ice cream or actually baked, but I doubt I'll give this place another try.
